title: Regional Manager - Education
description:
Our client provides curriculum products to International schools and is looking for a dynamic Regional Manager to join their team. The primary role of the Regional Manager will be to secure growth for their region through effective business development, sales management and school support for various curriculum programmes. This role will cover the MENA and South Asia areas. The ideal candidate must, therefore, be willing to travel. The role will be based out of offices in the UAE. The role is a mix of Business Development, Sales Management and Membership support. Business Development·Deliver high-level presentations to key global and regional stakeholders·Serve as an ambassador for existing and prospective partners to visit schools to observe our curriculum programmes in action·Employ a consultative approach to build, maintain & strengthen relationships ·Attend events to exhibit and showcase the products ·Responsible for working with the BD team to support the development of sales leads in the region.·Work closely with the BD and finance and other internal teams to facilitate various types of partner arrangements leading to final deal execution·Assist in exploring new partnership models and distribution channels·Develop in-depth understanding of local territory, including appropriate contacts and partnersSales Management·Own a revenue goal set ·Responding and converting incoming leads and develop/deliver appropriate plans for specific opportunities·Use the Salesforce CRM product effectively to support lifecycle sales activities·Use salesforce data appropriately to support future sales·Accountability for ensuring that outstanding orders convert into paid invoices.Member Support·Supporting schools that have bought programmes and membership.·Working to connect members schools with each other and sharing best practice·Supporting schools with ad hoc administrative tasks or to organise professional development as required by the schools·Working with the Membership and Professional Learning team to deliver high quality supportDevelop strong relationship with current schools, to support pre-sales activities for new clientCandidate ProfileEducated to degree level with, ideally some sort of sales experience and/or training. 5-10 years experience in the education sector Experience of converting leads into agreed targetsExperience of providing training in the school system, desirable.

title: Project Financial Controller
description:
Our client is an award-winning, privately owned, property acquisition and development management company. Partnering with a variety of investors and highly-regarded architects and consultants, the company is behind some of London’s most prestigious residential and mixed-use development projects.
The company now seeks to employ a Project Financial Controller to provide finance leadership and management to development projects.
You will report to the company Finance Director (FD), and will play a critical role in leading projects and driving commercial success, supporting the Project Development Manager (PDM). In addition to providing full traditional accounting, reporting, treasury, taxation and controls support to the project, you will develop a complete commercial and contractual understanding of the project, and compile and maintain the Project Business Plan.
You will develop key project performance indicators (e.g. hurdle return based Internal Rate of Return), and ensure the PDM and the project team are fully advised of progress against, and of risks to, the plan achievement. You will report regularly to the Board, alongside the PDM, on project performance, and interface, along with the PDM and the FD, with external partners and investors.
You will assist in the negotiation of project contracts, and ensure these are incorporated into and are consistent with the project plan.
This is a highly dynamic role, requiring more than the traditional Controller skill-set. It will require the application of commercial acumen, effective relationship management and communication skills, a willingness to challenge and be challenged, and solid teamwork. At the same time it is highly hands-on and detail-focused.
You will:

Hold a CCAB qualification with some PQE
Have strong practical financial controller skills and transactional understanding
Have demonstrable understanding of planning and working on projects
Have had exposure to commercial negotiation and bottom-line focus
Be an effective communicator to varied and senior audiences
Be analytical, detail-focused, and regularly use Excel to an advanced level, with demonstrable experience of financial modelling

recognised across the world.LANGUAGES Fluent in English and ideally also fluent in either French or SpanishLOCATION Based in Exeter + frequent travel to the international territories of Australasia, East, they wish to recruit an International sales Account Manager, ideally fluent also in either French or Spanish.Your role as International Export sales Account Manager will include the following channelsProvide feedback to internal departments such as Customer Services, Marketing, Purchasing, Production and Warehouse to aid ongoing territory growthCANDIDATE EXPERIENCE / SKILLSFluency in to work on own initiativeBe able to persuade and influence, and be assertiveBe proactive with an awareness of business needsBe able to adapt during sales presentations if the meeting changes from the year) with a full (ideally clean) driving licenceSALARY On offer is an excellent basic salary + commissionTo be considered for this excellent opportunity as French or Spanish speaking International Travelodge has an exciting opportunity for a Hotel Manager to join the team covering the Essex and Kent regions. You will be on a full time permanent basis and receive a highly competitive salary of £25,000 to £30,000 per annum.This is an excellent opportunity to join a fast paced, expanding company as a Hotel Manager. As a consequence of business growth and new site openings, we are seeking strong Hotel Managers to support across our Essex and Kent regions, therefore the successful candidate will need to have flexibility to travel and work across these areas.You will be rewarded with a competitive salary, benefits and financial support when travelling across the districts. The role will involve supporting key hotels during times of need and will lead to a single site Hotel Manager position in a suitable location for the successful candidate.The job in a nutshellAs a Hotel Manager your job is to make sure that our customers and colleagues are kept safe at all times. Our Hotel Managers ensure that our customers have such a great stay that they want to return. As a people leader you will ensure that your team is motivated, engaged and see Travelodge as a great place to work. As with any role, delivering results is essential.What you will be doing as our Hotel Manager- Delivering fantastic service so customers have a great stay and want to return- Review customer feedback and insight reports to create action plans that will improve the customer experience- Delivering food and beverage services to brand standards- Pre-empting any problems that may occur and put permanent fixes in place- When problems do occur take ownership to resolve problems and empower the team to do the same- Ensuring the hotel is safe and secure putting the health and safety of colleagues and customers at the forefront of what you doWhat we’ll expect from our Hotel ManagerTo succeed in this role, you will need to be a strong leader and passionate about customer service. Engaging and developing people to deliver results should come naturally and you will need to be dedicated, organised and results focussed to succeed in this role.Exposure to managing large teams in a complex, high volume environment. You will have natural gravitas and personal impact and able to manage senior stakeholders across the business.What you can expect from usCultureAt Travelodge, we are warm, straightforward and optimistic. We have a big footprint in the UK, but still a small company feel and you can expect quality and value to be built in to everything we do. Every day is different here and you definitely see life! We want you to bring your personality to work and we love our diversity.Reward and recognitionYou will earn a competitive salary and be entered in the hotel bonus scheme. You can also expect to enjoy generous room and food discounts, as well as friends and family rates. We are committed to recognising a job well done and commitment to quality is rewarded.Career and developmentYou can expect full training in your role with a detailed induction programme on joining the company. Career progression is encouraged whether that be to larger, more complex hotels or into support centre roles.If you feel you are the right candidate for the role as our Hotel Manager then please click ‘apply’ now! We’d love to hear from you!


Contact: Travelodge
        

Reference: Totaljobs/CCDartHM1705

description:

Charteris Consultancy are working alongside an established business consultancy and engineering business who focus on innovative delivery solutions to the Energy & Utilities sectors. This company have a global presence and are expanding further to new geographies. With ambitious growth plans they are working with us to identify for their Business Transformation unit a Head of Operational Excellence. As a business they are looking for credible, accomplished and ambitious leaders to be part of the fastest growing Energy & Utilities conglomerate. They want high calibre leaders with radical thinking capabilities who are well networked in industry to drive their business growth. If you are passionate about building high performance teams that create unique solutions for customers, hungry to take up challenging roles, able to demonstrate sound financial acumen, a proven business building track record, and the ability to manage large teams this could be the role for you. Responsibilities §Lead the Operational Excellence division to deliver engagements in: Productivity & Utilisation improvement, Flexible Shift Working, Accountability Enhancement, Line-of-sight implementation, Operational Performance Management, Excellence in Work & Asset Management, etc. §Build new offerings for the Operational Excellence Division, with specific focus on UK§Build on the current practice to a high growth division§Open at least 3 new accounts in FY17§Generate one IP by FY20, related to Ops Excellence§Work with the Business Development teams to win new business §Innovate path breaking ideas and conduct research to paradigm shift in the way Energy & Water sector Operations are conducted in offices and in field §Collaborate with research institutes and build partnerships with the thought leaders in the industry§Manage the team, develop the offering and plan for additional capability building§Establish thought leadership and build the company’s image in UK Energy & Water sectorEssential experience§You will have a track record of leading, constructing and winning £20+ mil transformation programmes§Experience of building an Operations focussed Consulting practice§Utility C level relationships/references§Pre-sales/deal orchestration experience§Productivity & Utilisation improvement§Operational Performance Management§Excellence in Work & Asset ManagementDesirable Experience§Knowledge of Utilities industry§Transformation Leadership experience§Awareness of latest developments and trends in Field Operations, Mobile Workforce, etc.§Good knowledge of Asset Management, ISO 55001, RCM, Asset Analytics, etc.§Good knowledge of solutions for Productivity and Utilisation improvement§Track record of presenting to Executive or Shareholder Boards§Experience of Transformation delivery§Ability to create new and innovative commercial models §Lead commercial negotiations and contracts

title: Buyer (m/f)
description:
Company description:Basic qualifications: •Completion of state-required secondary education; a formal business administration or procurement qualification will also be required,•You’re a great communicator, both verbally and in writing: you’re always clear and precise when interacting with others,•You’re proficient in ERP systems, such as SAP, Oracle, Coupa, in the context of a large organisation,•Previous experience in procurement and purchasing, including supplier relationship management,•Previous experience in a fast-paced and dynamic international working environment,•Solid computer literacy, particularly in Oracle and Coupa, as well as Microsoft Excel. Preferred qualifications and characteristics: •Previous contract and price negotiation experience would be advantageous,•Previous experience in vendor management,Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.Amazon takes your personal data protection seriously and respects EU and local data protection laws. Unless you express otherwise, by submitting your CV you authorize the hiring Amazon company to store your personal data in the electronic database maintained by Amazon Corporate LLC. in the USA or one of its affiliates for the purpose of assessing your suitability for this and future job vacancies and to pursue your recruiting process.If at any time you want your personal data to be deleted, you simply need to notify the hiring Amazon company. Amazon will not share your personal data with any third party without your prior consent. As part of your interview process with Amazon you may be asked to authorize the hiring Amazon company to separately verify your application data and personal background through a third party service provider. Job description:We are Amazon; we pioneer. We are also going through an exciting period of growth.That’s precisely why we’re seeking a Buyer to join our busy Fulfillment & Operations, at the heart of which you’ll find our Fulfillment Centers (FCs).These state of the art facilities sit at the core of the entire business: they are where we manage our fast-moving inventory, fulfill hundreds of thousands of orders each day, and exceed customer expectations. Given their size and scale, they’re also where we need sharp minds keeping an eye on Amazon’s item inventory, purse strings and supply chain.We’ll need you to provide holistic, functional support to your Fulfillment Center Procurement Manager-your line manager-with all aspects of Procurement. This includes securing a constant flow of packaging and non-inventory goods and services; we’ll need you to ensure everything is supplied at the best possible value to the business, on a daily basis. Required profile:Function-specific responsibilities: •Assist with the daily forecast and effective materials management of all non-inventory packaging supplies,•Execute purchase order creation based on internal requests,•Liaise with suppliers to negotiate and secure best value for money deals on a full range of non-inventory goods and services,•Build effective stakeholder relationships, ensuring a high level service regarding quotations and lead-times,•Work in full compliance with the company Spending and Transaction policy, educating and driving the expected and correct behaviors of business stakeholders,•Manage and drive down the number of invoices on hold (IOH), ensuring a robust and fluid procure-to-pay process,•Drive effective delivery of the Fulfillment Center procurement metrics, by leading &/or supporting projects and initiatives;•You’ll need to implement root cause analysis, as you identify any issues, their possible causes, as well as the necessary corrective actions,•Support the use of Kaizen methodologies throughout your Fulfillment Center, as well as other methods of continuous project improvement.What we offer:Your high-level mission and key performance indicators: •Functioning as part of a close-knit team, you’ll assist with driving cost reduction and improved overall services, for greater efficiencies and economies of scale,•Assertively advocate the value of smart procurement, to create alignment with and buy-in from your internal stakeholders,•Assist with the analysis of spending patterns, to help you identify a range of savings opportunities,•Delivery of Fulfillment Center Procurement and packaging metrics, in-line with set targets,•Achieving annual cost saving targets for your Fulfillment Center,•Ensuring that no Fulfillment Center materials run out of stock, as well as preventing service supply issues.


Contact: Claire Mastelli
        

Reference: Totaljobs/18321

title: Regional Ops Manager
description:

There head office is in Peterborough where you would need to visit once fortnight or you can meet your manage out on the road for 121'sYou will need to hold a full driving licence,have previous experience in a field -based role. Millar Cameron are a recruitment consultancy operating across Europe and Emerging Markets. The Real Estate team are looking for a Business Security Manager to work for a technology firm across the Central Europe region based in Gdansk, Poland.The purpose of this job is for supporting security operations, safety and business continuity programmes and to drive the development and standardisation of security policies that protect the client’s corporate business continuity programmes. Key Duties & Responsibilities:•Facilitate, coordinated and manage the creation and execution of security action plans including business continuity management (BCM), Business Impact Analysis (BIA), crisis management, travel security plans and incident response. •Support daily security operations to include guard management, alarm response and event management.•Manage third party security contractors ensuring they are effective.•Conduct security threat and risk assessments and consult with the client Corporate Security team to deploy mitigating security measures to monitor the identified security threats/risks. •Work closely with the various operations and HR teams to create and implement security awareness programs. •Develop and manage standard operating procedures for the design, configuration and implementation of physical security systems for both people protection and the effective storage and management of property. •Continuously review, implement and maintain effective security policies, procedures and practices.•Understand using metrics to improve performance, establish and implement effective, predictable and measurable procedures/processes that can be communicated clearly among stakeholders.•Conduct investigations, audits, special event coordination and other safety, security or business continuity efforts as business conditions warrant.•Work with management to create a security conscious culture. •Monitor the security environment and take proactive measures to minimize the impact of adverse changes on all client business location within the South Africa area of responsibility. •Provide timely security advice based on assessment of security risks and threats to inform business decisions.Key Skills and Characteristics:•At least 5 ¬years’ experience in a managerial role in the Security and Business Continuity Industry •Understand employment legislation regarding the provision of security staff in South Africa.•Experience of dealing with information and intelligence, interpreting security threats and risks and management of investigations.•Experience managing service providers and vendors and currently possesses, or has the ability to develop, a network of key stakeholders and service providers in South Africa.•Appropriate knowledge of current security technology.•Degree educated and professional qualifications are preferred.


Contact: Hamish Scragg
        

Reference: Totaljobs

Recruitment ConsultantHours: 8am-5.30pm, Monday to Friday (1 hour lunch)Salary: Basic £20,000 - £25,000 dependent on experience with a realistic OTE of £35,000 to £40,000. 10% - 12.5% bonus on all billing, NO THRESHOLDS AND UNCAPPED!!This Is A Recruitment And NOT A Sales Focused Role!HEADS has a proven track record of organic talent development. 100% of the Management Team started as Recruitment Consultants / Account Managers. The company has achieved 13.8% compound average growth for the last 5-years resulting in sales of £54 million to 200+ Supply Chain Clients operating in Manufacturing, Warehousing, Logistics and Customer Support.These results, our people, values and reputation have led to HEADS being recently acquired by Proman (1.3 Billion Euro Sales in 2016). Proman are also a family run business which has helped the two cultures merge harmoniously and allows for a relaxed and supportive environment.With Proman’s backing, HEADS is now embarking on a programme of significant UK expansion over the next 5-years so we are looking to add 2 experienced consultants to expand our existing operations in the Yorkshire region.Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:You will come on to a hot desk with live vacancies ready to work on and an established client base. You will be responsible for your own geographical area with anonymity to grow and develop this as you please. Your main roles and responsibilities will include…Speaking with clients to gain a full brief on vacancies so that you fully understand the duties of the role, the skills required to fulfil this role and the right character and culture fit for the organisation.Create and post professional and appealing job adverts in order to attract suitable candidates.Search internal and external databases in order to find suitable candidates which match your client requirements.Interview and assess candidates against your clients requirements ensuring candidates are not only suitable but also interested in the role.Work closely with your clients and candidates ensuring they are fully up to speed with the progress of the vacancy.Marketing of good candidates to companies to ensure the growth and development of your client base.Maintain regular contact with existing and lapsed clients to ensure you are aware of new and future recruitment opportunities.Regularly updating the CRM and candidate database to comply with ISO9001.The CandidateIdeally you will have experience of working within the manufacturing, engineering or warehousing sectors although other sector experience will be considered. Experience will include... Must have a good level of education and a professional mannerMust be competitive and looking to progress your careerMust be able to work at a fast pace across multiple vacanciesExcellent telephone manner and exceptional customer service skillsAbility to build rapport with clients and candidates alikeExperience of winning and developing new businessExperience of working with clients in the North West or Yorkshire would be highly beneficialA good knowledge of modern recruitment techniques and technologies

title: UK Alliances Director – Robotics/Analytics/IT Software
description:
My client is a global organisation, quoted on the NASDAQ with an annual revenue in excess of $1.3 billion with over 3,700 employees worldwide and approximately 500 in the UK & Ireland. They specialise in integrating real-time interaction management, advanced analytics and employee engagement tools to deliver faster, smarter and safer customer engagements, and to get major brands closer to their customers. They help major brands to understand, predict and adapt to customers’ needs in real time so that they can create tailored experiences that go beyond what customers expect. Their product suite is impressive covering sales and service optimisation, handle time optimisation, call volume reduction, back office, fraud prevention, workforce optimisation, analytics (speech, text, structured & un-structured data) and Robotic Process Automation (RPA).
They are well positioned to continue their growth in the marketplace for sophisticated software applications and services. Significant customers in the UK & Ireland include major brands in Telecommunications, Financial Services, Insurance, Utilities and Public Sector with thousands of users.  
The EMEA region constitutes around 30% of my client’s business. The EMEA region comprises five sub-regions: UK & Ireland, Western & Southern Europe, DACH (Germany, Austria, Switzerland)  Middle East/Africa and the Eastern Europe.  EMEA generates around $130m revenue through sales of the Enterprise portfolio of software, consulting and professional services.
My client is seeking a London based Partner/Alliance Director to lead UK level relationships with The Big 4 Advisory firms (PWC, KPMG, EY & Deloitte) and global System Integration (SI) firms (Accenture, IBM GBS, Atos, CGI, Tata, Wipro, DXC, Capgemini etc.) The role is measured on closing new business with these leading advisory and SI firms in The UK with a strategy to then take this to these firms across all of EMEA.
Annual sales target is negotiable but anything from $4m to $10m per annum is the expectation. This role will also have some management responsibility. There are currently 12 dedicated sales people in The UK.
The ideal candidate will have the following:

Good experience managing relationships with the Big 4 Advisory Firms and global System Integrators based in The UK
Minimum of  $4m sales per annum to UK firms (“Hunter” type skills) consistently over the last 3 years Experience working for a software vendor managing alliances and sales with The Big 4 and SI firms, or vice-versa, where you have worked for directly for The Big 4 and SI firms and managed alliances and partnerships with IT software vendors
A good understanding of Technology and Software. Knowledge of RPA or Analytics is desirable but not essential as “tech savvy” candidates can learn thi
The ability to sell and close the deal is important.
Both hunter and farming skills are required. Drive, passion, high energy and engaging personality is a must.

In order to apply for these roles, please email  a word version CV and cover letter explaining why you are suitable. Alternatively, please call Rakesh Pabbi on 0780 1179671 for a confidential discussion. Rakesh is a previous management consultant in Technology (SAP and Oracle) from PwC & KPMG Consulting.
Consulting Point Search is a multi-award winning talent advisory and search firm, headquartered in the UK, with a global presence and network. We have specialised in management consultancy since 2003 and operate across all industry verticals and services lines. The firm was founded by ‘Big 4’ management consultants to combine industry experience with talent acquisition and search excellence. We work on assignments for leading strategy houses, Big 4, specialist consultancies, private equity firms and internal consulting divisions within major firms across the globe, recruiting permanent and interim staff at all levels from analyst to global partners and C-level executives. 
We have attained industry recognition including being voted “Top management consultancy recruitment firm” in 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017 and acknowledged as having the greatest candidate reach in management consultancy of any UK based firm.  
 
NB: Consulting Point Search is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

Our client is one of hte leading Retail and Hospitality brands in the UK. They are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Head of Decision Support to join them.

Quantitative research techniques, in particular ability to manage and interpret large data sets

Scenario analysis

Self-motivated to make a difference

A commitment & passion for learning & development

title: Principal Consultant - Business Development for Consulting Services Firm
description:
Our client is a leading global network of independent management consultants.  Those in their network come from top tier global consulting firms and have chosen to operate independently.  They work with our clients to provide flexible, high quality consulting resource to address key business challenges.
Role
This role will be responsible for the development of a new market and lead the client development, relationship management and delivery of projects as well as broader work in networking, network development, events, marketing and being a key part of a growing team.  In summary, the role will involve:

Building a sales approach and strategy to take the Connect offering to market
Meeting with senior stakeholders across multiple organisations to build long term relationships through delivery of innovative solutions
Building internal relationships across the Odgers group to access wide client relationships
Pitching and selling to potential clients
Ongoing management of client accounts
Designing and implementing events for clients and consultant network alike through collaboration with central events team
Building relationships with consultants across our network
Developing a relationship within set industries as the expert in your field
Working with Associates to deliver a consistent revenue stream through delivering projects
Working with the Managing Partner to achieve sales targets

Person
This role requires an intelligent, sales focused approach and will appeal to those who enjoy being in fast paced environments and work well with ambiguity and thrive in a self-starting role.  Prospective candidates might come from Consulting, Executive Search, Contingent Recruitment or other solution sales backgrounds.  A target driven, positive outlook is essential as is an ambition to shape the way consulting resource is delivered to a global client base.
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:TC001NB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Interim Service Director of Assurance
description:
Interim Service Director of Assurance
        








, UK


£650 per day












Contract


Posted 21 days ago



























Interim Service Director of Assurance £650 per day 6 months Local Government My Client requires an Interim Service Director of Assurance post elections. This role is politically sensitive and would require a strong consultant with a proven track record of supporting the Corporate Leadership Team through a transition period.The role will encompass setting and delivering the service strategy across the council.To develop and lead an assurance service for the Council and to ensure that the Council has a democratic process which ensures well informed legally sound decisions.To act as the Council’s Monitoring Officer. To support or lead the development and delivery of corporate objectives as part of the Corporate Leadership Team.To develop emerging models of governance to deal with and facilitate devolution of powers and responsibilities from Government to the Council and from the Council to local bodies such as Parish and Town Councils and community groups. Key Accountabilities for the post holder include but are not limited to:Contribute strategically at an organisational wide level through being a member of the Directorate Leadership Team and Council Leadership Team.Ensure the delivery of the Council’s Monitoring Officer role and functions pursuant to section 5 of the Local Government and Housing Act 1989 and as such to be responsible and accountable for ensuring the legality of proposals and decisions and that overall governance arrangements are in place which encourage high levels of probity and ethical standards.To lead a proactive Internal Audit Service that adds value to the Council and provides sound assurance to the Chief Operating Officer & s.151 Officer, Chief Executive and External Audit on the internal control processes and systems of the Council.To oversee the exercising of the Council’s democratic functions ensuring they are fit for purpose in a modern unitary Council and the changing environment of devolution and the national and European context.Act as principal advisor on all relevant functional areas for the role including providing advice at Council, the Cabinet and Committee meetings and representing the Council on partnership and external bodies.To deliver regular assurance reports to the Chief Operating Officer & s.151 Officer and Chief Executive highlighting issues and concerns in relation to the internal controls and governance of the Council.Develop collaborative relationships with internal and external partners to ensure optimal outcomes for residentsWork with Corporate Leadership team colleagues to lead, develop or deliver cross-cutting corporate projects or prioritiesProvide strategic leadership and management of the service, role modelling behaviours, motivating senior managers and holding them to account for performanceContribute to the budget setting process for the serviceEnsure adherence to the Council’s financial regulations, that spend is within agreed budgets and savings are delivered in line with the Medium Term Financial StrategyInformation security and governance: Manage information in line with the Council’s policies, procedures and guidance on subjects such as Data Protection, Freedom of Information, confidentiality, information security and sharing, the information lifecycle and data quality, to ensure compliance and efficient and effective information governanceSafeguarding: Maintain awareness of Council policies and practices regarding the safeguarding of children, young people and/ or adults who may be at risk. Report concerns/ allegations in accordance with corporate guidance and proceduresRequired elements for the successful consultant:Relevant degree level qualification or equivalent and evidence of continuous professional developmentSuccessful and consistent achievement in the leadership of relevant functions at senior management level, within a local authority or other organisation of comparable scope and complexityAbility to articulate a clear vision and strategy for the service and how to improve and transform outcomes, and experience of translating policy and strategy into tangible outcomes for the benefit of customers/ residentsA proven record of successful change management, delivering new working policies and practices alongside significant cultural and structural changeProven experience of financial management including budget formulation, financial planning, monitoring and control, within tight financial limits in a complex organisationDemonstrates an up to date knowledge and understanding of the law, government policy and best practice in relation to the functions provided within the serviceSignificant experience of giving advice to and building relationships with elected members and/or Board Members at the highest levelTo be considered for the role, or to arrange an initial, non-committal and confidential discussion, please contact Sian Breward, Associate Director at Baltimore Consulting Group


Contact: Sian Breward
        

Reference: Totaljobs/sbjun17sda

title: Senior/Principal Project Manager - Defence Sector
description:
Our team provides project management services to a variety of clients within the Defence Sector covering the whole of the UK and within a range of overseas locations.Our team is expanding due to business growth and opportunities exist for experienced Project Managers across a number of UK locations. You will have the opportunity to work challenging, large scale projects within the Defence Sector.Your RoleYou will need to be able to forge strong working relationships with our clients and be part of their integrated project teams. You will be working on a range of projects, mainly in the Defence sector, where the portfolio of exciting development opportunities range from small scale project to those in excess of £100m, from feasibility/assessment stage to completion/use.About YouYou will have full membership of a recognised professional body or committed to achieving full membership (e.g. MAPM or MRICS) and preferably an industry recognised professional qualification in Project Management.You will bring to the team a sound knowledge and proven experience to assist in guiding and developing Project Management best practice and innovation. You will deliver a contemporary Project Management service focused on client satisfaction.You will provide an efficient, collaborative, well governed service using modern management techniques to deliver our projects successfully. You will be experienced in working on major projects and have a demonstrable track record of a high standard of technical delivery.You will also be experienced in managing both internal and external project teams. WYG provide most if not all technical services in the built and natural environments, and multi-disciplinary projects can involve many different disciplines across a wide range of projects and client organisation types.To be part of this diverse team you will have well developed communication and interpersonal skills, with the capacity to build strong working relationships at all levels. You will be a strategic thinker with the ability to convey your ideas both verbally and in report form to Client, external stakeholders and the design team and you will have the ability to adapt strategies in line with changing priorities.About WYGWe’re an international, award-winning, multidisciplinary consultancy, delivering creative solutions to some of the world’s most challenging projects. We’re confident in our abilities, authentic in the advice we give, imaginative in our thinking and resourceful in how we turn our ideas into reality. But most of all, we’re a people business. Our success is down to people like you.RewardsA rewarding future is yours at WYG. We’re committed to supporting your personal aspirations - and with clear career paths and a wide range of opportunities, your goals will always be within reach. Our blended learning experience will help you develop all the skills and qualifications you need to succeed. Fantastic flexible benefits and personalised rewards make up an excellent package.


Contact: Elanor Currin
        

Reference: Totaljobs/11532

title: Project Support and Researcher Role - Full or Part-time
description:
An excellent flexible opportunity has become available in our expanding aviation consultancy. Our business focuses on air traffic management and airports, and currently employs around of 50 people (www.askhelios.com)The successful applicant will be act as Project Support and Researcher for one of our key European clients. They will work at the heart of a team of around ten people. For the ambitious candidate the role could involve significant European travel. We are also happy to consider part-time options that suit the successful applicant.Responsibilities will include:Organising meetings for industry stakeholdersAttending meetings and writing detailed minutesResponding to stakeholder emailsResearching new topics and contributing to technical papersProof-reading and maintaining documentation in good orderUploading and managing documents on a web-based content management systemThe successful applicant will have a degree (or equivalent experience) and a background in project support or as a researcher. The post will suit a highly organised and methodical individual with a good eye for detail and excellent communication skills (both verbal and written). An interest in aviation, conversational French and experience with SharePoint are all advantages. Some European travel may be required. Apply by CV and cover letter specifying whether you'd like to apply for a full time or part-time role.Closing Date - 21st June 2017Interviews will be held on 3rd July 2017.

, UK

  NES Global Talent is currently working with an innovative new company in the field of carbon dioxide recovery technology. Our client has developed breakthrough technology that is revolutionising the way that large scale polluters like power stations and chemical plants are managing their CO2 emissions and converting it reusable products. We are currently looking for an interim contract manager to support the company’s growth and streamline their current licensing contract process internally. The majority of these contracts will be for projects in the UK, US, Brazil and Germany. We are looking to speak with experience contract specialists with previous experience of complex engineering contracts between £300K and £500K in value. These contracts will relate to licensing of new technology and retrofit engineering work.  Key requirements: Extensive experience in Renewable or Clean Energy engineering contract procedures*Experience with engineering contracts between £300K – £500KExposure to UK, US, Brazil and German engineering marketsExposure to engineering licensing agreements for new technology *Power generation or chemical manufacturing could also be considered This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced contract manager to work as part of a forward thinking and innovative company in the clean energy sector.  This contract can be considered as a home based position or working from the clients offices. Established in 1978, NES Global Talent provides a complete range of contract and permanent talent solutions to the Oil and Gas, Power, Construction and Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Manufacturing and IT sectors worldwide. With more than 40 offices in 28 countries, we are able to provide our clients with the engineering and technical expertise they need, wherever and whenever it is needed. Offering far more than a traditional recruitment service, we fully support our contractors while they are on assignment with everything from securing visas and work permits, to providing market leading benefits packages and accommodation, ensuring they are safely and compliantly able to support our clients.

title: Financial Controller
description:
Robert Half Finance and Accounting are currently partnering with a leading global consultancy who are looking to recruit an accomplished and ambitious Financial Controller to join their growing business. This company specialises in providing consultancy services to some of the most prestigious international brands from both the FTSE100 and Nasdaq. This is an exceptional opportunity to join a rapidly, global expanding business in a senior finance role and benefit from vast international exposure and rapid career progression.The role:·Management of purchase ledger including posting of invoices, planning creditor payments and payment of invoices; Management of Commercial accountantCredit control assistance to Commercial accountant where required Preparation of quarterly UK VAT returns and bi-monthly Republic of Ireland VAT returns; Overall day to day management of the finance department; To develop and oversee the daily financial operations and controlsAssist the FD in implementing new financial controls and systems;Assist the FD in the scoping and management of change projects within the finance department;Assist in the transition of the transaction ledger from a single entity to multi- entity and ensure staff are fully trained in the requirements of the new system;Manage the month end close process and ensure that management accounts are produced in a timely and accurate fashion;Month end balance sheet reconciliations;Management of intercompany accounts including monthly reconciliations;Assistance in the production of year-end stat accounts;Participation in the year-end audit process;Assistance in the preparation of financial plans and budgetsAny other ad hoc tasks as at time to time requested by the CEO or FD.Your profile:-Qualified ACCA/ CIMA/ ACA Strong hands-on financial accounting and management accounting experience SME experience would be advantageous -Ability to work in a growth environmentAble to manage stakeholders at a senior level ProgressionThis company is growing rapidly and they are looking for an ambitious individual to join the business and with that will facilitate fast career progression.MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE IN A MANAGEMENT CONSULTANCY ENVIRONMENTSalary£55-65,000 plus bonus and benefits Location Central LondonRobert Half Ltd acts as an employment business for temporary positions and an employment agency for permanent positions. title: Senior/Principal Project Manager - Defence Sector
description:
Our team provides project management services to a variety of clients within the Defence Sector covering the whole of the UK and within a range of overseas locations.Our team is expanding due to business growth and opportunities exist for experienced Project Managers across a number of UK locations. You will have the opportunity to work challenging, large scale projects within the Defence Sector.Your RoleYou will need to be able to forge strong working relationships with our clients and be part of their integrated project teams. You will be working on a range of projects, mainly in the Defence sector, where the portfolio of exciting development opportunities range from small scale project to those in excess of £100m, from feasibility/assessment stage to completion/use.About YouYou will have full membership of a recognised professional body or committed to achieving full membership (e.g. MAPM or MRICS) and preferably an industry recognised professional qualification in Project Management.You will bring to the team a sound knowledge and proven experience to assist in guiding and developing Project Management best practice and innovation. You will deliver a contemporary Project Management service focused on client satisfaction.You will provide an efficient, collaborative, well governed service using modern management techniques to deliver our projects successfully. You will be experienced in working on major projects and have a demonstrable track record of a high standard of technical delivery.You will also be experienced in managing both internal and external project teams. WYG provide most if not all technical services in the built and natural environments, and multi-disciplinary projects can involve many different disciplines across a wide range of projects and client organisation types.To be part of this diverse team you will have well developed communication and interpersonal skills, with the capacity to build strong working relationships at all levels. You will be a strategic thinker with the ability to convey your ideas both verbally and in report form to Client, external stakeholders and the design team and you will have the ability to adapt strategies in line with changing priorities.About WYGWe’re an international, award-winning, multidisciplinary consultancy, delivering creative solutions to some of the world’s most challenging projects. We’re confident in our abilities, authentic in the advice we give, imaginative in our thinking and resourceful in how we turn our ideas into reality. But most of all, we’re a people business. Our success is down to people like you.RewardsA rewarding future is yours at WYG. We’re committed to supporting your personal aspirations - and with clear career paths and a wide range of opportunities, your goals will always be within reach. Our blended learning experience will help you develop all the skills and qualifications you need to succeed. Fantastic flexible benefits and personalised rewards make up an excellent package.

title: HR Generalist
description:
HR Generalist
        








Blackpool (FY1), 






From £26,000 to £26,000 per annum












Part Time


Posted 21 days ago



























HR Generalist - 21 hours a weekPart Time Human Resources AdvisorLocation: BlackpoolSalary: Pro rata £26,000Fully involving, brand new HR Advisor role, working 21 hours per week!This exciting HR opportunity reports into the Human Resources Manager in the South East office, near Gatwick. You will enjoy close liaison, support and guidance regarding the roll-out of this new HR position, based within their small but growing Blackpool office. This busy HR Advisor role will suit a capable, qualified HR professional who wants to be responsible for all recruitment, training and development, performance monitoring, and grievance and disciplinary procedures for the personnel in this office. You will enjoy working 21 hours a week, ideally across 4-5 days and will be based within their new office, using a brand new HR system and implementing a wide range of HR processes. The 40+ employees are based both in the office and in the field so at times you will be required to travel to locations across the country as well as to the head office near Gatwick for meetings. If this sounds like the challenge you have been waiting for then APPLY NOW!Your duties will involve the following;Accountable for providing HR support and responsibilities, within a multi-tasking, fast paced and changing environment.Effectively co-ordinate the recruitment process including writing job specifications/profiles, candidate sourcing, agency liaison, conduct assessments, support interviews to ensure most suitable candidates are recruited.Seek best value recruitment solutions.Manage new starter, mover and leaver processes.Deliver HR induction programme, ensure operational induction is completed. Oversee probation process, supporting managers with any identified issues.Assist managers to formulate their appropriate training and development plans: identify skills gaps to ensure the business optimises the contribution of its people. Seek best value training solutions.Assist in drafting new HR & Health & Safety policies and procedures.Co-ordinate Personal Development Reviews, IDP and maternity processes.Monitor absence level thresholds and effectively manage with relevant line manager and Occupational Health as necessary.Coach and support managers in dealing with range of complex and sensitive employee relations issues; attendance, grievances, performance management including disciplinary and capability proceedings to achieve successful outcomes.Keep HR Manager fully informed of all developments and maintain strong communication links at all times.Maintain HR system database. Liaise with Payroll.Assist in maintaining relevant ISO standards.Active contributor to the Health & Safety Committee. Undertake risk assessments and other actions to promote a safe and healthy workplace.Provide research, analysis, management information and administration as required.Participate in regular training/ learning activities to maintain and develop skills and knowledge.Skills & Knowledge:CIPD qualification with solid HR experienceStrong problem-solving and analytical abilitiesStrong administrator with excellent organisational skills.Confident communicatorIntermediate knowledge of Excel, Word and Outlook.Key Words: Payroll, HR, Administrator, Admin, CIPD, CIPP, Human Resource, Payroll Advisor, HR Advisor, HR Recruitment, Recruitment, ER, Employee RelationsFollow us on Twitter@aboutyourecruit or join our facebook community by clicking 'Like’ on our About You Recruitment Ltd page. Be the first to see our jobs as well as lots of useful information about the job market, interviews and CVs!Note: Due to the large volumes of applications that we receive if you have not had a response within 7 days of your application then please assume that you have been unsuccessful on this occasion.About You Recruitment is an Employment Agency providing office jobs across Sussex and Surrey.

description:
Our client are one of the UK's leading Construction and development companies and due to recent growth of the business they are looking for a Commercial Manager to join the team to be commercially responsible for all allocated projects based out of the companies Preston Brook officesMain responsibilities:To encourage, manage and develop the commercial department to allow the staff to perform to their abilities, encourage decision making and provide support to those with problems, suggest solutions and implement procedures.Report punctually and accurately on all financial aspects of the division. title: Procurement Assistant
description:
Due to expansion, we have an opportunity for an Assistant to join our established Procurement department, based at our support centre in Watford.The main purpose of the role is to support the procurement department in meeting objectives of providing an efficient and cost effective procurement service, to all departments and branches of the Medivet group, for all goods and services as defined within the duties and responsibilities of the job.This is an excellent opportunity for someone who has experience in the procurement function and looking to take their career to the next level.What you'll be doing:Assisting the team with the requisition and purchase order process by placing and progressing purchase ordersReview and process of requisitions and purchase orders to ensure that Branches are kept up to date with their requirements.Ensure the Branches are advised of purchase orders placed and of any delay in the processing of a requisition, or, the delay in the delivery of goods for outstanding purchase orders.Be responsible for the vetting and processing of weekly and, ad hoc, stationery requests.Process requests for uniforms in line with current uniform styles and specifications for existing and new staff, as requested by Departmental Managers.Liaise with the nominated Print Management supplier to provide design and print services when new or amended printed materials are requested by our Marketing Department.What you'll bring to the team:* Ability to communicate professionally. Possess excellent communication skills including; face-to-face, telephone and email* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (especially Word and Excel)* Good attention to detail and well-organised* Ability to multi-task and see each task through to the end* Previous experience in a similar role is essentialWhat we'll offer you:* A competitive benefits package including 25 days' annual leave (plus bank holidays), auto-enrolment pension, eyecare and childcare vouchers, cycle-to-work scheme, option to sign up to our healthcare scheme and over 6,000 retail, holiday and days out discounts* Fun, friendly and supportive atmosphere

title: Operations Manager (Private Client - Medical)
description:
Our client is the largest independent Kent specialist within their field, servicing both Private and NHS clients they are expanding their team due to securing further contracts across North Kent and South London. As an experienced Operations Manager you will be responsible for the strategic, financial and day-to-day running of this practice and associated health services, across Kent and South London. Liaise with clinical and non-clinical staff and other partner organisations. Reporting in to the Director and Multinational Partners. You will be a logistical planner with a financial bias with the ability to see the whole picture from a senior management view point. NHS or cooperate experience in not essential as full services training can be provided. You will be based within the client head office in Folkestone however you will be expected to visit branches throughout Kent and South London regularly, in addition you will be required to attend meetings with NHS commissioners when required. ·Working alongside the General Manager you will managing clinical, professional, clerical and administrative staff;·Working alongside the HR Team you will managing the recruitment, selection, appraisal and development of staff;·implementing new policies and directives;·gathering and analysing data and using it to plan and manage both projects and systems;·working towards ensuring quality and value for money for patients;·extrapolating data for quality assurance and monitoring purposes;·setting budgets and maintaining finances within tight constraints;·planning and implementing strategic changes to improve service delivery;·attending meetings, writing reports and delivering presentations to a variety of audiences; clinical governance and audit;·sitting on committees and representing the views of departments and teams;·handling communications and corporate affairs;·using computers to manage information and financial data and to analyse and measure performance;You will need to show evidence of the following:·communication skills, both oral and written, as you will need to communicate effectively with a variety of individuals and professional groups;·listening skills and the ability to negotiate with and persuade others;·motivation, interest in the sector and identification with the common values and aims of the healthcare sector·an emphasis on achievement of results and both the energy and enthusiasm to ensure that objectives are met;·initiative and leadership skills and the ability to gain the trust, commitment and cooperation of others;·the ability to grasp clinical issues, including the understanding of treatments and evolving medical technologies;·organisational skills to deal with a diverse range of challenges;·flexible and creative problem-solving ability;·numeracy and the ability to analyse complex issues, absorb information, understand data and identify underlying trends;·adaptability and readiness to challenge existing practices and find alternatives;·the ability to cope with pressure, stress and ongoing change in the form of new medical technology and treatments, policies, practices and reorganisation.As this is a newly created role, its an exceptional opportunity for an experienced General Manager or Operations Manager to join an SME business and make a real difference to the running and development of the company. Career progression into a Directors role is possible within this business for the successful candidate.

title: Business Manager - Automotive
description:
Are you an experienced Automotive Business Manager or a driven Sales Executive looking for the next steps in your career? Are you looking for the next steps in your career with a forward-thinking franchise dealer group? If the answer is YES, we want to hear from you.Our client are a leading multi-franchise retail motor group in the UK and has been trading successfully for nearly 100 years. Operating 26 franchised dealerships across 11 locations, they currently represent brands including Citroen, Dacia, Fiat, Ford, MG, Mitsubishi, Peugeot, Renault and SEAT.Due to continuing growth, they are now seeking a Showroom - Business Manager to join the team at their multi franchised dealership in Lincolnshire.What will I be responsible for?Reporting in to the General Sales Manager, the successful Showroom / Business Manager will be responsible for maximising the profitable sales of finance and insurance products. Your responsibilities will also include:•	Assisting in the closing of vehicle sales by providing finance products as an aid to selling.•	Securing finance business using approved providers.•	Ensuring F & I policies are followed by all employees when using finance and insurance products.•	Ensuring that Sales Management, General Management and other front line sales employees are kept abreast of developments in the finance and insurance market.Who are they looking for?As their ideal Showroom / Business Manager, you be an outstanding salesperson and have up-to-date knowledge and relevant experience gained within the finance and insurance industry. You will also:•	Have an ability to build exceptional customer relationships and negotiate profitable transactions. •	Have the ability to mentor and develop others while being regarded as a member of a team.•	Have an understanding of the legal, tax and fiscal implications of Finance and Insurance.Rewards & BenefitsIn return for your hard work as a Showroom / Business Manager, you be entitled to a competitive basic salary and a range of excellent rewards including a company car, workplace pension, staff discounts, 22 days' annual holiday.They are looking for an experienced automotive professional who has the knowledge, skills, experience and outstanding track record in F&I to provide their customers with outstanding service. If you believe that this could be the ideal role for you, please click APPLY below to register your interest in the role of Showroom / Business Manager!The vacancy you have applied for is being advertised by CVWOW Ltd, the UK's leading, award winning recruitment specialist. We are happy to accept applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation or marital status. title: Town Planner - Senior / Principal / Associate
description:
WYG, having grown to become one of the top 3 Planning Consultancies in the UK, is seeking a progressive and versatile Town Planner to join our London office on Mansfield Street. You will be a Senior, Principal or Associate Planner with expertise in regeneration planning to support one of key projects for the next 6 - 12 months. In return for your dedication, you’ll enjoy a quality total remuneration package, including contributory pension, health cover and flexible working options.Your RolePlanning is at the heart of WYG and leads the growth of the company. Providing unrivalled professional and technical advice and intelligence, you will maintain and develop long standing relationships with our key client. You will be expected to operate at a competent and professional level with little direct supervision. The role requires an excellent knowledge of the planning system and the ability to process planning applications for major regeneration developments. This will include the assessment and appraisal of detailed and technical documents; including impact statements, the negotiation of all aspects of a planning application, and direct liaison with internal and external clients.About YouYou may be a Senior, Principal or Associate level Planner, looking for the opportunity to support a key regeneration project. You must be educated to degree level or equivalent, with sound knowledge and proven experience in the field of Town Planning. Joining as Associate, you will begin the path of development with long term progression to becoming a Director. You will have been involved in large or complex planning projects for private sector and /or local authority clients. We are looking for candidates with an enthusiastic and a flexible approach that equips WYG to support diverse teams in line with changing priorities. You will be a member of a professional body, such as RTPI or RICS.About WYGWe’re an international, award-winning, multidisciplinary consultancy, delivering creative solutions to some of the world’s most challenging projects. We’re confident in our abilities, authentic in the advice we give, imaginative in our thinking and resourceful in how we turn our ideas into reality. But most of all, we’re a people business. Our success is down to people like you.RewardsIn return for your dedication, you’ll enjoy a quality total remuneration package, including contributory pension, health cover and flexible working options. Pick and choose your perfect blend from advantages including childcare and retail vouchers, travel insurance and variable holiday. You’ll also benefit from a tailored package or professional training and development, with support to achieve your career goals.

Junior Project Management Consultant - Defence - Bristol/Wiltshire An exciting opportunity to join a growing management consultancy that specialise in project and programme management. The opportunity to work across a range of programmes and sectors including Defence, Justice, Energy and more. A company with great values that encourage and support formal training & career progression. Demonstrate practical experience in one or more of our client's PPM capabilities of Project Control (including Earned Value), Planning and Scheduling, Project Risk Management, Cost Estimating and Forecasting, Through-life Management Planning and Assurance.Have experience of working in a project environment particularly in the Defence industry.Be a confident individual who can perform when working as part of a team or when acting independently with support from colleagues.Operate effectively at senior levels in a client's team to influence strategic decision makers whilst acting at the working level to deliver practical solutions.Be articulate with good presentation and written communication skills.Have a genuine enthusiasm to contribute to the growth of a successful business.Be a member of an appropriate professional body (such as APM) and have a desire for further professional development.Key Requirements:The ideal candidate will be educated to degree level and will have experience of working as a consultant in the defence industry and be looking for their first move.This role requires the holder to have a valid UK driving license.RECOMMEND A FRIEND: If you have professional friends/colleagues who would be interested in one of our roles and our excellent levels of service too, we'd like to recognise your recommendations with a 'thank you' of our own. For every colleague you refer who then starts a role through Datasource either Contract or Permanent, we will send you £300!You will be required to hold a minimum of DV/SC security clearance. description:

For large and/or complex proposals an Estimator / Technical Bid Manager will support through the formation of a bid team.All activity, planning and sales processes are managed by the Sales Consultant through Salesforce.com, JCI’s CRM application.Through focused sales activities executed with a consistent rhythm, the key objectives for the Sales Consultant are pipeline growth and conversion improvement, to drive bookings growth against a defined sales target. Responsibilities * Lead Management – self generation of leads through planning & execution of business development activities from a variety of lead sources. Identify and qualify leads against solutions to pursue to bid. Collaborate across business channels and other enterprise solutions where lead can be supported, as required.  * Account/Territory Planning – through planning activities, identify accounts to target for growth opportunities against enterprise solutions. Define account plan with SMART objectives.  * Opportunity Planning – Identify opportunity to bid, fully qualify with the customer & engage in a pre-bid review. Form a bid team to identify critical must wins/complex/large opportunities, define roles of team, technical strategy, value proposition and next actions.  * Survey, Configure, Price, Quote – survey customer sites, prepare costs, specifications and quotations to propose solutions to the customer.  * AMR – pursue all AMR opportunities, ensure all installation opportunities have attached AMR quotations  * Presentations – Carry out technical/bid presentatiRequired profile:.What we offer:See Job Description

title: Financial Business Analyst
description:
The role of the Financial Business Analyst based out of Luton will be to support the business with meaningful reporting and analysis to understand the companies current financial position and results as well as future direction and developments. This is a great role offering progression for someone already strong in excel and analysis, looking to further their exposure and move up the ladder with study support and professional development on offerClient DetailsMy client are a leading Consultancy business with offices and divisions all over the globe, a forward thinking business with parking on site in Luton and a great culture of ensuring employees personal and professional development plans are upheld and supported thoroughly. An initial contract position developing into a permanent role after a 3 month periodDescriptionThe Financial Business Analyst will be responsible for the production of a number of key reports and analysis to support the business together with undertaking various commercial activities in the teamManaging cash flow and working capitalThis role will require someone to produce internal management information and KPI reportingProducing monthly budget reports for department managersMonitoring business performance against both internal and external service level agreementsAssist with decision making and the provision of reports using Excel, PowerPivot and PowerViewBalance sheet reconciliationsAd hoc spreadsheet work and analysisMonthly invoice reconciliationsProfileEssential Financial Business analyst experience;Of challenging existing processes & implementing changes which create efficiency'sMinimum of 12 months experience in an finance and analytical position looking at cash flow and working cpaital managementSignificant experience of using finance and reporting systems (input, interrogation, development)Strong MS Office knowledge with intermediate Excel skills (i.e lookups, If Statements, Pivot tables)Analytical approach to problem solving - able to absorb and interpret financial information quickly to understand the operational drivers or implicationsSkills and exposure;Varied experience of working in a busy and challenging finance team dealing with queries across the organisation dealing with account/process correctionsAn individual who is part-qualified or actively studying within ACCA or CIMAA positive 'can-do' attitude with the resilience and tenacity to see a project/task through to a successful conclusion, no matter what challenges may ariseExcellent stakeholder management - building relationships across the organisation to improve understanding of key issues, drawing on expertise to ensure delivery of customer requirementA strong customer ethos - always looking for ways to meet and exceed customer expectationsAbility to build strong working relationships and work well in a team - providing direction, support and challenge to others as requiredStrong organisational skills - able to prioritise competing requirements and implement plans to deliver against themHigh levels of accuracy and attention to detail - in completing daily tasks and in reviewing the work of othersJob OfferA company whose culture is at the forefront of their strategy, rewarding staff and ensuring hard work is repaid through competitive packages and bonus', this Finance analyst role is offering study support

title: Team Manager (FIF07518)
description:
Job Description  Interview Date: Week Commencing Monday 3 July 2017 Before applying for this job, it is important that you read the Applicant Guidance by clicking on this  link and the attached Job Pack. These explain the job role and the type of person we are looking for. The main terms and conditions of employment are also available via the above link. You will be responsible for managing a team of social work staff delivering an assessment and care management function for older people, including Adult Protection, AWI and Hospital Discharge responsibilities.You will provide professional leadership as first line manager with day to day operational management responsibility for a team or of Social Work staff delivering front line social work services for Older People, whilst ensuring high standards of practice parameters and service provision are maintained.Fife Council pays the Scottish Local Government Living Wage Rate to employees earning less than £8.33 per hour. If the hourly rate of pay for the post is less than the Scottish Local Government Living Wage Rate a supplement will be paid. Requirements You will require to have a social work qualification and extensive post qualifying experience within a community care assessment and care management setting. This is essential together with experience assessing and meeting the needs of individuals with a range of needs within a challenging financial climate.Before confirming appointment, you will be required to obtain Protection of Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme Membership through Disclosure Scotland. Responsibilities You will have experience of working with older people. Previous responsibility for managing/supervising staff and the ability to delegate are essential. You will have excellent written and oral communication, organisational and prioritisation skills, as well as leadership, decision making, strategic planning and service development skills. You will also be able to manage change and budgets. You must have experience of assessment, review and care planning and experience of working with carers and families. This post is considered Regulated Work with Children and/or Protected Adults, under the Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007. The Individual You should evidence a strong knowledge of relevant legislation, policies, procedures and practice issues. Knowledge of local policies, procedures and frameworks in addition to assessment skills and the ability to work positively and closely with other agencies. You should have the ability to travel throughout Fife. In addition, you should have good, clear, written and verbal communication and presentation skills, experience in team development, a sound awareness of your own values and their impact on practice, and embody an inclusive approach to anti-discriminatory working. You should also have an awareness of the impact of stress and the ability to manage stress pro-actively.In Fife Council How We Work Matters and you will be responsible for being a role model by displaying and promoting behaviours that are expected of all Council employees:  Take ownership Focus on customers Work together Embrace technology & information Deliver results  For Further Information Please Contact:Jamie Kirkby, Service Manager.   See also: Team Manager Older People March 2016.docx  RR82 TandCs March 2015.doc  Health Social Care Partnership Info Sheet.docx

3aaa Apprenticeships, a Grade 1 Outstanding Ofsted awarded training provider, specialising in the delivery of Professional Services Apprenticeships have an exciting opportunity for a Delivery Manager.The successful candidate will have overall responsibility for the delivery of Apprenticeship activity for their cluster and will be accountable for achievements against all set KPIs and measurements.Delivery Managers have responsibility for all quality and compliance requirements within the delivery of the apprentice journey. You will be an advocate for 3aaa Apprenticeships, actively promoting our Vision, Mission and Values.What you'll be doing - includes but not limited to:Responsibility for the recruitment and induction of new staff members for your teamLine management of cluster delivery staff, including, but not limited to, trainers, trainers/assessors, assessors and apprenticesComplete scheduled and structured one to ones with all staff membersActively performance manage all members within your delivery team to ensure operational KPIs are achievedProvide or facilitate support, coaching and mentoring for the cluster staffEnsure academies are fully compliant with both funding and quality requirements Maintain appropriate tracking systems relating to quality, compliance, management and assessmentAll applicants require a full clean driving license and have their own transport. There is a requirement to pass an Enhanced DBS check. This will be paid for by 3aaa Apprenticeships.Due to the nature of this role, flexibility and willingness to travel is essential.What we need from you. EssentialExperience of managing and leading a team to perform Experience of contractual paperworkExcellent organisational skills Developed communication skills Good level of IT literacy (Excel in particular) Driving licence Desirable Knowledge of the FE sector and funded programs First Aid qualified IQA/Assessor experience About us3aaa Apprenticeships is an Ofsted Grade 1 Outstanding training provider specialising in the delivery of apprenticeship programmes across the country. We aim to provide the next generation of high quality IT employees, Digital Marketing executives, Financial Services staff, Managers and Accountants to feed the demand for qualified professionals through the exceptional delivery of Level 3 & 4 training and professional qualifications. We also have a significant number of Levy paying clients from Blue Chip companies and many education and sporting organisations. Our wider offer to clients continues to expand and grow to meet new demands.3aaa Apprenticeships is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

title: Solicitor
description:
Experienced Community Care Court of Protection Solicitor Minimum 3 years PQE Salary dependent on experiencePermanentFull timeLocation: HuddersfieldOur clients are an award-winning firm of solicitors, based in Yorkshire, with a national profile; Passionate about making a difference to peoples’ lives by being innovative and forward thinking.
