title: Operations Manager
description:
01746 - OPERATIONS MANAGER - HOVE - £35,000 - £38,000 PA Bond Recruitment is currently recruiting for a OPERATIONS MANAGER - with in the IT and telecommunications industry.You will be assisting with day to day running of key aspects of organising, planning and implementing strategy, overseeing deadlines and ensuring work is effectively prioritised, quality assurance of documents, assisting in Statement of Works, cost analysis of projects, assisting in service delivery regarding pre-project planning, post-project service and providing hands-on help when needed. You will manage all Customer Satisfaction initiatives.You will need to be an enthusiastic person who is self-sufficient, trustworthy and dependable as you will be an integral part of the team. You must be able to work to deadlines and complete tasks accurately and efficiently. You will be an outgoing, self-assured individual with common sense who is a team player. Extreme proficiency in grammar and syntax is a must. Experience in working in an IT environment is a bonus. Experience in working in smaller teams in a medium size organisation is an advantage.The role and responsibilities: * Agrees objectives in conjunction with the Finance & Operations Director and sets individual objectives* Ensures quality assurance on all client documentation, deadlines are monitored and achieved or exceeded* Assisting in scheduling Senior/General IT/GRC Consultants to ensure schedules and objectives are met* Monitor operating costs, budgets and resources* Liaising with clients for scheduling and report delivery ensuring high standards are consistently met.* Assisting with the logistics of delivery providing efficient and cost effective logistical planning* Performing regular customer satisfaction duties* Working with Finance Department for project costings* Working with the sales team in document development* Comply with company procedures, policies and guidelines* Communicating with all departments and providing reports as and when required* Developing operational procedures to ensure consistency and accuracyAdditional Information £35,000 - £38,000 pa Pension, Holiday entitlement bonus and further training* Competitive salary with annual reviews* Performance-related bonuses* Company pension scheme* Company Share Option scheme* Length of Service is linked with increases in allocated holiday days* Car Allowance (for certain positions)* Parking/Season ticket scheme* Childcare Voucher scheme* Bonuses for employee referrals* Structured learning and development plans which can include support for professional qualifications* Entertainment and social activities* Annual eye testsPersonal specification:* Proven experience as an Operations Manager, or similar operational position* Must have experience in reviewing documentation/contracts to an excellent standard - correct Grammar is a must - you will be tested* Must have experience in dealing with consultants/engineers and scheduling consultant delivery days* Must have experience in supporting a sales team: documentation, Quality Assurance and project planning* Must have experience in dealing with business customers - B2B not business-to-consumer* Familiar with financial and customer service principles and practices* Knowledge of data analysis procedures* Excellent written and verbal communication skills* Proficient user of MS Office* Ability to plan and prioritise effectively, well organised* Interpersonal and communication skills* Good commercial awareness, builds and manages effective relationships* Problem-solving* Previous experience working for an IT Company will be an advantage.* Previous experience in working with a smaller, growing and dynamic fast-paced organisation.


Contact: Sian Buckler
        

Reference: Totaljobs/01746

title: Junior Copywriter
description:
Fantastic opportunity for a Junior Copywriter to join a boutique creative information design agency with some of the biggest name clients going, based in Central London.My client is a creative information design agency, with offices in London and New York, working across digital and print to deliver excellent customer experience. They are a small but mighty team, with big plans to grow, and well-versed in working fast and playing hard. Their clients are global, well-known brands in the banking, utility, financial services and insurance sectors and due to growth they are now looking for a Junior Copywriter to bolster the team.The role of the Junior Copywriter will be to write beautifully crafted and grammatically correct copy for a variety of mediums including email, web, letters, white papers, brand guidelines etc. Also longer more technical copy and shorter social media type content.As such to be the right candidate you'll have a portfolio demonstrating your ability to write and craft different types of copy, whether it be long or short, bringing flare and accuracy to every piece of work. You'll also have experience of interpreting brand guidelines, writing for different tones of voice, editing existing content and proofreading. As a given you'll also be passionate about writing and working across a range of channels.In terms of cultural fit you'll be natural communicators, have a positive energy and be highly motivated.In return you'll get to work with some very big name brands and a close knit team. You'll also have the opportunity to develop and grow as a writer.So if this sounds like you, please get in touch with your current CV & examples of your recent work.Please note due to the high volume of candidates we will only reply to those successful in their application.

title: Senior Motion Graphics Designer
description:
Our client works with a world-class roster of global clients, spanning broadcast, branding, strategy, digital and tech.Their designers have a passion for making beautiful, original brands that work. They live and breathe design, typography, colour theory, and composition. They don't rest until the idea, design, artwork is right and they are driven by creativity. They work closely with strategists, creative directors, copywriters, and animators, to translate marketing and brand strategies into creative work that is stunning, intelligent and robust.Pivotal to the role is experimenting, learning and endlessly creating for any medium.Attuned to design and branding while able to make killer frames, you love making things move. As part of a team, you work closely with creative directors, designers and strategists to create work that is engaging, delightful and unique. Telling a story, whether a promo, commercial or graphic system, the brand is what drives you. This crafted approach to animation combined with a meticulous eye for the unusual, fuels your passion for experimentation across any medium. It's what makes you tick and enables you to work at pace always striving for creative excellence.Skills include:- You'll be fluent and expert in C4D, After Effects, Photoshop, Adobe CC - the usual - plus Arnold skills a bonus. The more software skills the better; being unafraid of pushing into new territories, changing ideas through experimentation and unorthodox methods of expression.Experience:- You will solid agency experience primed in the areas of creating broadcast brand identities from TV formats to broadcast systems.- Comfortable in exploring design ideas across brand films, content, experiential, UI, info GFX.What We Offer:- Competitive salary-Company benefits include extra holiday entitlement for long service, regular performance reviews, training & development, pension scheme, plus all expenses paid weekend & our family Friday lunches.  If this role is of interest, please apply with your CV and showreel to get regsitered with Creative Recruitment. Senior Content Manager - Content Labs

Here’s your week. First, you put the finishing touches to a creative pitch for Third Sector. Then it’s a brainstorming session for a PRWeek event, before a client rings to discuss the direction of their latest Windpower Monthly video series. By lunch, you’re helping with some Campaign marketing copy and checking a handful of lead-gen projects are ticking over. Then you head into town with an editor and salesperson for That Big Pitch. Tomorrow is totally different.

Content Labs, part of Haymarket Business Media, is looking for a senior content manager who's versatile, creative, and can offer demonstrable organisational skills to help grow Haymarket Business Media's commercial content department. It will suit project managers or account managers wanting to stretch their creative side, event producers looking to diversify their experience, or editorial staff who fancy getting stuck into the cut-and-thrust of commercial while using their editorial skills.

Who we’re looking for

A highly organised multi-tasker who works well under pressure, adhering to deadlines and targets
Able to prioritise, delegate and commission effectively
An articulate and excellent communicator both written and verbal, with copywriting experience
Happy to build relationships both internally and externally, dealing with people across all levels
Has forensic attention to detail and never assumes anything
Uses own initiative and is creative, with the ability to think differently
A quick learner who’s motivated and a genuine self-starter, confident enough to provide solutions where needed

You’ll also need to be honest and approachable, know when to support and help and also when to challenge the status quo. You need to understand a client's big picture vision and know how to go about turning that into reality.

Nice to haves

Good understanding of modern media landscape
Client-facing experience
Sector specific experience and knowledge
Entrepreneurial and commercial mindset with an interest in growing revenues around content
	 

Software skills

CMS experience, basic HTML
Google Drive (G-Suite), Slack (or similar team collaboration tools), understanding of Google Analytics
InDesign and Photoshop (preferred, not essential)
All mainstream social-media channels


If you're excited by this great opportunity click apply now to get in touch for more information.

title: Senior Account Manager - (live events agency)
description:
Award-winning creative live events agency is looking for a talented and creative Senior Account Manager to join their London office, and work on a great portfolio of live event and communications projects for their impressive client list.THE COMPANY Great existing clients and regular client wins make this agency a really exciting and dynamic company to be part of. They produce a wide range of creative live event, video and digital projects for an impressive array of top corporate clients and brand names across varied sectors.THE ROLE  As Senior Account Manager you'll take full responsibility for managing the delivery of a portfolio of client projects including large scale and high budget, across live event, comms and digital. Complete ownership of client communication and budget, briefing internal departments, supplier liaison, content development, technical, logistics and delegate management . You'll facilitate creative meetings, enabling and overseeing creative content solutions for videos & events and supporting material for projects, and be able to demonstrate a great understanding of client strategy to advise and steer content. You'll have full control of project budgets. As well as heading up day to day client relationships you'll develop business development plans for existing clients, and work on new pitches with the Business Development team. Line Management of your Account Team.Key Responsibilities include:Project Management of varied of live events and communications projectsContent development, organising and facilitating creative meetings, understanding client strategy/objectives and steering project deliverables to meet theseFinancial Management - full control of budgets and working to agreed margin targetsClient Management, heading up day-to-day client relationships on projects, recognising and developing further opportunitiesNew business - working with Client Services Director to put together new business pitchesSupporting direct reports to perform at their best.THE CANDIDATE You'll have previous experience in a relevant Agency role (Senior Account Manager, Account Manager, Project Manager), within the events and communications sector. title: Site Head of Production
description:
Contract Type: PermanentJob Elements: -• To lead, develop and motivate production management and staff in the pursuit of operational excellence. • To effectively manage the conversion process of raw materials into finished product to meet specified quality, quantity, delivery and health and safety requirements. • To lead the site services team and engineering maintenance staff to develop and support engineering solutions and equipment to meet operational requirements. • Ensuring that the business can achieve shortened cycle times with maximum output from Production through PPMs, reduced OEEs and ability for the maintenance department to respond promptly and effectively to urgent downtime events. • To manage departmental activities to ensure that: agreed weekly production schedules are achieved • To recruit, train and manage departmental staff to ensure that personnel requirements are identified and suitable staff are selected to meet current and future needs and that best use is made of the team and its members via the effective distribution of tasks and activities, the setting of clear objectives, the setting out of appropriate plans and methods of working and the provision of feedback on performance • To identify opportunities for improving operational activities and to plan, agree and successfully implement changes, • To effectively manage the Production department’s budgets. • To contribute as a member of the Operations Management Team (SLT) to major decisions and the development of relevant programmes of work and policies. • To lead designated projects through planning and preparation, co- ordination and Implementation, and closure stages to achieve project outcomes within agreed time scales and budgets. • To establish and maintain productive working relationships with colleagues at all levels and to effectively represent the interests of the Company in dealings with key stakeholders • Manage, coordinate and control all aspects of maintenance & site services engineering in order to meet agreed departmental objectives. • Implementation of engineering metrics through gap analysis, design and implementation of roadmaps and improvement plans. • Introduce and manage automated Preventative maintenance plan utilising kitting system with the objective of minimising machine downtime. • Actively participate in daily/weekly/monthly production review meetings. • Monitor line performance as OEE Values and actively progress continuous improvement activities in a structured fashion. The ideal candidate will have:• A Bachelor of Engineering degree or equivalent level of qualification in electrical and/or mechanical engineering is essential. • Have senior leadership experience. • An extensive level of experience in managing within a similar position, and be fully conversant in the day to day running of a factory environment. • Excellent knowledge and extensive experience in all aspects of Modern Maintenance practices such as automated PM systems, TPM and condition based monitoring. • To have extensive experience in adopting Lean Six Sigma techniques, ideal candidate will be black belt trained • High degree of commercial negotiating skills is essential. • The jobholder should have excellent inter personal, administrative and leadership skills, financial awareness and the ability to organise his or her own workload. • A thorough knowledge of Quality Management Systems, GMP and other legislation relating to this job. Petrie Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers.For further vacancies, please visit http://www.petrie.co.ukFollow us on http://www.twitter.com/PetrieRecruitReceive updates via http://www.facebook.com/PetrieRecruitment/LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/petrie-recruitment

Head of QSHE NorthamptonPermanent £ Competitive + benefitsOne of the UK’s biggest brands is looking for a Head of QSHE.You probably know us best for Carlsberg and Carlsberg Export. But, there's more to us than meets the eye. From Tetley's to Tuborg, San Miguel to Somersby Cider and not forgetting one of our newest brands, Brooklyn. We produce lots of leading brands. We also import premium world beers like Mahou, have an impressive portfolio of cask ales and source specialist wines and spirits from around the globe to delight our customers with. Furthermore, we are proud of our partnership with the UK's best festivals - Glastonbury and Download to name just a couple.In conjunction with Global Quality & SHE teams, we are looking for a candidate that can create and implement effective Quality & SHE strategies to deliver world-class performance.This role will entail engaging, developing and leading resources to deliver Carlsberg UK’s visions. It is important that we ensure Quality and Food Safety are prioritised and promoted to ensure our customers and consumers receive our products at the right quality at the point of purchase and consumption. By leading the Quality and H, S & E strategy across both the Supply Chain and Commercial businesses, this role will engage with colleagues across the Carlsberg network to develop best practice standards for global implementation. We are looking for previous experience in contributing to a senior leadership team within specifically, a production environment, creating a culture of continuous improvement.In order to carry out this role effectively we require strong leadership skills with a proven track record of change management in driving safety improvements. You will need to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization and be able to have an impact, challenge where necessary and influence where possible. We are looking for someone who has a Degree or relevant industry experience in Food Science & Technology, for example, NEBOSH Diploma as well as experience in leading a Safety and Environment function, delivering structured improvements. If you describe yourself as a specialist in Quality processes in particular, with in-depth experience of implementing and leading, backed up by some relevant training in H&S then this role could be right for you.On top of the culture and career development opportunities that make working with us so rewarding, we offer a flexible benefits scheme, pension, generous holidays and a product allowance. So, what are you waiting for? The broader opportunities you crave with a world leader could be yours for the taking. Applications may be processed prior to the closing date so don’t postpone getting your application submitted.Please note that due to the high volume of applications we receive we are unable to contact all applicants directly. If you haven`t heard from us within 28 days, please consider your application to have been unsuccessful.

title: Operations Director
description:
An excellent opportunity for an experienced senior Operations professional to make a real impact on the growth of an engineering-driven, highly successful SME!Our client designs, develops and installs servo-hydraulic test equipment on a global basis, focussing on the automotive and aerospace industries. As their business grows and expands, they will be adding an extra seat at their senior management table for an Operations Director to manage the operational efforts of the organisation.This role will give you responsiblity for the functional areas of Deisgn, Purchasing, Projects, and Mechanical / Electrical Production. This will include all the strategic, financial, manpower and cultural management to ensure the achievement of organisational objectives and performance KPIs.As this is a newly created position, you will have a real opportunity to put a stamp on how the operational function of the organisation progresses. You will be in control of all resources, planning, health and safety, quality output and efficiency of all areas of responsibility, including the motivaiton and management of all staff, and ensuring the ahcievement of project and budget deadlines on time and on budget.The ideal candidate will have a degree level qualification (Ideally in an engineering discipline). Previous experience of managing operations in an engineering or manufacturing environment is highly desirable, espcially if that was in testing equipment manufacture, servohydrualics, automotive or aerospace. In addition, you will have a strong and robust character with a track record of successful delivery of projects, managing people and financial / budgetary and strategic control.A valid UK or EU passport is required for periodic travel to China.In return, the company offers a well-structured benefits package including relocation support for the right candidate, a supportive team environment and good prospects in a secure and highly stable working environment.For more information, please send your CV to the link provided.Regreattably, we will only be able to respond to selected applications.
    
    

Contact: Cathy Richardson
        

Reference: Totaljobs/CROPS

title: Scrum Master
description:
We are recruiting on behalf of our client within the telecommunications industry for a Scrum Master to work on site for our client representing ij. The role will require a strong Scrum Master to deliver on key projects. You will be working alongside a number of stakeholders across the business and will be involved in making sure key strategic transformation projects are being delivered. Ideally you will have agile experience and be comfortable working in an ITIL framework. Telecoms experience is essential.The scrum master will help to ensure the team follows the agreed scrum processes, they will facilitate key sessions, and encourage the team to improve. The Scrum Master will engage with product owners and will coach and mentor the team to deliver against objectives. The role will help coach the team within the Scrum principles in order to deliver high quality features and products. It will also help to promote self - organisation within the team. It will also help to educate and be an evangelist to the wider business around the benefits of using the Scrum mythology.Working with ij gives you access to programme, product and portfolio delivery expertise throughout the entire project life-cycle; from ideation to successful completion and audit.We aim to make the experience of working with ij:* Fast & Flexible* Solutions and Service focused* Simple & Straightforwardij recruit operates as an equal opportunities employer and we welcome all applications regardless of gender, marital status, sexual orientation, race, colour, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, disability and age.

title: Project Manager - Commercial - Development
description:
Job Title: Project Manager - Development
Location: London (Central)
Salary: £40,000 - £55,000 (dependent on experience). 
 
Our client, a dynamic partner-led property consultancy, is looking for a Project Manager to join their office based in Central London. They deliver Project Management and Cost Management whilst also offering Employer’s Agent, Programme Management and Fund Monitoring services.
This an exciting opportunity to join a young and dynamic consultancy during a period of growth, which offer services across a number of sectors including Commercial, Residential, Luxury Residential Student Residential, Hotels, Education and Corporate End Users.
As Project Manager you will get involved in some lucrative projects ranging in value from £2 million to £100 million. You will advise on budgets, master programmes and delivery strategies for developments at inception stage, as well as providing effective and strategic leadership to internal and external project teams.
It is essential that you have experience dealing with Developer’s in the past within a previous Consultancy role. You will ideally be MRICS qualified or a similar qualification, however this is not essential. The successful candidate will ideally have a minimum of 1 years experience within a consultancy and experience in delivering consultancy projects.  
With a very competitive salary and performance related bonus are on offer, you will be joining a firm which will support your structured career path, provide training and assist in your growth as an individual.
To apply for this please email your CV to  with your contact details or alternatively call 0207 534 0208 quoting job reference CW/848322.
I aim to get back to all applications, however; if you have not received a response within 4-5 working days, please assume your application has been unsuccessful this time round. I will confidentially retain your details and inform you of any other suitable opportunities arising should you not be successful in this role.

title: Chief Financial Officer - Private Equity Backed Company
description:
Our client, a dynamic and fast growing private equity-backed business services company, is looking for an experienced CFO to help drive growth and add value as it navigates through its next stage.
The Company
The company has a significant international presence and is an acknowledged leader in its field. The private equity backers are some of the most successful in the industry, and have thrown their full weight behind this growing business to add value on its journey and preparation for a prospective sale.
The Role
This role requires a CFO with a specific skill set to take on a leading role within the company. The role will be high level, external facing and broad with a wide remit across a multi-site, multinational business. As an integral member of the senior management team, you will routinely make decisions which will determine the direction of the company. Therefore, highly commercial instincts and a drive to get the best outcome is essential.
The CFO will be responsible for but not limited to:

Managing an entire finance and accounting function for a multi national company, including upgrading the financial structure
Overseeing and improving the reporting systems and procedures within the company including monitoring, developing, reporting and interpretation of business KPIs
Responsible for M&A work, banking relationships, investor management, and engagement with the private equity backers
Developing and maintaining strategic banking and corporate finance relationships
Ability to provide strategic decision alongside the senior management team and board

Candidate
The ideal candidate will have experience as CFO in an international multi site business with a strong record in organic growth, preferably within a private equity-backed business. The client is seeking a candidate who has had prior experience preparing and taking a company through a strategic exit. The successful candidate will work alongside the private equity backers and will need to be prepared for significant responsibility, rigorous attention to detail, and highly sought after experience with a renowned PE house.
Applicants should be qualified accountants, preferably chartered. Please understand that due to the expected high number of applications; only shortlisted candidates will be contacted directly.
Marks Sattin Executive Search is part of a leading specialist financial recruitment business with offices in six countries around the world. We form an integral part of the FiveTen Group, which is rapidly expanding globally. Our team exclusively recruits CFOs and FDs into business across a wide range of sectors, mostly focused on change (including exit and growth). We continue to expand our network; providing finance professionals PE backed, privately owned and listed businesses.

title: Head of Commercial Finance
description:
Our client, a ground breaking and much loved high street retailer, requires a new Head of Commercial Finance to take ownership of the commercial finance function within the UK and internationally. With aggressive growth and high turnover each year, the role requires a professional and commercially aware individual to work closely with the whole business in order to operate effectively in this rapidly growing and incredibly popular business. You will have significant interaction with non-finance branches of the business, and your role will include trading finance, buying and merchandising.
Key responsibilities:

Leading, developing and managing a commercial finance team
Complete oversight for all strategic decisions including the day to day running of the commercial finance team
Offering key strategies and planning in relation to the international growth and expansion
Strengthening and building relationships with senior management and analytical teams
Responsibility for presenting weekly trade figures, ownership of KPIs and market analysis
Ad hoc analysis which includes brand profitability, new store appraisals and store action plans

Desired Skills and Experience:

Qualified accountant
Prior experience working in retail or consumer related business
Previous experience of managing and developing staff
Planning and analysis experience as well as the ability to work with a high level of accuracy and meet strict deadlines
Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

This is an exciting role which will allow the candidate to get truly involved at a strategic level. The successful candidate must have a positive and very hands on attitude in order to continue to expand and develop an already well recognised retail brand.

title: Finance Director
description:

title: Financial Controller - High End Retail Wholesale Business
description:
Chic fashion brand with international offices requires a highly astute and technically strong Financial Controller to take responsibility for managing the full finance function on a daily basis. You will work closely with the senior management and investors in this growing PE-backed business to ensure the continued growth and enviable reputation for quality.
The Role
This position represents an outstanding opportunity to make a mark on an already successful company, and gain exposure to the rigour of an investor-led institution. From their trendy London offices, you will be fully responsible for the finance function on a day to day basis. The role will also consist of ensuring the financial and operational management and control all the operating entities globally in a rapidly changing private equity backed company.
The Candidate

Detail-oriented qualified accountant with an understanding of international reporting in the retail sector or similar
Exposure to processes performed in a multisite business
Due to the high levels of operational growth the company is undergoing, candidates must be technically strong and comfortable dialling in systems, processes, and controls
Extensive understanding of managing stock, consolidation of accounts including all financial accounting and reporting for the group
Detailed knowledge of financial planning and analysis within a retail company/ wholesale consumer or related business

The ideal candidate will be either a Financial or Management Accountant in a larger business or a Finance Manager or Financial Controller in a smaller business looking to make a step up. This fast-paced, PE-backed business is the perfect environment in which to demonstrate aptitude for financial control and commercial acumen. Our client is ideally looking for a qualified accountant, preferably chartered, with significant PQE.
Please note due to a high volume of applications, only successful candidates will be contacted with further information.

title: Group FC
description:
Interim Group FC
Sheffield
6 Month - up to £550 per day
Marks Sattin have been engaged to search for an experienced Group FC, to join a leading South Yorkshire business. The successful applicant will be joining during an exciting phase of businesses, and will have sole responsibility for overseeing the group's financial activities.
The successful applicant will work very closely with the CFO, providing support when required. Key responsibilities will include:

Manage all aspects of statutory reporting and audit including playing a lead role on all technical accounting matters
Multi-currency group consolidations both for statutory, management reporting, budgeting and forecasting
Prepare and review weekly profit reporting, monthly management accounts and group board reporting pack
Co-ordinate annual budget, quarterly forecasting and strategic planning processes
Manage group treasury function including cashflow forecasting and foreign exchange management
Manage corporation tax and VAT returns including proactive tax planning
Develop and implement group accounting and control policies and processes
Influence improvements in the efficiency of the finance function and business processes generally
Assist management of DB pension schemes
Ad hoc project work

To be considered for this role, you must have the following experience:

Qualified accountant with very strong technical knowledge and analytical skills

title: IT Strategy / Business Analyst
description:
Our client is a rapidly growing operational improvement consultancy with an impressive reputation across the defence, aerospace, consumer, healthcare, manufacturing, local government and private equity sectors. They are growing fast and aiming to continue growing at 25% annually over the coming years.  Their Business Technology team implement the IT which underpin the success of their consultancy projects. Their systems help drive improvement anywhere from operating theatres to 24/7 production lines. Their Internal IT team deliver the technology which supports their consultants. They are aiming to implement a number of key projects over the next five years to match and build on their business growth. The role:Youll be working closely with their clients and key stakeholders to understand business processes, recommend improvements and detail technical requirements.For the most part youll be working onsite with key people from our clients businesses and our consultancy teams. Youll be an important part of the process in understanding business processes and where technology can help make them more effective. Youll also be helping their business turn its own IT ambitions into tangible, deliverable and successful projects.As a new role in a fast growing business, they are looking for someone who will challenge and expand what this role can deliver.  Responsibilities:  Lead our requirements discovery process, working with key stakeholders to understand and analyse technology and business process needs Develop our business capability so our consultants can carry our initial business analysis and identify technical opportunities in discussions with clients Assist in building business cases with cost benefit analysis to help prioritise information systems spending and project scopes  Transform business needs and ambitions into tangible, deliverable technical requirements  Identify and assess third party technology suppliers who can match our needs Communicate with and support the technology teams to ensure project delivery matches business expectation Research new technologies against the context of our longer term business strategy Skills: Able to run requirements discovery workshops and discussions A good awareness of information systems, technologies and concepts Engagement with senior business users and clients to build confidence and maximise their contribution to the process Able to negotiate priorities, provide productive challenge and resolve conflicts between stakeholders Strong written, verbal and presentation skills Self-starter, who will own the quality and delivery of their work Desirable: A degree level qualification in a relevant technology or business field A recognised business analysis qualification  Familiarity with agile methodologies Experience working in a consultancy or service focused organisation Travel Their clients work across the UK. As such, travel and time away from home will be necessary.  Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.ukTo apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:, quoting reference number:TC005NB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Associate Director - Leading Change and Transformation Boutique, UK and International
description:
Our client is a boutique specialist consulting company specialising in business transformation. 
Their clients are typically customer-facing and geographically dispersed businesses, for which they have unique approaches to rapidly drive growth and to develop compelling multichannel customer propositions supported by highly efficient operating models.  For example, they have worked with all the major Retailers in the UK, leading Retail Banks and Financial Services companies and leading Leisure and Travel companies.  We also work internationally, including the US and Australia.
They would like to add a talented and experienced Associate Director to their senior team.  This role is one level below Director and they are looking for someone with fast track potential.  The successful candidate will therefore need to demonstrate a track record of stellar project delivery and successful business development.  Ideally the candidate would have direct experience of working with Consumer-facing businesses, including a good commercial understanding of the key profit levers. 
The role is likely to suit experienced Principal Consultants or Associate Directors in larger consultancies who are in the pipeline for a Partner role but concerned about how long it will take.  It would also suit candidates from boutique consultancies who are keen to play an influential and shaping role and to move on quickly to a full Director role.  They will offer a good salary, bonus and future entry to a share option scheme, together with a great opportunity to shape the future of our business and to undergo rapid career development in an environment with a strong people focus.  They place a strong emphasis on work life balance and our teams are only on client site for 4 days a week.
 
KEY REQUIREMENTS

Proven track record of holding and achieving sales targets, preferably in customer-facing, people intensive businesses
Excellent consulting experience from a strategy firm, "Big 4", or strong boutique 
Experience leading client assignments, selling on and developing new business opportunities
Degree, with MBA from a good business school an advantage
Excellent people skills and customer relationship track record
Experience in developing client business relationships and creating a good network of contacts
Interpersonal skills that facilitate the building of senior relationships and the ability to engender trust and to challenge senior executives – so confident and good at working in the political and behavioural domains as well as the rational
Ability to develop consulting solutions and design projects in partnership with clients, that are both unique and compelling
Excellent project management skills, professionalism, team leadership skills, a strong work ethic and willingness to travel and work in a diverse environment
Strong core consulting skills and methodologies with a strategic thinking capability
Content skills in consumer-facing businesses and some or preferably many of the following disciplines – operating models, lean, supply chain, organisation design, leadership, category management, commercial development, customer-centricity, multichannel, low cost delivery

PERSONAL PROFILE

High impact and credible in all client situations, both pre-sales and during assignments
Driven to achieve but resilient when things don’t work out as planned, high energy
Confident and authentic – easily develops client trust and naturally curious so finds it easy to unearth client needs
Flexible, able to balance many competing demands at the same time
Ability to synthesise the complex into the elegantly simple
Commercially oriented, strong focus on the business case for clients
Skilled at managing client situations under pressure
Autonomous, positive, and a true team player who can inspire others
Excellent listening, verbal and written communication and presentation skills.

ACCOUNTABILITIES

Identifying and developing opportunities and winning new business, through marketing and sales activities and continuous client contact programmes with senior and executive level client staff
Networking with clients, prospective clients and internally, developing ongoing relationships and leveraging these where possible into project opportunities
Acting as the engagement leader for projects – leading project teams on client sites and being responsible for project design and senior level client liaison, including selling on
Taking responsibility for the overall quality of delivery
Being sufficiently 'subject matter expert' in selected content areas to reassure clients that you understand their issues, choices and solutions
People development, mentoring and coaching, including management of client facing teams
Contributing to the management and development of the client as part of the management team – e.g. could include helping with recruitment, development, methodology innovation, marketing strategy, business strategy etc.

LOCATION
They are London based and work predominantly on client site.  They currently have a major US-based retail client and are also keen to hear from candidates who willing to work in the US, either with very frequent visits back to the UK or on a temporary US resident status for 18 months to 2 years (could include family)
Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk

Relationship with Suppliers, Projects and Negotiations

title: Senior Consultants and Principal Consultants - Operational improvement boutique
description:
A Principal Consultant is expected to “project or programme manage” key projects to achieve a high standard of delivery. They will typically lead projects, or work streams within larger projects, with relative autonomy. They are not expected to be seasoned business developers, but they should be capable of taking a supporting role in new business development and developing existing client accounts through “sell on”.
Contribution to Operations Team 

Provide accurate project information (progress against plans, budgets etc)
Contribute to the development of offers and services
Support other team members to achieve team goals
Contribute to the development of our client's business strategy
Play a supporting role in implementing the business strategy as directed by the Partners
Support recruiting, managing and developing consultants

Generating Demand 

Play a supporting role in implementing plans to acquire new clients, including the writing and publishing of case studies/articles, presenting at seminars & conferences and attending networking events
Identify requirements for new product/service development
Occasionally lead the development of new or revised offers

Winning Business

Take a supporting role in progressing sales leads
Support sales opportunities by writing discussion documents, tenders and proposals (often taking a lead role in this activity)
Develop and occasionally lead sales presentations to potential clients
Liaise with clients, consultants and the Partner responsible for resource management to mobilise teams to deliver projects

Building Great Client Relationships

Support the client Account Manager/Partner in contracting negotiations 
Help assure the quality of delivery, through both their own work and that of their colleagues, including associate consultants
Support delivery of plans to grow an account further
Develop new client relationships
Work with the Partners of the firm to realise the full benefit of our learning in other business opportunities
To build networks within the client to identify future possibilities for business development
To solicit feedback from the client on performance

Planning and Managing Delivery 

This is the primary role of a Principal Consultant
They should act as project manager on smaller projects, or work streams within larger projects/programmes
Understand and apply the principles of Project/Programme Management (possibly having a formal qualification e.g. Prince2, APM, MSP)
Lead project planning e.g. identify and capture project(s) objectives, develop project scope, benefits and establish acceptance criteria, determine resources and performance expectations, assign project responsibilities, estimate timelines, identifying key project results and milestones, develops project plans and work break down structures and communicates these
Manage delivery to a high level of customer satisfaction
Ensure that project files are updated with the appropriate project information
Track and manage project budgets, manage project controls, manage project governance and reporting
Work with the client to resolve any issues that occur during delivery and ensure all issues are resolved to the client's mutual satisfaction.    

Experience/Technical Knowledge

As well as project management, ideal candidates will have skills and experience in one or more of the following areas:
	
Operational excellence
Strategic quality management
Lean
Six-Sigma
Business process improvement
Organisational change/transformation


Indicators for the recruiter – they may have lean or six-sigma qualifications and/or they may work within the operational excellence, operational improvement service line of a larger consultancy/organisation

General

Professionalism – our clients trust us to be independent, objective and utterly reliable. We keep our promises, work shoulder to shoulder with clients to provide dependable, highly appropriate, practical solutions.
Expertise – our most precious asset. We are proud of our in-depth knowledge and are committed to passing this on to our clients through skills transfer.
Loyalty – both a driving force within our organisation and the ultimate aspiration for relationships with customers, employees, associates and partners. We conduct our business in a straight-forward, honest way at all times.

About the Right Candidate
Will have solid evidence of intellect based on their career / academic results to date, have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to genuinely solve business problems with solution development that lies outside of standard processes. The ability to think on their feet and truly understand how businesses operate is essential.
The client's environment will also require a self-starter, able to operate without the heavy infrastructure of a larger organisation. Mind-set and personality fit will also be critical, with the successful person demonstrating ambition along with a desire to work in an environment where individuals do not compete, but collaborate for the best results for our clients and the business.
 
 
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:, quoting reference number:TC100NB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Financial & Operational Analyst
description:
Our client is a worldwide provider of media content, technology, and connectivity solutions to the travel industry. Through the industry’s most comprehensive product and services platform, our client provides airlines with a wide range of inflight solutions. These include Wi-Fi, movies, television, music, interactive software, as well as portable IFE solutions, content management services, e-commerce solutions and original content development. Serving over 150 airlines worldwide, our client delivers exceptional quality and value to its customers to help them achieve their passenger experience objectives.
Key responsibilities
Our client is undergoing a company wide change process and needs to strengthen the in house capability to work on identifying and delivering value from acquisitions. The Financial & Operations Analyst will support our client's drive for growth and value creation by developing synergy cases, supporting their execution and supporting the operational integration of our client's acquisitions. In addition to specific M&A activity, the role will also support business unit and functional leads in achieving operational excellence through the ongoing improvement of operational performance, customer service and quality in a cost efficient manner.
Key responsibilities:

M&A pre-deal; Support the identification and evaluation of potential M&A targets
	
Support development of potential synergy and value creation plans
Lead the financial and operational analysis required to support M&A decisions and business case submissions


M&A post deal; Support and project manage acquisition integration
	
Support the development of integration strategy and execution plans
Support the creation and execution of the their M&A integration and post deal performance improvement initiatives
Lead the analysis required to track progress and delivery of value
Develop their M&A integration and value delivery capability and tools
Work in cooperation with business owners responsible for the acquisition to make sure deal synergies are captured


Operations
	
Identify opportunities to improve current operational performance and overall operating model effectiveness
Identify key transformational themes impacting the media, technology and telecoms sector and airline industry that are relevant
Develop business cases and plans to implement operational change to drive value for the shareholders
Support implementation of initiatives through project management and support of key stakeholders



 
Qualifications

Priven competency in financial analysis, M&A advisory, merger integration, due diligence
Bachelors or Masters Degree
Primary experience and capability required is financial and analytical in nature, therefore a finance qualification would be a distinct advantage although not mandatory e.g. ACA, ACCA, CIMA, CFA, CISI, MSc etc.
Previous experience of operational change, performance improvement and functional or team management would be an advantage

Areas of interest and intrinsic competencies 

Excellent financial and analytical skills
Knowledge of international finance and accounting concepts as they relate to M&A transactions
High attention to detail in analysis work as well as written and verbal communication
Demonstrable project management experience and ability to meet tight deadlines
Good communication skills and ability to diplomatically work with and manage key stakeholders
Responsible, diligent and able to work autonomously as well as part of teams that may be cross functional in nature
Commercial understanding of key business drivers
Genuine interest in and understanding of key trends in the media, entertainment, technology and telecoms markets and the airline industry
Ability to think strategically as well as financially and operationally
Ability to be flexible and live with ambiguity in a rapidly changing environment
Energetic, roll up the sleeves attitude

Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk

Senior Quant phD candidates - "Google" type Hedge Fund, exceptionally smart people job vacancy from Mindbench | Top-Consultant.com

Senior Quant phD candidates - "Google" type Hedge Fund, exceptionally smart people - Central London£100k plus 20% sign on/guaranteed bonus plus company bonus, multiple of salary


Senior Quant phD candidates - "Google" type Hedge Fund, exceptionally smart people - Central London
£100k plus 20% sign on/guaranteed bonus plus company bonus, multiple of salary
 
Our client is one of the most creative and successful hedge fund businesses, likened to being the "Google" of hedge funds. They are hiring Quants who will generate alpha through creating algorithms to identify and exploit inefficiencies in capital markets. They give Quants the intellectual freedom to research independently & pursue areas that interest them. They have incredible Quant retention and they have paid bonuses every year (14 years), have shown excellent performance year on year & are a stable company with the ability to monetise strategies. They offer a relaxed environment (most of the Quants rock up at 9.30/10 and leave 6.30/7), they have the brightest talent there & offer an almost academic feel with financial rewards.
They have an environment where you will be spending at least 80% of your time on your own research and we have a great deal of greenfield work to do. A good example of this is one of the quants they hired last summer who has come in, had an idea, and was given 100% of his time to work on it - it was rolled out in to the production portfolio and has been successful. You will be given a great deal of autonomy and can research your own ideas.
Although equities are still their core business, we work FX and have also recently rolled out futures.  You will have the potential to become an expert in this field. 
As a low profile business, the package is one of the clearest signals they can give of their quality and is the most communicable. They would like the level to be sufficiently high to spark interest amongst the best quants in academia and become part of their reputation. The quality of their people, combined with the £100,000 base starting salary are some of the signs of their confidence to continue on their quality direction. The additional bonuses are fully conditional on company performance, but for Quants who come in and do well should be expecting to make multiples of their base salary once assuming they have come up with valuable contributions. 
THE PROFILE
They look at PhD level candidates and PostDocs with a background in Mathematics/Physics/Statistics/Finance/other numerical subjects. They are very keen to see postdoc candidates as well as those still completing their PhDs as well as those who have some experience so we really are open.
They don't need finance experience or even a particular interest in finance (they have decided that they we're happy to train on this aspect of the role) but they would expect some reading around finance before interviewing.
They are also interested in exceptional candidates toward the end of the second year of the PhDs ready for when they complete their studies.
You need to have some coding ability or at the very least they can show they have the ability think algorithmically and they can demonstrate they could translate their ideas/alphas in to something that could be coded up as an algorithm
 
If you have a strong quant background and would like a confidential discussion please email 
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:, quoting reference number:TChedgefundNB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Business Development Senior Manager, to Director
description:
Our client seeks an experienced business development manager with proven track record in lead generation and sales conversion, possibly from a business services, consultancy or IT solutions environment.
This individual will bring credibility and gravitas representing the clients brand and company values with high professional integrity, able to earn trust and respect at Executive and C-Levels across target client organisations.
Role requirements
A senior business development manager tasked with the job of helping our client grow its business and notoriety in the UK market.
This role calls for a sales professional that already has a strong business relationship network at senior levels within UK companies, and is additionally able to leverage our client’s existing network of contacts and list of client references within UK manufacturing, retail and industry sectors (particularly Food, Beverage and FMCG).
They will help to acquire new customers and promote/ sell our client to organisations and decision makers hitherto unfamiliar with our client'sservices and benefits.
 
Key Responsibilities

Generating new sales leads
Pitching our clients products and/or services
Maintaining fruitful relationships with customers and prospects

 
Activities will include:

Researching organisations and contacts to identify prospects, entry points and needs
Understanding and qualifying their needs, matching the relevancy of our clients services and capabilities, and understanding the client’s decision making process
Contacting potential clients and setting up prospect meetings (support from our client's agency is available)
Attending prospect meetings, write up prospect meeting reports and progressing opportunities along the sales pipeline to successful conversion
Planning and executing UK marketing initiatives, attending networking events where relevant
Supporting the selling activity and conversion process to include:
	
Preparing PowerPoint presentations, credentials, case studies and initial sales support collateral
Contacting clients to inform them about client developments and compelling reasons to meet
Developing offers and proposals in conjunction with other colleagues
Supporting the Sales process and Negotiations as required
Maintain and manage sales pipeline KPI’s (conversion ratios) and customer database (ADB/CRM)
Training and coaching the UK team to develop and improve their sales skills
Coordinate and collaborate with Group level Marketing and Key Account Management teams where relevant



Our client offers a very competitive salary and bonus for the right candidate.
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:, quoting reference number:TC001NB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Top Tier Operational Improvement Consultants - any industry, business or consulting experience
description:
About The Company:
This company brings together the world's most talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds spanning engineering, science, mathematics, business & economics, languages, law, social sciences and beyond. With emotional intelligence and a unique approach, they work in partnership with their clients to deliver market leading operational, financial and quality improvements. They implement transformational, award-winning change across a wide range of sectors for some of the world's most successful, innovative organisations. Projects vary in size and complexity, but they are high-profile, multi-million pound programmes, which are carried out on a unique ‘no results, no fees’ basis. It is challenging and incredibly rewarding work, rooted in analysis, problem solving and insightful communication. The track record of delivering huge results along with an inspiring work culture means headcount and turnover has been growing on average at a rate of 30% annually for the last 12 years.
Background to the Role:
Continuous success and demand for business means that we are recruiting at all levels across the consulting teams. Applicants do not need to have had previous consulting experience – we are looking for people with a strong academic background and experience in general business, industry or consulting.
The Role:
All project work with clients commences with an assessment phase to understand the opportunities for organisational or operational improvement. Once the opportunities for improvement have been identified and quantified, a team of consultants will work on the client’s sites to deliver these. A project’s length can vary from several weeks to six months or longer.
The programmes consultants work are normally complex, multi-faceted and will involve delivering real and measurable results for our clients. Depending on your previous experience, soon after joining you could be taking ownership for and personally delivering performance improvement in a discrete area of a project, or you may soon be managing an entire site-wide improvement project, or even be managing a number of sites and improvement processes simultaneously. Comprehensive, tailored training is given to all new joiners upon starting and throughout your career.
At all levels, client relationship management is an important aspect of the role, and you will work extremely collaboratively with clients. All consultants are responsible for developing relationships with key senior stakeholders and ensuring regular project reviews take place.
Beyond day to day client project work, all the people in the company have a broader remit of supporting the growth and development of the consultancy in general. This entrepreneurial spirit is present throughout the company and might involve working with the recruitment team to continue to find us great candidates, or organising internal review meetings or social events, or helping develop our knowledge capture processes. Everyone is encouraged to get involved in growing and developing the company.

Skills and Attributes:
We are looking for candidates from an operational consulting background in top tier firms, with experience.
Essential Attributes:
Successful candidates must:

Be strong, effective communicators at all levels with the ability to build and sustain relationships
Have the ability to work effectively as part of a team, with a collaborative approach
Be flexible and adaptable
Thrive on early responsibility and be self-motivated and driven to succeed
Be highly numerate with a logical mind-set and strong analytical and conceptual skills

You should also have:

An undergraduate degree - minimum 2:1 from top university, preferable in a numerate subject e.g. Engineering, Maths, Physics, Economics (non-numerate degrees will only be considered if you have A at A Level Maths or equivalent)  
Experience in consultancy or internal roles that develop a similar skill-set (there are many roles and levels and we will consider candidates with varied experience from 1 year through to more experienced candidates)

Location and Travel Requirements:
Clients are based across the UK and Europe. Therefore travel and time away from home will be necessary Monday to Friday. During this time all reasonable expenses will be covered. You will not work at the weekends and will always be home by 6pm on a Friday.
 
To apply please Email CV toNB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Private Equity, Retail and Consumer Goods Strategy and Commercial Due Diligence Manager
description:
Our client is a global, full service advisory firm.  Their clients are industry leaders who benefit from the consulting firms deep industry and functional expertise in strategy, transaction services, operational performance and transformation management. In the UK, they focus on retail and consumer products, where they have unparalleled expertise and deep knowledge.  
Their UK Private Equity and Strategy Advisory practice is expanding due to the ongoing demand for our skills. They are seeking a Manager with experience in strategy and / or M&A consulting to retail and consumer products companies to continue growing the Private Equity and Strategy practice.
The types of projects the team undertakes are:

Commercial and operational due diligence: Recent examples of targets include a European fashion brand, branded food manufacturer and  retail services firm
Operational improvement projects for private equity portfolio companies: A recent example is redesigning the merchandising and planning processes for a European department store
Strategy projects for retail and consumer corporates and portfolio companies: Some examples include developing an international expansion strategy for a consumer goods company and developing a go-to-market strategy for an innovative new product

Because of the flexible and collaborative way that they work your remit may not be confined to projects in the Private Equity and Strategy area; you could also be involved in projects on retail operations, digital transformation, buying and merchandising or supply chain management, all of which allow you to more fully develop your consulting capabilities and expertise
The projects will be challenging and exciting; they certainly won’t be predictable. You’ll be expected to initiate, manage and maintain senior internal and client contacts, and to understand and scope client challenges and potential solutions to both deliver and sell.
The Role
Managing projects:  Assume full responsibility for successful execution of projects Manage the team and the broader client team to complete projects to the high standards for which the client is known Liaise with the client to ensure expectations and requirements are fully met or exceeded. Coach the client team members to develop the skills and knowledge required for successful project outcomes
Practice development: Develop thought leadership white papers and other marketing collateral to promote them as the go-to consultancy for Private Equity and Strategy in the retail and consumer space Work closely with their Private Equity practices in the U.S. and other markets not only on global projects but also to facilitate sharing of industry knowledge and best practices Develop and document new methodologies for approaching client problems and support the training of consultants As part of the business leadership team, help to set the direction of the business and drive it forward

Business development: Generate leads, contacts and new business by networking, attending events and identifying opportunities Act as a key constituent in the sales process by drafting presentations and proposals and  presenting at pitch meetings with existing and prospective clients Develop strong relationships with existing clients and ensure the quality of work delivered is consistently high in order to ensure repeat business
 
Candidate Experience & Qualifications

Strong academic background with an MBA and/ or a minimum 2:1 first degree in Business, Finance or equivalent from a top university. An accounting qualification is not necessary, but would be helpful
Direct experience managing complex strategy and/ or M&A projects and leading teams to achieve successful outcomes
Direct experience and / or expertise in the retail and consumer sector
Experience in the Private Equity practice of a consulting firm, or in an M&A advisory 
Strategy/ business development experience within  a major retailer or consumer goods company would be an advantage
Proven business development experience in a consulting environment or similar
High levels of personal motivation, presence and energy and a strong ability to communicate at all levels
Outstanding written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate complex problems or solutions in a way in which they are quickly understood
A genuine passion for retail and consumer products is essential

Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:, quoting reference number:TC001NB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Local Economic Development Consulting - Consultants and Managers
description:
Our client is a well-established provider of economic consultancy services with a core team of over 20 professionals based in England and Northern Ireland. 
 The team is comprised of highly skilled consultants, economists and researchers serving public, private and third sector clients in a diverse range of sectors across the UK and Europe.
 They specialise in business development and enterprise, innovation and technology transfer, inward investment, labour market and skills development, neighborhood renewal and social inclusion.
Role:
They are seeking to recruit an experienced and motivated Senior Consultant with expertise in the development of local economies. It is envisaged that the successful candidate will have extensive GB based experience of: the design, appraisal and evaluation of local economic development interventions; strategy development; and the governance/resourcing of place-based economic growth.
Specification:
The essential requirements for this post are: 

A strong academic record with numerical proficiency (minimum of 2.1 Honours Degree);
Excellent experience of winning and delivering Economic Consulting / Research projects, especially competitors eg SQW, Regeneris, Ekosgen, Ecorys etc.
Experience from: local authorities, Local Enterprise Partnerships, Government Departments etc)


Detailed knowledge of clients and the wider economic development policy environment in GB;
Excellent spoken and written communication, including experience of presenting complex ideas clearly and concisely to senior client teams;
Demonstrable experience of the delivery of high quality reports;
Excellent project management skills, including project planning and budget management;
Ability to meet deadlines in a client / quality focused environment;
High proficiency in MS Office including MS Office, Excel, PowerPoint; and
An in-depth knowledge of research 
 

Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk for further information
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:, quoting reference number:TC001NB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Group Financial Controller for FTSE Global Company
description:
My client is a high growth FTSE 250 company and a market leader in their field of engineering. Throughout the last 10 years, they have grown both organically and through acquisition and now have a truly global presence with offices on every continent. Due to restructuring within the business, they are looking for a Group Financial Controller to lead their team in their head office in Macclesfield.
As Group Financial Controller, you will drive continuous improvement of group reporting & financial and management accounting, financial systems and controls, whilst setting the standard for the Group. You will work closely with Finance globally to ensure accurate, timely and relevant financial information and plans which assist the Senior Management of the Company to produce and meet strategic goals The successful Group Financial Controller should have experience of leading high-performing teams at a senior level and a vision to continuously improve processes and outputs and define financial systems and processes that are high quality and efficient to operate. This will suit someone who has previously worked as a Group Financial Controller in a FTSE business.
This is an exciting and very high profile position within the group where you must have excellent interpersonal and strong technical accounting skills as you will report directly to CFO and will be a key member of the Senior Management Team. As this role is on an interim basis (initially 6 months), only candidates on a maximum of one months notice
Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

As our Head of Platform Engineering you'll be leading the overall development, implementation, and support of our Technology platforms. You'll ensure that our Technology solutions meet both our business and customer needs, and that supporting infrastructure is reliable, flexible, secure, and efficient.
Client Details
Leading multi national global media organisation who have just started a large scale IT Transformation along with Media, Sales departments.
Description
Head of Platform Engineering you'll be leading the overall development, implementation, and support of our Technology platforms. You'll ensure that our Technology solutions meet both our business and customer needs, and that supporting infrastructure is reliable, flexible, secure, and efficient.
The introduction of new technology is a fundamental part of our innovation strategy and you'll be identifying and implementing those that can help us deliver business value.
Building partnerships with suppliers to help us optimise costs, create shared value and reduce supplier related risks is something you'll relish.
Head of Platform Engineering key skills:

Experience of leadership of large, culturally diverse virtual teams in a global organisation
Developed and implemented innovative strategies for Technology sourcing and vendor management
Formulated strategies for the design, development, delivery and support of technology solutions and infrastructure
Developed organisational capability (people, processes, technology, knowledge)
Delivered benefits of global scale - and achieved optimal balance between cost and quality
Ensured continuous optimisation of the contribution of the suppliers to strategic objectives
Communicated and inspired confidence at a senior level with technical and non-technical audiences
Global strategy execution and change management experience with advanced stakeholder and risk management skills in situations of ambiguity
Knowledge and understanding of world class Technology organisations with a strong external perspective of developments in Technology
Experience of directing, leading, influencing and operating in a complex geographical / functional matrix organisation

Profile:

Experience of leadership of large, culturally diverse virtual teams in a global organisation

Experience of directing, leading, influencing and operating in a complex geographical / functional matrix organisation

Key Responsibilities:

Development and implement of the agreed target operating model with global governance and control in line with the technology strategy
Develop the resources and capability to meet current and future needs
Lead the investigation and introduction of new technologies and usage models so that business value is optimised
Work with the CIO and Technology senior leadership team to set Platform Engineering strategy and policies governing the direction and conduct of engineering and support processes including application of appropriate delivery methodologies and automation tools
Ensure engineering standards and platform architectures are aligned to Enterprise Architectures and standards
Lead the development of platform roadmaps and put in place assurance mechanisms that ensure the quality, stability, flexibility and sustainability of Technology solutions to meet current and future business requirements and service standards
Proactively engage and support all stakeholders to ensure common understanding of engineering governance, policies and processes

Head of Technology Transformation & PMO - Global Media Organisation
As our Head of Technology Transformation & PMO you'll lead and support the execution of our Technology strategy and associated multi-year investment plans.
Client Details
Global Media organisation who have just started a major IT transformation covering all departments like sales, marketing, IT.
Description
As our Head of Technology Transformation & PMO you'll lead and support the execution of our Technology strategy and associated multi-year investment plans.
Your role will see you aligning our strategy and operational plans to maximise the value of our investment. And you'll deliver transparent and predicable strategic objectives through global Project Management Office (PMO) capabilities
Position Requirements:

Experience of leadership in a global Technology organisation
Delivered transformational change in Technology organisations
Developed organisational capability (people, processes, technology, knowledge)
Developed processes and planning timetables to ensure Technology strategy supports Corporate strategy
Experience of innovation, strategy development and execution, planning and decision-making in a in a complex geographical / functional matrix organization. Strategic thinking will come naturally to you
Experience of leading the introduction, operation and improvement of a global planning and PMO capabilities
Knowledge and understanding of world class Technology organisations with a strong external perspective of developments in Technology
Experience of communicating and inspiring confidence at a senior level with technical and non-technical audiences
Technology governance and change management experience with advanced stakeholder and risk management skills in situations of ambiguity

Other preferred attributes:

Knowledge of the Events industry
Educated to degree level or equivalent with relevant Project / Programme management / P3O qualifications

Profile
Principal duties and responsibilities:

Develop, implement, communicate and maintain an operating model for strategic planning and the delivery of PMO capabilities.
Develop and maintain the Technology strategy; capture strategic issues and the options for supporting and influencing the business strategy
Align the Technology function and other business units on the strategic value of technology to maximize the creation of business value.
Translate Technology strategy and decisions into an agreed programmes and projects which will deliver strategic objectives with identifiable deliverables and resources to achieve the medium and long-term strategic objectives
Lead the execution of the Technology strategy through implementation of the IT operating model
Oversee overall project and operational plans and budgets required to support the Technology Strategy
Ensure the plan reflects business objectives and achievability
Manage the associated prioritisation processes
Develop, implement and manage standard global policies, processes and tools for Portfolio, Programme and Project management to ensure: Continued alignment with corporate strategies and objectives
Adoption / adherence to best practice, robust governance and quality assurance
Programmes and projects have an approved business case, and that this is kept under scrutiny
Identification and resolution of issues, risks, dependencies across programmes and projects
Optimal use of Technology resources across the global organisation
Learning is captured from successful and less successful initiatives and apply this to future initiatives
Proactively engage and support all stakeholders to ensure common understanding and ownership of strategic / operational planning processes, goals and targets
Provide value added information and insight required for effective decision making
Monitor and report progress against the strategy and operational plans
Manage and motivate teams in order to deliver required outcomes
Attract, develop and retain a pipeline of talent in line with required technical, professional, managerial and leadership capability
Develop, implement and maintain a culture and framework for innovation and continuous improvement
Lead and role model the required culture and behaviours

Job Offer
£95,000 to £120,000 + 30% Bonus + Package
