title: Head Of Finance - Entertainment
description:
Internationally renowned Entertainment business is currently looking to recruit an experienced Senior Finance Manager / Head of Finance to join their London based Global finance team.
Reporting to the Director of Finance, you will form an effective partnership with the senior management team within one of the largest business units; managing a small team, the role will responsible for the provision of insightful analysis to support decision making and strategy. The role will also ensure best practice across all regions, make recommendations and presentation directly to the Executive Board & senior stakeholders.
This is a highly visible multi-faceted role that will require excellent business partnering skills gained within a large international business, ideally within the Media, Entertainment or the Digital space.
Selected duties:

Form a close working partnership with the Regional finance teams to plan and execute the month-end close, consolidated reporting, quarterly forecasting, annual budget, 5-year plan and statutory reporting
Complete In-depth financial analysis, including KPI's and ad-hoc analysis to support decision making
Lead Balance Sheet review & cash-flow reporting
Supervise the maintenance of all database systems and present
Identify, and drive improvements to the management information, financial systems and decision making practices across all regions.

To apply for this role it is essential you possess the following:

ACA / CIMA Qualification with relevant post-qualification experience
Experience with financial modelling, KPI development and financial planning
Media experience is highly desirable
Strong interpersonal skills to manage internal relationships and effectively business partner

title: Director of Operations
description:
The Director of Operations plays a pivotal role in working with colleagues and partners to realise our vision; ‘inspiring Edinburgh to be a more active and healthy city’. Not surprisingly the responsibilities of the post are many and varied; customer experience, service developments, usage targets, budget management, health & safety, asset management, partnership and stakeholder relationships…we could go on. Whoever gets this job must be able to keep many balls in the air at the same time. And yes, they are all a priority! Consequently, to be in with a fighting chance, the person who applies must be in possession of an equally long list of skills and abilities. An energetic, enthusiastic leader with a positive, can-do attitude. An ability to make tough decisions and take your colleagues with you. A highly effective relationship former and keeper. Mental stamina of the sort that can cope with high pressure, competing demands and short time scales. Strong analytical, project management and change management skills.
 
This is an Executive Director level post, so applicants will also need to demonstrate a strong track record of strategic leadership and management at the highest level. In return, we’re offering one of the best rewards packages in the industry, with generous holiday allowance, pension and free membership across every one of our centres. If you like a challenge, are committed to making a difference and you think you have what it takes, apply today.

title: CFO
description:
The Opportunity
A highly profitable PE backed international manufacturing business, is currently seeking an experienced and commercial Chief Financial Officer who can step up to Chief Executive Officer in 12-18 months.
The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the finance team and ensuring the business's systems, processes, and controls are both fit for purpose and scalable as the business continues to grow in the UK and internationally.
The Role:

The CFO will need to investigate, analyse, and interpret all of the company's financial and commercial data and other vital KPIs in order to make accurate long term strategic decisions.
Responsible for M&A, banking relationships, external advisors, and engaging with the private equity backers
Proven experience of sorting out systems and processes to professionalise the finance function/team is essential.
Provide strategic decision making together with the senior management team and board of directors
Understand the major responsibilities that come with overseeing all financial aspects of the business
Deliver shareholder value through strategic focus on company objectives
Ensuring the cash and working capital management processes are in place

The Requirements:

Previous experience working as a CFO in manufacturing/distribution business
Qualified Accountant (ACA/ACCA/ACMA) who has been in an autonomous CFO role previously with the desire to step up to a CEO role in the future
Prior experience improving business performance in a highly competitive market
Private Equity experience is essential.
Used to working in a very fast paced environment, have strong leadership skills and a hands-on approach
A completer-finisher, adaptable, with the ability to build strong internal and external relationship

National Account Controller role with the view to progress to director level very quickly.
Client Details
My client is a branded blue chip organisation. Due to the confidentiality of this brief no further information can be disclosed unless candidates are selected for screening by Michael Page.
Description
This role is a pipeline role into a directorship with a large FMCG business, as National Account Controller you will manage a team of seven national account managers in the Foodservice/Away From Home channel. You will be responsible for increasing and driving the capability of the team and making changes where necessary. This business unit has a lot of 'white space' and category growth opportunity that this FMCG company wants to drive and be at the forefront of, so you need to be highly commercial and able to build and implement category and account growth strategy.
Profile
This role is being seen as a pipeline opportunity for a directorship within one of the most highly sought after employers in FMCG. This National Account Controller should be a cut above the rest and you should have outperformed your peer group to date in terms of results and career progression.
You must be adept at managing large teams of highly skilled individuals and ideally will have had experience at capability change / upskilling in the past. You must have worked with the away from home channel at some point, although this could be in any function, not necessarily national accounts.
There is flexibility on location for the right person as this company offer agile working but you must be willing to travel to London a couple of times a week.
Job Offer
c. £80 000 + benefits

Commercial Finance Manager - Music Publishing
Leading Music Publishing business is looking for a Commercial Finance Manager to provide strategic and analytical support to the company's senior management team, working closely with the European Managing Director and Head of European Sales & Marketing on a day-to-day basis. The successful applicant will drive financial insight into all areas of the company's business in Europe, especially in contributing to the company's sales and profit goals.
This varied role created out of growth will:

Provide insight into sales and margin performance and identify opportunities to increase profit
Provide margin analysis and set goals for maintaining and increasing as required
Analysis of ROI on investments
Design and develop the necessary financial reporting structures required to improve and grow profitable sales
Develop systems and procedures to drive analytical insight in product sales and marketing spend across B2B and B2C markets
Partner with sales, marketing, production, purchasing and logistics to contribute and influence decision making
Contribute to strategic product pricing and competitor analysis on an international basis dealing with different currencies, exchange rates and tax systems
Provide internal, market and competitive analysis for new business pitches
Provide general commercial financial support to management team

Skills and Qualifications Required:

Strong interpersonal skills including self-motivation, a confident approach, a desire to self-develop and an ability to influence others
Insightful and comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty
An ability to simplify complex situations and present complex information internally in an effective way.
Experienced in strategic financial analysis
Degree educated with appropriate professional qualifications in ACA, CIMA or ACCA
Experienced in managing financial systems and processes

Harvey Nash is working with a healthcare organisation to source an Interim Programme Director for a period of 8 months based in Central London (with regular travel). The ideal candidate will come from an academic background in health.
Overall, the Programme Director will work with the Head of Programme Delivery to provide leadership, support and direction in developing and implementing an integrated approach across the organisation’s footprint.
The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinating the development of bids for funding and helping to develop and evaluate how best to scale-up the use of evidence-based practice in new models of care for patient benefit. Working with partners in primary, community, social care and secondary care along with patients and the public and local authorities, the role will provide leadership in responding to Sustainability & Transformation Partnership (STPs) strategies and transformation plans, leading towards the successful transition to Accountable Care across partners.
Key responsibilities:

Manage a team of 35 staff
Lead the development of strategy for the programme, and supporting business plan for operational delivery
Ensure the programme of work is comprehensive across service delivery, research and education, and provides opportunities to support delivery and evaluation of innovative solutions
Bring strategic and policy insight whilst leading the development of content by staying on top of new developments in the field
Represent the organisation at relevant partner forums including System Transformation Boards and leadership summits; and consulting widely with stakeholders to ensure local ownership of development and delivery of the programme
Support development of bespoke fee-for-service and other targeted commercial activity for the programme as required by partners and in line with their values and the objectives of the programme
Establish effective leadership relationships with relevant theme leaders across the partner organisations to facilitate inter-organisational work and other activities as required by the partners
Coordinate the implementation of agreed projects in conjunction with partner organisations and present progress and performance reports to the Board
Coordinate and support applications for programme grants from major funding agencies and identify opportunities for and establish funding from other organisations as appropriate
Develop effective and influential relationships with key external organisations such as higher education, research funding organisations, the NHS and its Arm’s Length Bodies, Local Authorities, industry, influential organisations such as think tanks, NIHR, DH, etc.
Managing the team and overseeing their programmes of work; ensuring team members are supported in their personal and professional development in line with good practice and all local policies.

Essential attributes and skills:

Demonstrable track record of leading positive change with excellent leadership, influencing and communication skills
Track record of leading or participating in successful applications for programme grants from major funding agencies
Ability to communicate complex and challenging issues to stakeholders in science and healthcare and more widely across academia, the NHS and government
Experience of formulating and delivering a strategic plan and experience of strategic leadership to drive new models of care
Relevant clinical or managerial qualifications plus a higher academic degree, e.g. MD/MS or PhD or evidence of an equivalent level in research publications
Understanding of the role and remit of the NHS; awareness of relevant NHS policy; and understanding of the importance of clinical and research governance in clinical service delivery

If your skills match the above criteria and you have health experience, please send your CV to josh.blackman@harveynash.com

title: Project Manager
description:
Responsible to: Operations DirectorResponsible for: NoneGrade of post: Spot Point £40,000 per annumHours of work: 35 hours per weekWork location: Wolverhampton with the ability to travel in a timely manner to customer sites throughout the West Midlands and beyondJob Purpose: ........ To ensure that key customers major apprenticeship programmes are planned, implemented and delivered within quality, time and budget targets, managing associated risks to the satisfaction of the customer and maximizing the profit potential for the College.Key ResponsibilitiesManaging TasksPlanningShort term, long term, priorities, objectives, schedules, revising plans, adjusting policy, anticipating problems/problem solving etcEg: To effectively project plan all major projects within the area by leading on the outline and detail of the plan. To ensure that each plan is effectively developed with tasks and milestones prioritised. To monitor implementation of the plan adjusting where necessary to ensure that the quality is maintained and the project delivered to customer expectations whilst ensuring that the college maximises profit potential. To be able to multi-task with projects ensuring that the milestones hit agreed deadlines for all projects. To maintain a clear focus on delivery.Managing TasksImplementing/Co-ordinatingOrganising resources, admin systems, allocating, arranging events, ensuring efficient co-ordination etcEg: To ensure that the scale, complexity of the project are taken into consideration and the project delivered to time without compromising quality. To ensure that the customers are kept informed of the project deliverables. Resources are sourced, managed and delivered. To ensure that the delivery teams in the College are able to deliver on the projects at the right time, with the right quality of provision to maximise productivity and quality. To develop resources as necessary to effectively deliver projects. To ensure an effective handover to the Customer Relationship Team (Account Managers) following project implementation.Managing TasksReviewing/Evaluating (Systems/Methods)Assessing feasibility, assess compliance, reports, alternatives, efficiency, numerical data, projects and designs etcEg: To contribute to the quality cycle, ensuring that the quality control and quality improvement are auditable, effective and fit for purpose. To monitor the effectiveness of each project at key stages and when completed, review lessons learnt and ensure that these are captured, shared with the senior management team, and implemented into future projects.Working with InformationDecidingOwn initiative, in conjunction with others, ruling on procedure, time pressure, decisions affecting people etcEg: To lead on the projects ensuring that others work effectively to ensure that the project is delivered. To decide where employer’s training needs map against funded and full cost programmes and ensure that the project is produced to fulfil customer needs and College profitability. Once the project is scoped to deliver this to the customer to ensure that their needs are met. To then deliver the project.CommunicatingRepresenting/Selling (products or services)Contacting customers, new/established customers, answering enquiries, making enquiries, negotiating etcEg: To represent the Company/College at internal and external meetings/events to maximise exposure for our services. To propose additional products where appropriate and build into the projects to maximise profitability for the Company/College. To provide a confident relationship with other contributors to the project.AdministeringClerical/Administrative functionsRoutine administration, records, forms, typing, filing, handling mail, managing appointments etc Eg: To co-ordinate and deliver information in the form of reports for key stakeholders, partners and the senior team on the status of projects and work. To ensure that all work produced is to a high quality standard and delivered at appropriate times. To be able to produce high quality written information, presented effectively to all stakeholders without assistance. CommunicatingInforming/ReportingAdvising, presenting, training sessions, briefing, giving instructions, informing verbally/in writing etcEg: To be able to produce presentations and deliver these effectively for all stakeholders. To be able to produce briefings and deliver these to stakeholders, to sell and engage with the plans.CommunicatingSelling/InfluencingContacting customers, products and services, making a case, arguing, challenging, advising etcEg: To be able to build effective relationships with all stakeholders, challenging and advising as appropriate whilst ensuring a first class service is delivered at all times. To build effective rapport so that our customers become repeat customers.Other Duties and Responsibilities·To carry out any other duties as directed by your Line Manager.SafeguardingThe College is committed to safeguarding and protecting the welfare of learners and expects all who work with or on behalf of the College to share this commitment. All roles within the College therefore are subject to DBS regulations.The College considers that the job holder for this role should have a DBS Enhanced disclosure. ValuesOur values are: putting the student at the heart of every decision we make; ensuring that all students and colleagues are valued and respected; everyone is accountable for their actions; everyone is empowered to find ways to overcome obstacles and we have a clear vision and move towards it. Our compulsory DNA review process is based on these values and for this role you are expected to have the following level of personal attributes:Respect – Level CAccountability – Level CAccountability through team – Level CVision – Level CEmpowerment – Level CStudent Focus – Level CEquality and DiversityWe are committed to the promotion of equality of opportunity in all of our activities and to encouraging access to our College from all groups irrespective of race, gender, age, disability or sexual orientation. We are working to create an environment in which cultural diversity and individual difference are positively valued in an atmosphere free from harassment and discrimination. We take our legal and moral obligations with respect to equal opportunities seriously and welcome dialogue with groups and individuals on ways in which our equal opportunities policies and practice can be enhanced. Health and SafetyTo comply with fire, environment and health and safety duties as identified in the current college health, safety and environmental policies and to maintain an awareness and observation of these regulations (as identified and available on the staff intranet). To maintain an awareness of other college fire, environment and health and safety duties as they relate to your employment.

title: Senior Buyer
description:
Are you a Senior Buyer with experience in a manufacturing industry such as Automotive, Defence, Aerospace or any other heavy manufacturing & engineering environment? Procurement People are proud to be working a with a global world renowned manufacturing business who are looking to add an experienced Senior Buyer to their successful team. The successful candidate will help to develop strategy for range of commodities across the business keeping in mind the core components of price and quality with the wider needs of the business.• Develop and maintain commodity strategies for a range of commodities, ensuring that the business is kept up to date on commercial and technical developments, as well as potential suppliers• Evaluate cost data and quotation analysis and identify cost saving opportunities• Identify supplier risk and develop robust risk mitigation strategies where necessary• Develop and maintain good supplier relationships• Full procurement/ supply chain ownership for key suppliersAs the successful Senior Buyer you will have…•	A relevant business studies, supply chain, procurement or engineering related qualification.•	Good communication skills and the ability to liaise confidently with Design and Manufacturing colleagues in addition to external suppliers and other Buyers•	Good negotiation, project management and problem solving skills.•	The ability to apply logical reasoning to situations and strong organisational skills.•	Good commercial awareness and business acumen•	Strong numerical, verbal and written skills and experience of concise and accurate report writing.•	Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office•	The flexibility to travel worldwide for supplier visits.This is a fantastic opportunity to join a world leading and highly regarded organisation. You will be rewarded with a salary of £35,000-£45,000 per annum plus a benefits scheme. The organisation have a high retention rate as it values the continued development of it's staff and provides a clear and structured career development plan accordingly. Don't miss out on this great opportunity. If you are an experienced Senior Buyer with the relevant experience above or looking to transition into a Procurement career, then please apply with a copy of your CV. Please feel free to call Chris Jackson on 0121 272 8260 to discuss your application in more detail.

title: QHSE MANAGER
description:
Advanced Insulation, incorporating its buoyancy and fendering division Manuplas, is a fast-growing company that specialises in the manufacture and supply of unique insulation and fire protection systems. We are looking for a QHSE Manager based at the company’s Plymouth facility. The role may involve travel within the UK as well as some international travel as required.The successful candidate should ideally, but not essentially, be qualified to degree level, or equivalent, in a relevant discipline, must have a creative and innovative approach to problem solving, whilst being able to work effectively as part of a team. The ability to work consistently and methodically to a high standard of accuracy and quality is essential. The successful candidate will need to have:+Experience of quality management systems and the ISO9001 standard.+Experience of safety management systems, carrying out risk assessments, knowledge of health and safety legislation (e.g. COSHH, LOLER, PUWER).+Knowledge of ISO14001 and OHSAS18001 standard requirements useful but not essential.+Ability to write detailed procedures and work instructions.+Effective problem solving attitude to be able to deal with incident and non-conformance investigations.+Ability to train and communicate effectively to others.+Proactive, collaborative and target driven approach to work. 


Contact: Maria Mackenzie
        

Reference: Totaljobs/PMM-MM-1016

title: Customer Service Supervisor
description:
If you're looking for a more rewarding summer, we're helping the South West Line into London Waterloo with their blockade project. Which will positively transform the journeys of millions of people. The South West line is one of the busiest, with half a million passengers every day, £800 million investment in passenger improvement will give the public Extra platforms, new longer trains and improved passenger facilities. The project will start in August 2017; as a result of this platform 1-9 In London Waterloo will be closed for 23 days. So, unfortunately Journeys will be affected whilst the work is completed.That's where you come in; showcasing great customer service, you will lead a team to assist passengers at one of our stations across the line by ensuring all passengers are greeted in a timely fashion, encouraging your team to pull out all the stops to make the customers journey that extra bit special in time of major disruption. To join our team in keeping the stations up and running you will be demonstrating leadership skills, be presentable, warm and friendly by nature and most importantly be driven to provide and your team a great customer experience every time. We'll also ask you to:*Be available to work for a minimum period of 4 weeks*Be flexible to work shifts and weekends*Be able to get yourself to and from work in time for shift *Be happy to wear a uniform to work. We'll ask you to provide a basic uniform of black trousers/skirt and white shirt/blouse and we'll make sure you're one of the team by adding the finishing touches such as a company scarf or tie, branded Hi-viz name badge and lanyard.We'll be holding hiring events week commencing 5th June in a number of locations across the South west train line.Please register your interest by applying to the advertisement.Benefits: Free travel on South West Lines for the duration of the project for successful candidates. Adecco is an equal opportunities employer. If you do not hear from one of our consultants within 7 days of applying for this role, please assume you have been unsuccessful in this instance. Your CV will be kept on file and you will be considered for future vacancies that match your skills. Adecco is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy. The Adecco Group UK & Ireland is an Equal Opportunities Employer.
    


Contact: Marcia Priestly
        

Reference: Totaljobs/Waterloo Sup

title: Employer Liaison Operations
description:
Responsible to: Director of OperationsGrade of post: Scale SO1/2 - £26,528 - £30,765 per annum Hours of work: 37 per week Work location: Main base Wolverhampton but post requires regular regional travel Job Purpose: To provide a sales and account management service to  employers, meeting challenging targets and enhancing the  reputation of the CollegeKey Responsibilities1.To undertake a range of direct sales approaches to increase employer sales, includingtelesales activity to meet challenging targets2.To promote the products and services of the College to employers, undertaking organisational needs analyses and working with College staff to produce proposals to meet agreed objectives3.To actively engage with employer representative groups and stakeholders, ensuring that the full range of services, facilities and expertise that the College has to offer is communicated effectively.4.To participate in networking events, open days, careers fairs and local/community events to promote the College and all of its services. 5.To act as a main point of contact for employer enquiries and ensure that these are responded to efficiently in line with team procedures.6.To maintain accurate records of employer contacts and communicate relevant information to College staff in a timely manner.7.To participate in the review and evaluation of services provided to employers by the College, identifying opportunities for positive PR, case studies and competition entry.Other Duties and Responsibilities·To carry out all duties in accordance with the College’s Health and Safety policies and procedures.·To carry out any other duties as directed by your Line Manager.SafeguardingThe College is committed to safeguarding and protecting the welfare of learners and expects all who work with or on behalf of the College to share this commitment. All roles within the College therefore are subject to DBS regulations.The College considers that the job holder for this role should have a DBS Enhanced. ValuesOur values are: putting the student at the heart of every decision we make; ensuring that all students and colleagues are valued and respected; everyone is accountable for their actions; everyone is empowered to find ways to overcome obstacles and we have a clear vision and move towards it. Our compulsory DNA review process is based on these values and for this role you are expected to have the following level of personal attributes:Respect – Level CAccountability – Level CAccountability through team – Level CVision – Level CEmpowerment – Level CStudent Focus – Level CEquality and DiversityWe are committed to the promotion of equality of opportunity in all of our activities and to encouraging access to our College from all groups irrespective of race, gender, age, disability or sexual orientation. We are working to create an environment in which cultural diversity and individual difference are positively valued in an atmosphere free from harassment and discrimination. We take our legal and moral obligations with respect to equal opportunities seriously and welcome dialogue with groups and individuals on ways in which our equal opportunities policies and practice can be enhanced. 


Contact: RECRUITMENT TEAM
        

Reference: Totaljobs/TOTAL JOBS

title: Recruitment Business Partner, Management Consultancy, £55,000-£60,000
description:
The client: A leading consultancy within the field of financial services currently in the middle of an exciting growth phase. They employ best-of-class consultants who can advise clients on technology, strategy, change and much more. They are ambitious, established and set themselves apart from the corporate environment of professional services.In the midst of this time of growth, they require an excellent Recruitment Business Partner to support across the business in finding the best consultants to join their clients. Also, it is imperative for this role that you have people management experience ideally - or certainly you must have mentored a team.Their function is expanding and whilst they need someone who can find the best talent, they also need someone who can be a great leader! Reporting directly into the Head of Recruitment, you will carry out the full lifecycle, from defining job roles with Partners, to deciding on appropriate process, building talent pipelines, actively headhunting for consultants and managing the candidate experience. Relationship building is key in finding the best talent and you must be someone who enjoys maintaining those relationships. You will have amazing exposure to the business, lots of autonomy and your own area.You will work closely with the rest of the team to identify recruitment solutions that are tailored to the business’ need. This role needs someone flexible in style, commercial in thought and highly-proactive in approach.You will partner closely with the business, attend strategy meetings and deliver on a number of key vacancies. To be considered for this role, you must:Have extensive recruitment experience within a highly commercial environment.Be a highly capable communicator, with strong relationship management skills at senior levels.Have experience of managing diverse and multi-channel recruitment campaigns with an emphasis on direct sourcing, specifically head hunting, networking and building a talent pipeline for the business.Have the confidence and gravitas required for a fast-paced role, but also a flexible and team-focused style.Be able to hit the ground running, capable of making a lasting difference from Day 1.

title: Senior Quantity Surveyor
description:
Job Title:Senior Quantity SurveyorHours:39 Hours per WeekLocations:CambuslangEmployer:Keepmoat Regeneration ScotlandJob Type:Full Time PermanentKeepmoat Regeneration, part of the ENGIE Group, is the leading provider of regeneration services in the UK.Keepmoat Regeneration designs, builds, refurbishes and maintains homes, buildings and the facilities, places and spaces that support our communities.We work in partnership with housing associations, local authorities, the private sector and residents to invest in local communities, strengthen local economies and transform lives. We specialise in working with public and private sector landowners and landlords, bringing brownfield sites into active use and breathing new life into neighbourhoods across the UK. We are passionate about maximising the social and economic benefits wherever we work, which is why we employ local people and suppliers and work closely with our residents.Purpose of the Role:The main purpose of the role is to be a key member of the Regional Commercial Team in delivering profitability for the region through sub-contractor selection and procurement, cost planning and control and general commercial input and acumen.Key Responsibilities:To take responsibility, control and accountability of all aspects of the commercial, financial and contractual elements of designated projects to protect the company’s legal and contractual obligations and maximise contribution.This is to include procurement of sub-contractors to meet programme and budget, ensuring applications and valuations are completed in line with the contract terms, managing and monitoring costs and cost reports and understanding, implementing and adhering to the company SHEQ policy/strategy.What we are looking for:·Experience in New Build and Refurbishment projects.·Experience in traditional and design and build projects ·Post graduate experience within a surveying position reporting to either a senior surveyor or a commercial manager·Up to date relevant knowledge of building legislation.·Up to date relevant knowledge of Health and Safety legislation.·Team commitment.·Demonstrates eye for detail and commitment to delivering excellent standards.·Excellent organisational skills.·Effectively manage time in order to meet deadlines.·Professional attitude and approach to work.·Ability to competently operate MS Office (Word & Excel).Why work for us?At Keepmoat Regeneration we pride ourselves on being a great place to work. As the market leader in our industry we want to ensure that we attract, motivate and retain the best people who can deliver the best service for our customers. We offer you:·Competitive rates of pay – We regularly check our pay against our competitors to make sure they reflect our position as market leader. We also review our pay every year.·Bonus Scheme – Our annual bonus scheme is linked to team and company performance.·Special offers for staff – We run a range of offers and discounts exclusively for our employees including holidays, health club memberships and days out.·Trust – We encourage you to come up with ideas and get the most out of your job with us.·Recognition – We have a scheme to reward people who go the extra mile for our company.·Development – we offer genuine development opportunities to progress your career.Please note that due to the high level of applications, if you have not been contacted within 5 days of the closing date please assume your application has not been successful.



Contact: Joanna Clark
        

Reference: Totaljobs/KMR/SC/017

title: Area Manager
description:
Established in 1981, Poundstretcher is the UK’s leading variety discount retailer for quality products across the ‘Poundstretcher’, “Pet Hut” and ‘Pound Deals’ brands. With 400 stores nationwide, Poundstretcher stocks a huge selection of great value products at competitive prices, including food, toiletries, kitchenware, bedding, bathroom products, furniture, electric goods, toys and pet care.We are currently looking to recruit an Area Manager, to cover our Swindon Gloucestershire, This is a demanding fast paced role and requires the successful candidate to be extremely organised.Purpose of RoleLeading and providing support to an average of 16 retail stores simultaneously. Motivating a team of managers to achieve business objectives. Translating goals into short and long-term action plans consistent with company objectives to maximize and sustain profitable sales growth. Partner with regional controllers and head office in the development of operating priorities, accountability standards, communication and planning/training.Key Responsibilities:SalesDrive area sales to the agreed budgets (LFL and target)Ensure basket growth is achievedCost ControlManage payroll and ensure area comes in line with budgetManage the following additional controllable costs within the areaRefuseCarrier BagsTill Shorts/OveragesPetty CashEnergy SavingCompliance & Operational StandardAchieve high store standards in all storesClean and tidy – secure clutter free aisles and clean floors at all timesFull – secure optimal fill level throughout trading hoursPricing – full compliance on pricing and POSAll bay plans completed as per company directiveAdvocate exceptional customer services practicesMaintain a safe working environmentDrive compliance with operational and general company guidelinesSecure store staff rota planning within the agreed budget in each store to achieve efficient workflow, task planning and follow up in all areas of the storeEnsure optimal till manning and customer service in each store through planning based on customer footfallVisit all stores within a two week period.LeadershipDemonstrate a high level of coaching, motivation and energy within the areaKeep a high level of communication and information flow within the areaEncourage and support individual management developmentFacilitate and coordinate with HR in regards to the area training and HR related issuesEnsure monthly manager meetings are held to discuss sales performance and operational standardsConduct quarterly reviews on a 1-1 basis with store managers discussing performance and ensure succession planning is in place throughout the areaPeople Management/TrainingEnsuring that employees are given appropriate training to carry out their jobs, and additional training and development to enhance their abilities in preparation for progression to more senior positions.Develop the skills and competence of staff through training, coaching and on the job developmentEnsure training records are updated and Personal Development Plans are completedDeliver new starter induction training and conduct probationary reviews when requiredDevelop a robust succession planning process for members of the team including the recognition of top performersPerformance reviews and business directives setAccountability of projects to develop teamsHealth & SafetyTraining/ProcessComplianceEnsure all risk assessments are completed to the correct standardManagers trained to understand how to do these properlyShrinkageManage shrinkage and ensure this is kept to a minimum in all stores by ensuring all company policies and procedures are adhered to at all times.Analysis of results (cycle counts, sns etc..) and check compliance on regular actions issued through monthly review and LP newsletter.Check reason code controls on the following:63 In store Damage67 WH Damage68 Customer Return**Stock Management*Enforce high standards in store warehouses and stock rooms through structured stock management and warehouse planning in each store.Secure stock file accuracy through structure and planning in cycle counts within each store.Ensure area compliance with back office procedures through structure in each storeStaff SchedulingTwilights in place on delivery shiftsRecovery shift in place on SaturdayReplenishment shifts in place based on productivity (1hr per pallet)Base rotas in place for replenishment shifts, till hours and management coverStore/deputy managers running weekends especially SaturdaysSchedules balanced to reflect business needsHolidays planned in advance to ensure store is covered all the timeManagers kept in their own stores as much as possible unless being developed on a projectCommunication and ReportingMonitor and analyse area reporting and trends, provide recommendations based on daily, weekly and/or monthly HQ reportsInitiate regular review of sales reports with store managersWork Experience2 years of large store retail management experienceExternal candidates should have at least up to 2 years multi-site experience.KPIsAchieve area Sales budget (LFL and target)Achieve area salary budgets in % of turnoverAchieve area shrinkage budgetArea profits as per budget90 percent of area stores in “green” store standardsAchieve 95% availability on core rangeTake ownership of key company compliance issuesKey AttributesLeadership (leading on a distance)High level of integrityHigh energy levelTeam playerFact based approach to problem solvingAt Poundstretcher we place real value in our employees, and appreciate the hard work that all our staff put in. As a result we like to compensate our employees with a competitive salary based on experience and an excellent benefits package.If you have the passion, drive and commitment to succeed then Apply todayNO AGENCIESJob Type: Full-timeRequired experience:multi-site: 2 yearsSales: 1 yearManagement: 1 yearApplication QuestionsYou have requested that Indeed ask candidates the following questions:How many years of multi-site experience do you have?How many years of Sales experience do you have?How many years of Management experience do you have?

Carillion Rail are seeking a Senior Document Controller, the successful candidate will be embedded into the Midland Main Line project team based in Derby and will be responsible for the document control activities on site plus developing current process/policies and training new staff members. To provide effective management of Information and model validation at project/bid level, in line with our systems and processes using 4Projects/other CDE systems. This will apply to any project over £50M or group of smaller projects as well as collating and managing contractors proposals submissions for single/multiple bid submissions. Role requires the candidate to have Good knowledge of collaboration and BiM tools as well and understanding of CP compilation.Key Responsibilities·Collaboration with external and internal team members. ·Deliver and comply with the National deployment Strategy. ·Maintain Project/bid IMP as directed by the Project lead. Provide data for, and assist in compilation of, monthly reports required by DM. ·Assist in the development and improvement of processes and protocols forwarding any proposals to the IM and SiM. ·Support the project team with any technical issues to be resolved with 4Projects and report any issues unresolved to the Information Manager. ·Assist in the deployment of 4 Projects/other CDEs on projects/bids, requesting site set up on behalf of the team. ·Compile IMP for Project or Bid. ·Provide additional training to users and Information controllers who join the project/bid. ·Provide support to projects and Bid teams with any IM or 4Projects/other CDE issues. ·Manage the invitations to 4Projects/other CDEs. ·Manage incoming electronic information ensuring compliance with protocols, and ensure registration/distribute in accordance with the Design Management Plan and Information Management Plan. ·Quality assure all incoming information against the IMP and feedback any issues back to the issuers, providing guidance where required. ·Manage/maintain hard copy requirements for the project team. ·Monitor/record received information against agreed programme. ·Perform security checks as defined in the IMP. ·Distribute information in line with the IMP. ·Carry out model validation and information validation of all models produced on the project to ensure aligned with both the Project BEP and the IMP. ·Undertake specific model federation exercises for the Design management team as and when requested. ·Arrange printing and delivery of drawings/documents to site as required. ·Take the lead and be the interface of O&M/H&S File production. ·Assign responsibilities to managers to validate commissioning date/O&Ms and COBIe data. Coordinate COBie federation to ensure consistency.Reward Package26 days annual leave + 8 bank holidayswith the opportunity to buy more holidays once you have been with us for a short whileBUPA Healthcare Insurance (single cover with option to 'trade up' to cover your familyPension PlanCarillion 'Thank You' Scheme, which offers flexible, tax efficient benefits such as child care vouchers, cycle to work scheme & discounts on high street brands


Contact: Carillion Careers

East Londoners are you looking for an easy commute? This well-established and award-winning creative agency based in East London (on the Central Line!) is looking for a Project Manager to support their design team in the delivery of branding, print, digital and packaging projects. They are people-centric, very collaborative, friendly and share a common love for consumer brands and great design. A really nice team to learn from and grow with.
As the key Project Manager you will be client-facing, have excellent verbal and written communication skills, be super organised, methodical and self-motivated. You'll be confident and thrive in an environment where initiative and hard work are valued and rewarded. Working alongside the Studio Manager and Managing Director you will ensure tasks are organised and project budgets set and kept to, as well as source and arrange print. As you progress into the role you will have the opportunity to grow your own accounts, develop solid partnerships and advise on budgets, working schedules, resources, etc.
Being part of a small team means that everyone is hands-on and happy to get stuck in. As the Project Manager you will be expected to get involved in the day to day essentials of studio life! Everything from answering the phone, to co-ordinating shared calendars with their other office in Yorkshire and their satellite office in London.
So if this sounds like the right challenge for you - wait no longer, send your CV ASAP. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Business Development Manager Business Intelligence
description:
Our client established in  1981 is  a key adviser to worldwide  corporate, financial and government decision-makers and thought leaders.  They are  looking to hire a consultative, outgoing and entrepreneurial Business Development Manager (BDM) for the UK 
This position will be responsible for building the reports subscription research business within this territory, including new business sales and upselling and servicing existing clients.  You will also focus on selling subscription services to targeted customer lists under the supervision of the Director of Business Development. This position will be an integral part of their growth plans for EMEA and is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing company at the forefront of the industry. An interest in Macro Economic s would be a big plus.
Your key responsibilities within this role would be;
Sales and Client Management

Initiate create, execute and close sales of subscription services, typically through phone sales,  webinars and face to face meetings
Research, create and implement sales plans for your assigned sectors/territory in alignment with the Director of Business Development’s overall regional business plan
Through market analysis, identify key companies in the territory, key individuals within companies, and establish relationships with the purpose of closing sales
Coordinate sector business development initiatives and build a pipeline for the respective sector or country
Manage relationships with existing clients to ensure renewals and upsell new subscription products
Maintain a knowledge of global economic and business trends to facilitate conversations with clients
Develop a strong knowledge of the subscription products and become proficient at providing demonstrations of the services
Create sales presentations and lead webinars and meetings with prospective clients
	Internal Communication

Prepare weekly sales reports to be shared with senior management
Communicate opportunities, challenges and feedback to rest of immediate team
Ensure contact details of new leads and prospects are recorded
Ensure details and outcomes from meetings and calls are recorded
Record and share insight and learnings on the prospects, clients and leads and share with rest of the team
	Marketing and Product Enhancements



Follow up on marketing campaigns to sell various subscription services
Help organize, and where needed manage marketing events to raise brand profile and increase sales opportunities
Provide feedback and suggest product improvements to product teams, based on client interaction and  competitor analysis
	Skills and Experience:  Required



Masters degree highly desirable
A proven  sales track record, with at least 5 years of experience
Experience of selling in a B2B environment
Must be highly organized and able to manage multiple projects at once
You must have strong presentation and writing skills
You must have knowledge of MicrosoftWord, Excel, and PowerPoint
You must be a self-starter, with the drive to set and reach ambitious goals
A  team player
Fluent English, another  European Language would be a plus
	Skills and Experience:  Desired



Economics or international affairs degree or masters
Advanced degree is highly preferred
Research, economic or business sales experience
Experience selling to information specialists and executives


Phone sales and Webex experience along with face to face selling

title: Data & CRM officer - Financial Services
description:
The CompanyGround breaking financial services company, consisting of an exceptional team of talented marketers working in a fast moving, ever changing supportive environment. Superb riverside offices - Central London.The Role This is an exciting, newly created role. As Data and CRM officer you will be responsible for defining good data management across the marketing department. You'll work closely with a dedicated project team to help put in place data management and a CRM data management system. You'll be the linchpin of the team - the 'go to' data person - you'll also oversee data management, ensuring it's compliant with legal and data protection regulations.About You I'm looking for a data/CRM officer (executive) who has gained some previous experience in B2B/membership marketing department. You would have had exposure to managing end to end data process and systems - this experience could be as a product provider, third party administration organisation, in-house or via a consultancy. You will have detailed understanding of database marketing and knowledge of how to manage data, including understanding of regulatory and legal issues (specifically UK Data Protection Act, General Data Protection Regulation, Privacy or Electronic Communications Regulations). You will have a high attention to detail, advanced MS office and excel skills and strong CRM skills ideally within Microsoft dynamics. What's key above all is 'attitude' - they're looking for someone who's wanting to develop their career, someone who's ambitious, keen to learn, interested in making their mark and someone who's wanting to make an impact in the future marketing strategy and teamWhat a great role! To apply for the Data and CRM Officer, press the 'Apply Now' button, they want to interview ASAP.

Wren Kitchens are a family owned manufacturer, installer and retailer of fitted kitchens. We have 61 showrooms across the UK and due to our continued success, we will be opening several more throughout the year. We’re passionate about kitchens and in providing a great service for our customers. We are now looking for an Operations Manager, to manage all showroom operational and administration tasks. You'll support the General Manager and Sales Manager in the delivery of a smooth and efficient service, in order to meet the needs of our customers.You'll work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday.At Wren we believe in growing our talent. We will invest in your development and give you opportunities to thrive in your career. When you join, you'll be enrolled onto our 6-month Retail Management Induction programme, where you'll learn everything that it takes to be a successful Operations Manager.The ideal candidate will have kitchen industry experience.Critical Purpose of Role:- Arrange and manage daily diaries for all team members (Designers, Surveyors and Information Advisors)- Monitor free issues and plan checks and ensure all estimate sheets are fully completed and uploaded.- Manage customer service queries & escalate to the centre.- Ensure high standards are maintained all times, team are dressed correctly and have good personal hygiene, showroom standards (including windows, doors, signs and lighting), Surveyors vans and warehouse standards are maintained.- To ensure point of sale is correct and displayed to planograms and all replacements/missing items are ordered.- Contacting customers who have had a survey completed to check quality of work.- Ensure Designers contact customers six weeks prior to delivery date to sign off plan, contract and payment in full- Liaise with the Transport team regarding outstanding orders.- Improve the showrooms NPS results ensuring our customers receive great service.- Ensure banking & safe reconciliation are completed as per company procedure- Ensure all Head Office communications are cascaded to showroom employees- All HR processes are adhered to including New Starters paperwork, change forms, leaver’s forms and all attendance records are emailed to central HR.- Managing Staff rotas and holidays, ensuring all holiday requests are booked on self-service.- Ensure all Health & Safety guideline and processes are adhered to by all employeesMain Responsibilities- Support the General Manager in managing the end to end showroom strategy; engagement, design, delivery and installation- Supporting the showroom team to deliver achieve their personal targets, service standards and Wren values by conducting monthly reviews and providing coaching and mentoring- Monitoring of compliance processes to ensure all required process are followed and paperwork completed- Process expert within the showroom and to attend regular "train the trainer" sessions- Working with the General Manager to identify individual training requirements across the showroom team and deliver the training- Handle escalations and issue resolution where requiredDesired:- 1-2 years management experience- Computer literate including Microsoft programmes- Ability to work calmly under pressure, and able to prioritise their workload whilst maintaining attention for detail.- Experience in customer facing rolesSome Benefits of Working for Us- Fantastic pay – best pay package in the kitchen sector- Amazing perks & benefits – free Tastecard, half price cinema tickets, discounts off high street shopping- Great career opportunities with ongoing expert training and ambitious expansion plans- Amazing incentives during our peak seasons


Contact: Wren Kitchens
        

Reference: Totaljobs/tpopscatford-3105

3aaa Apprenticeships, a Grade 1 Outstanding Ofsted awarded training provider, specialising in the delivery of Professional Services Apprenticeships have an exciting opportunity for a Delivery Manager.The successful candidate will have overall responsibility for the delivery of Apprenticeship activity for their cluster and will be accountable for achievements against all set KPIs and measurements.Delivery Managers have responsibility for all quality and compliance requirements within the delivery of the apprentice journey. You will be an advocate for 3aaa Apprenticeships, actively promoting our Vision, Mission and Values.What you'll be doing - includes but not limited to:Responsibility for the recruitment and induction of new staff members for your teamLine management of cluster delivery staff, including, but not limited to, trainers, trainers/assessors, assessors and apprenticesComplete scheduled and structured one to ones with all staff membersActively performance manage all members within your delivery team to ensure operational KPIs are achievedProvide or facilitate support, coaching and mentoring for the cluster staffEnsure academies are fully compliant with both funding and quality requirements Maintain appropriate tracking systems relating to quality, compliance, management and assessmentAll applicants require a full clean driving license and have their own transport. There is a requirement to pass an Enhanced DBS check. This will be paid for by 3aaa Apprenticeships.Due to the nature of this role, flexibility and willingness to travel is essential.What we need from you. EssentialExperience of managing and leading a team to perform Experience of contractual paperworkExcellent organisational skills Developed communication skills Good level of IT literacy (Excel in particular) Driving licence Desirable Knowledge of the FE sector and funded programs First Aid qualified IQA/Assessor experience About us3aaa Apprenticeships is an Ofsted Grade 1 Outstanding training provider specialising in the delivery of apprenticeship programmes across the country. We aim to provide the next generation of high quality IT employees, Digital Marketing executives, Financial Services staff, Managers and Accountants to feed the demand for qualified professionals through the exceptional delivery of Level 3 & 4 training and professional qualifications. We also have a significant number of Levy paying clients from Blue Chip companies and many education and sporting organisations. Our wider offer to clients continues to expand and grow to meet new demands.3aaa Apprenticeships is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

title: Senior Manager, Service Performance
description:
About BurberryFounded in 1856, Burberry today remains quintessentially British, with outerwear at its core. Digital luxury positioning and intensive focus on design innovation, quality and heritage icons ensure continued brand purity and relevance globally across genders and generations. Burberry believes that in order to be a great brand it must also be a great company and constantly leverages the energy of its compassionate and creative thinking culture to continually innovate and drive the brand forward. Headquartered in London, Burberry is a design, marketing and retail led business with a global reputation for innovative product design, digital marketing initiatives and dynamic retail strategies.ABOUT BURBERRY BUSINESS SERVICESBurberry is opening a brand new Shared Service Centre - Burberry Business Services (BBS), based in Leeds at their stunning new premises in the heart of the City Centre. This Centre of Excellence will be an extension of their Head Office in London and house core functions; HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Services and I.T. helpdesk.JOB PURPOSEAs Senior Manager, Service Performance you will be leading the initial set-up of Burberry Business Services and developing and implementing improvement initiatives and driving continuous improvement with the business stakeholders. Managing day to day performance of Commercial Procurement activities and liaising with the Director of Commercial Procurement.RESPONSIBILITIESDeliveryInitially:Owns the implementation plan of the Burberry Business Services up to Go-Live, including:Monitoring and supporting mobilisation and set-up (infrastructure)Ensuring resource readiness for Go-Live (on-boarding, training oversight)Implementing and dry-run of all key processesEmbedding governance structure and performance managementOngoing deliveryManages the Contract / Supplier and Content Enablement, Requisition Support, Sourcing Support and Data and Market Analytics teams within the Burberry Business ServicesWorks with the Director for Commercial Procurement to effectively plan and deliver agreed upon procurement support services through the Burberry Business ServicesOwns and manages procurement support services' processes and operational procedures within the Burberry Business ServicesAccountable for all activities required to be performed within the Burberry Business Services by Commercial ProcurementDelivers and maintains high customer satisfaction ratings by processing transactions accurately and meets agreed service levels for process specific areasIdentifies risk associated with execution of the assigned tasks within the business processes and escalates / mitigates / resolves as requiredSupports establishing and managing service level agreements and operating level agreements with internal Burberry customers (e.g., turnaround times, lead times needed)Supports resolution of escalated issuesProvides performance reporting to BBS Director as neededIdentifies and supports pursuit of continuous improvement opportunitiesLeadershipManage teams of 10 - 20 resources to performing all activities within the BBSTrain, develop and coach team and assist them with complex activities as neededTrain, develop and coach Source to Contract Senior Co-ordinator to ensure they have the capabilities to manage the teamManage, motivate and develop a team of professionals / associates / operational team in order to provide services contributing to the delivery of business objectives.Set process based objectives and targets for individuals that are linked to their performance objectives as well as overall Team delivery objectivesProvide constructive feedback to team members and conduct performance reviewsContinuous improvementApply understanding of assigned business process to identify gaps and propose continuous improvement measuresWork closely with the process owner and team lead to understand root causes and represent process procedures, practicalities and exceptionsImplement continuous improvement initiatives per the roadmap defined by the management team and ensure initiatives meet agreed outputs and address customer feedback / improve customer satisfactionPERSONAL PROFILEQualifications & ExperienceDegree level or equivalentExcellent interpersonal skills with an ability to inspire trust and confidence Proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint requiredStrong leadership experience (10+ years) within Shared Services and Procurement delivering against targets. Proven success in managing, organizing, and/or completing multiple tasks and prioritiesExperience implementing sourcing methodologies for category management.Good knowledge of procurement concepts, processes and techniques including commercial contracts negotiation skills and relationship management.Experienced of e-sourcing and contract management solutions required (preferably Ariba) and SAP.Proven experience in developing a best-in-class indirect spend management program.Demonstrated leadership talent with ability to motivate all levels of stakeholders by virtue of keen business acumen, excellent judgment, professional competence, credibility, flexibility, and personal integrity.SkillsAbility to build and foster productive working relationshipsSuperior ability to communicate both orally and in writingAbility to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressureAbility to influence change in others through role modellingAbility to impact team morale, sense of belonging and participationAbility to manage the work of large departments - LeadershipAbility to prioritize and organize effectively - LeadershipAbility to supervise and motivate others - LeadershipAbility to manage a team setting with a diverse group of employees - LeadershipOPPORTUNITIES AT BURBERRY BUSINESS SERVICESIf you do not wish to apply for a specific role but would like to register your interest please click on the following link: https://rsbb.avature.net/talentcommunityBurberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.


Contact: Burberry Group Inc.

Finance Service Improvement Director & Manager (x2 positions) - Iconic FTSE 100 - London or Berkshire - £60,000 - 90,000 + Excellent BenefitsFTSE 30 giant seeks two passionate Service and Continuous Improvement experts to deliver a massive capability shift globally to improve operational performance, uniting teams across the Americas, Asia Pacific and Europe.The organisation has historically outsourced major works so does not currently have the skills internally, so this is a huge opportunity for two enthusiastic individuals to create and shape the agenda, deliver to it, and then receive recognition for doing so.As Finance Service Improvement Director & Manager you will:-Develop multi-year FS strategy, delivering change and transformation to drive global functions towards best-in-classHave full accountability to the Finance Leadership team including VP / Heads ofEstablish process improvement capabilities in a multi-functional shared services environment using Lean Six Sigma and Kaizen type methodologies, working across Finance, Supply Chain, upstream P2P business units and beyondBuild a global network of practitioners, engaging with key stakeholders to identify important figures that need to be involved, and coaching & upskilling them to improve people capabilitiesFocus front line activity across the globe, ensuring that skilled individuals flow to the demand and support the service line owners to improve their operationsEstablish governance processes and provide performance management of third party service delivery (such as Genpact)Required background & traits:-Degree, Prince 2 and Lean Six Sigma qualifications preferred, though not essentialProven ability to transform operational performance ideally within a multi-functional shared service environmentImpressive track record of quick progression within your career to date, proving your capacity to perform in a fast-paced, ever-changing environmentHuge ambition, enthusiasm and passion, with a knack for solving complex problemsTo find out more and apply? please send your CV to  or directly through this page. Key skills: Service Management, Continuous Improvement, Change Management, Transformation, Finance Operations, Project Management, Shared Services Transformation, P2P, Supply Chain Finance, Capability Improvement, Process Improvement, Cost to Serve, Process quality, Continuous ImprovementTo keep up to date with all the latest procurement jobs, follow our twitter feed at http://www.twitter.com/BramwithProcure

QA Director of Automation required by Global IT services group who are looking for someone who will be strategic in advising and directing the business going forward with their next generation Automation strategies and Frameworks. The ideal candidate be someone that thrives in a work environment that requires strong problem solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for team collaboration and open communication. This key hire will be reporting to VP of Systems. The role will encompass multiple Automation offerings spanning Deployment Automation, Test automation, & Robotic Process Automation (RPA).Responsibilities: Collaborating with Systems leadership to define and execute Automation roadmaps and strategies across the business. Develop, document and implement company-wide best practices, frameworks, processes, operational activities and procedures in relation to automation. Showcase measurable improvement in software quality by identifying, developing and implementing innovative QA automation capabilities, strategies, approaches and services. Define quality metrics and targets for assessment, measurement and continuous improvement of QA automation effectiveness. Improving the efficiency, effectiveness and speed of quality assurance practices and testing activities a through the identification and implementation of appropriate automated testing tools and processes. Partnering with QA managers and teams to assist in the adoption and rollout of QA automation strategies. Identify training needs in relation to Automation and partner with the Learning team.Experience: Proven track record of developing automation strategies and frameworks for enterprise level platforms preferably across all areas of testing including functional testing, integration testing, regression testing, performance testing and stress testing. ISTQB or other relevant industry certifications advantageousSummary: This role is suited to a Director of Automation who employs a structured approach to delivering Automation /Test strategies at board level by utilising their strong communication and business influencing skills at all levels. They are based in an area of outstanding natural beauty within a vibrant and cosmopolitan town. In addition to relocation assistance and expenses they can also provide VISA Sponsorship for anyone outside of EU working regulations

title: Team Manager Luxury & Prestigious Travel Company
description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join a luxury, prestigious and market leading travel company based in Cheltenham. They are now recruiting for a Team Manager to become a part of the family on a permanent basis.As the Team Manager, you will oversee the daily operations of the client services team by monitoring the efficiency of other team members and creating daily action plans to prioritise the workload. The role will act as second in command for the client services team and to work closely with the head of client services to foster teamwork and unity. Main Responsibilities:- Responsible for performing 121 meetings. - Probation and annual review meetings with the team.- Monitoring sales and tracking targets. - Work closely with the marketing team to monitor effectiveness of ongoing campaigns. - Report on various aspects of the business and the progress of the client services team. - Building strong VIP client relationships. - Responding to client online reviews and acting on these when necessary.- Visiting houses and clients to develop portfolio knowledge and build relationships. Key Attributes:- Excellent customer service skills. - Previous experience in a managerial or supervisory role.- A passion for working with people. - An understanding of the importance in exceeding expectations.- A desire to deliver exceptional service in all areas. - The ability to use initiative under pressure. - An organised and assertive nature.Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:30am – 5pm. Salary: £24,000 – £26,000 depending on experience. This is flexible depending on experience.

title: Multi-Site Employee Relations Manager North
description:
Our client is a well-known services company with over 170,000 employees. Due to a company restructure they are looking for a Regional ER Manager to support ER Specialists in the North of EnglandBased between sites your main duties would beTo lead and coach a team of 6 or 7 regional ER Specialists that effectively and efficiently supports all areas of our varied business. To develop the expertise in the team through the sharing of knowledge and individual ownership of knowledge development.Develop the capacity of line managers to manage ER problems locally, developing management styles to foster positive working relationships with employees, minimising the occurrence of line management problems and issues and fostering a positive climate for ER.To coach and develop managers. To provide specialist ER advice and solutions that are cognisant of current legislation and tailored to company policies and procedures and business realities. To proactively manage and support the company in relation to all elements of TUPE and Mergers and Acquisitions. To foster and support a partnership relationship with the unions at regional level. To form part of the negotiations teams for pay negotiations as required and to identify with the unions joint initiatives. To support the ER and Policy Development Manager and the external solicitors with the management of Employment Tribunals claims as required.To alert and escalate any areas of non-compliance and or associated risks to the business to the Head of Employee Relations.We are looking for someone who has these existing skills:Minimum level 7 CIPD or equivalent qualification. Previous experience as a people leader, ideally in an ER capacity within a unionised and regulated environment.Proven ER experience including advising on complex disciplinary and grievance issues with the ability to apply the relevant legal principles and risk assessment.Experience of supporting large scale organisational change and restructuring programmes including TUPE, redundancy and contractual variations.Experience of partnering with trade unions and a good understanding of the trade union framework and collective bargaining.Strong communication and influencing skills with the ability to interact across all levels of management.This is a very busy / ‘hands on role’. Our client offers a positive working environment and a varied role. This is coupled with an excellent benefits, car allowance and bonus package!


Contact: Alex Hillman
        

Reference: Totaljobs/AH130417

HR Advisor - 21 hours a weekPart Time Human Resources AdvisorLocation: BlackpoolEasy commute from Preston and surrounding areasSalary: Pro rata £26,000Fully involving, brand new HR Advisor role, working 21 hours per week!This exciting HR opportunity reports into the Human Resources Manager in the South East office, near Gatwick. You will enjoy close liaison, support and guidance regarding the roll-out of this new HR position, based within their small but growing Blackpool office. This busy HR Advisor role will suit a capable, qualified HR professional who wants to be responsible for all recruitment, training and development, performance monitoring, and grievance and disciplinary procedures for the personnel in this office. You will enjoy working 21 hours a week, ideally across 4-5 days and will be based within their new office, using a brand new HR system and implementing a wide range of HR processes. The 40+ employees are based both in the office and in the field so at times you will be required to travel to locations across the country as well as to the head office near Gatwick for meetings. If this sounds like the challenge you have been waiting for then APPLY NOW!Your duties will involve the following;Accountable for providing HR support and responsibilities, within a multi-tasking, fast paced and changing environment.Effectively co-ordinate the recruitment process including writing job specifications/profiles, candidate sourcing, agency liaison, conduct assessments, support interviews to ensure most suitable candidates are recruited.Seek best value recruitment solutions.Manage new starter, mover and leaver processes.Deliver HR induction programme, ensure operational induction is completed. Oversee probation process, supporting managers with any identified issues.Assist managers to formulate their appropriate training and development plans: identify skills gaps to ensure the business optimises the contribution of its people. Seek best value training solutions.Assist in drafting new HR & Health & Safety policies and procedures.Co-ordinate Personal Development Reviews, IDP and maternity processes.Monitor absence level thresholds and effectively manage with relevant line manager and Occupational Health as necessary.Coach and support managers in dealing with range of complex and sensitive employee relations issues; attendance, grievances, performance management including disciplinary and capability proceedings to achieve successful outcomes.Keep HR Manager fully informed of all developments and maintain strong communication links at all times.Maintain HR system database. Liaise with Payroll.Assist in maintaining relevant ISO standards.Active contributor to the Health & Safety Committee. Undertake risk assessments and other actions to promote a safe and healthy workplace.Provide research, analysis, management information and administration as required.Participate in regular training/ learning activities to maintain and develop skills and knowledge.Skills & Knowledge:CIPD qualification with solid HR experienceStrong problem-solving and analytical abilitiesStrong administrator with excellent organisational skills.Confident communicatorIntermediate knowledge of Excel, Word and Outlook.Key Words: Payroll, HR, Administrator, Admin, CIPD, CIPP, Human Resource, Payroll Advisor, HR Advisor, HR Recruitment, Recruitment, ER, Employee RelationsFollow us on Twitter@aboutyourecruit or join our facebook community by clicking 'Like’ on our About You Recruitment Ltd page. Be the first to see our jobs as well as lots of useful information about the job market, interviews and CVs!Note: Due to the large volumes of applications that we receive if you have not had a response within 7 days of your application then please assume that you have been unsuccessful on this occasion.About You Recruitment is an Employment Agency providing office jobs across Sussex and Surrey.
