title: Training Business Partner
description:
Our Client, a dynamic company within the Finance and Banking Sector, are currently seeking a Training Business Partner to join their team on a full time, permanent basis. This role would involve the complete delivery of learning and development solutions across the business, partnering closely with HR and senior business managers to ensure objectives are met in line with business need.You will be responsible for delivering an annual learning needs analysis, linking learning and development activity with developing capability within the organisation as well as delivering a guided book of work to cover product, technical, customer service and core skills programmes/inductions. Duties and Responsibilities include:·Managing the established L&D team·Working with key stakeholders across the business to identify learning needs through an annual calendar and framework in line with companywide practice ·Managing the design and delivery of appropriate learning solutions including product, technical and specialist training specific to the business area ·Aligning L&D programmes with the business strategy by liaising with 3rd party suppliers and internal subject matter experts ·Coaching and mentoring; identify coaching and mentoring requirements in development discussions with HRBPs and business leadership teams ·Managing the learning and development budget in partnership with business unit leaders to ensure effective and timely solutions are delivered ·Proactively measuring the continued effectiveness of learning activity, continuously reviewing the quality of learning initiatives and providing constructive feedback on course content for continuous development·Working closely with the Head of Learning and Development to maintain and develop the various internal programmes including on boarding and induction·Representing Learning and Development on significant business change programmes ·Regularly researching and conducting best practice reviews looking at learning and development innovations and assessing their fit for the business·Business Partnering and consulting with various stakeholders across the business; developing strong and positive working relationships through regular and open communication, and high quality delivery Skills and experience:·CIPD or equivalent qualification in Learning and Development essential·People/team management experience ·Proven experience in identifying learning needs and in designing comprehensive and practical learning solutions to meet business needs·Ability to partner with senior stakeholders and HRBPs across a business with a confident and credible approach ·Proven experience working well under pressure in a busy environment and demonstrating resilience with an ability to meet challenging deadlines.·Ability to demonstrate an understanding of the full training cycle: needs analysis, design, delivery and evaluation within a commercial organisation·Proven practical experience of course development and learning intervention design, including blended learning. · A genuine passion for keeping up to date with the latest learning and development practices·External supplier relationship management capability ·Strong organisational and planning ability ·Previous project management experience ideal·Flexible to travel to company sitesThis is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic company working at the forefront of their industry on a permanent basis. If you feel this could the right opportunity for you apply directly, alternatively for more information call us on 01242 228 200.

Programme ManagerIT Programme Manager required by Global IT Services Group who have created a new role in line with their structured expansion and service improvement plans. This role needs someone who that employs a structured approach who can improve the Service Strategies by working closely and across the Project Management teams whilst demonstrating experience in organizational awareness, financial management, project governance and vendor management. Technical project experience is critical to the role along with possessing knowledge in some or all of the following; Change Management, Risk Management or Release Management.The salary and also the career enhancement incentives reflect this companies desire to recruit the highest calibre of PMO/Project Management professionals in the market.Responsibilities: Provide the leadership and focus to ensure ongoing improvement of the Project Management Team’s capabilities and effectiveness. Day to day management of an established Project Management Team by providing guidance, governance and advice to project task owners, and Project Owners from various internal resources within the business. Identifying and allocating resources in order to deliver and complete new projects in line with defined timescales and SLA’s. Prepare documentation and correspondence, to ensure transparency and progress as and when required. Deliver presentations to the internal business. Provide adhoc Business escalation support and guidanceExperience: A proven track record working within a Programme Manager capacity working on a wide and varied number of projects at enterprise level utilising structured Methodologies ie:Prince2 or ITL. The ability to demonstrate a history of improving service and project management delivery at all levels. Experience of working on projects relating to any of the following is desirable: Telecommunications, enterprise infrastructure and data centres, Unified Communications, enterprise user migrations.Summary: This is a role for a an experienced Programme Manager who is looking for a career move that will present both a challenge and diversity where they will get the opportunity to be instrumental in driving the Project Management Team forward whilst maintaining and improving high standards at all times. My client is based in an area of outstanding natural beauty within a vibrant and cosmopolitan town. They also offer relocation assistance/expenses and VISA Sponsorship for anyone outside of EU working regulations

title: Business Support Manager
description:
A leading UK based management consultancy who pride themselves on delivering an exceptional service to their clients are looking for a Business Operations Manager to join their office in Holmes Chapel.The main objective of this role is to provide operational support across the business with a clear focus on IT support, supplier relationships and compliance processes.The key responsibilities of the business operations manager are:Providing support for the IT infrastructure in the business including company laptops and phone contractsBe familiar with good practice of IT policies and procedures and ensure they are implemented accurately across the officeAdminister and manage 3rd party IT supplier relationshipsReview of all existing supplier relationshipsManagement of existing and new supplier contractsSupporting the sales & marketing team with the organisation and running of events for business development purposesEnsure business is compliant with external policies and regulationsWorking closely with the HR Manager and Financial Controller to ensure continuity across the businessManage the relationship and lease holding with office's landlordDevelop and manage disaster recovery arrangements for the officeThe ideal business operations manager would have the following skills and attributes:Be highly self-motivated and self-sufficientExcellent communication skills to be able to develop strong working relationships with both internal and external stakeholdersPrevious experience working closely with a senior management/ leadership teamExcellent written skills to able to communicate on behalf of the businessExtremely well -organised with an acute attention to detailprevious proven experience of managing projectsAbility to demonstrate flexibility and adaptabilityPrevious experience working in a professional services or corporate environment is highly desirableThis is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced business operations manager who would like to work in a professional and dynamic working environment which promotes a collaborative working style. This role is not only offering a competitive salary but also a great benefits package and discretionary bonus.For further information, please contact Shaz Flanagan on 0161 214 7403

title: Senior Manager, Process Excellence
description:
About BurberryFounded in 1856, Burberry today remains quintessentially British, with outerwear at its core. Digital luxury positioning and intensive focus on design innovation, quality and heritage icons ensure continued brand purity and relevance globally across genders and generations. Burberry believes that in order to be a great brand it must also be a great company and constantly leverages the energy of its compassionate and creative thinking culture to continually innovate and drive the brand forward. Headquartered in London, Burberry is a design, marketing and retail led business with a global reputation for innovative product design, digital marketing initiatives and dynamic retail strategies.ABOUT BURBERRY BUSINESS SERVICESBurberry is opening a brand new Shared Service Centre - Burberry Business Services (BBS), based in Leeds at their stunning new premises in the heart of the City Centre. This Centre of Excellence will be an extension of their Head Office in London and house core functions; HR, Finance, Procurement, Customer Services and I.T. helpdesk.JOB PURPOSEAs Senior Manager, process Excellence you will develop and continuously update an end-to-end process strategy in support of overall business objectives and embed LEAN/Continuous Improvement strategy, methodology and mind-set throughout BBS.RESPONSIBILITIESAccountable for consistent deployment of Continuous Improvement (CI) and the supporting LEAN Six Sigma based methodologies and tools.Energise, train and coach BBS Functional delivery teams to engage in CI, supporting improved productivityDrive E2E Process Leads to effectively support Function Leaders / GPOs to unlock process valueDevelop Robotic Process Automation (RPA) specialism and process mining to continually advance automationStay abreast of function / industry leading practice developmentsProject Management qualificationDegree educatedLean / Six Sigma (or similar) qualificationPERSONAL PROFILEExperienced and proficient in Microsoft Office applicationsPrevious experience of working in a shared services environment, specifically in FinancePrevious experience of working with SAP (desirable)SkillsAbility to absorb large quantities of information and identify key pointsDrive to develop expertise in the area of shared services and the business processes it deliversAbility to thrive in a dynamic environmentExcellent communication skills, both verbal and written. With the ability to listen and connect with senior stakeholders and colleagues in different geographies.Deductive reasoning, analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong analytical and data interpretation abilityThrives on making recommendations that provide solutions to complex problemsNatural ability to work as part of a teamWillingness to get pro-actively involved in the day to day running of the shared services operation as part of the BBS organisationBurberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.


Contact: Burberry Group Inc.
        

Reference: Totaljobs/1010480

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Project Manager with a real passion for delivering multi-disciplined projects across the Midlands and East Anglia region. Joining the existing Project Management team, working out of our Midlands offices, you will be leading and contributing to the delivery of projects from £5M to £50M, having absolute responsibility and accountability for all project aspects. You will bring a wide range of project management skills, knowledge and experience of working closely with clients, stakeholders and all engineering disciplines to progress projects and deliver on some challenging timelines. Due to the varied nature of our work, it is important that you are flexible with respect to employed location and are keen to support the wider sectors within the business. We are looking for an experienced Project Manager with well-developed professional and commercial skills and a proven track record of delivering multi-discipline projects ideally but not exclusively within the Defence sector. The ability to identify project requirements, develop a programme of delivery, control costs, manage project governance and work collaboratively with a team of people from across the business will be crucial for success. You will be busy, challenged and feel rewarded.Your RoleFrom day one, you will be involved with delivering aspects of current projects and supporting the bid process for future opportunities. We will expect you to quickly settle in to the business and assist team members with undertaking a variety of projects predominantly within the Defence sector but also supporting other sectors; where appropriate this may include an element of international work. Activities will include all aspects of pre and post contract project delivery from the bidding process through to construction phase; including quality control, cost control, reporting, programming, health and safety aspects, client and stakeholder liaison. You should be a team player and able to deliver multiple projects to tight deadlines.About YouYou will bring to the role well developed and proven project management skills and have the agility to apply these to a range of built environment and infrastructure opportunities. You will have effective communication skills, a collaborative approach and an ability to deliver on your promises. In additionyou should be able to demonstrate/ideally have:Proven track record in defence related projectsEvidence of working collaboratively with clients and suppliers to deliver positive resultsUphold professional and ethical behaviour in everything you doConstruction related degreeProject management and professional qualificationsChartered membership of a recognised professional institutionAn understanding of the RIBA Stages or other recognised delivery implementation that is applicable to the construction industryGood practical application of Microsoft Project and all other MS softwareDriving licenceSecurity clearance or suitability for security clearanceExperienced in successfully securing and delivering major construction projects from inception to completion, with the ability to produce commercial bids, write persuasive project proposals and perform effectively at the interview stage of a bid. You will have the ability to manage other professionals and to collaborate and influence other industry professionals and clients.About WYGWe are an international, award-winning, multidisciplinary consultancy, delivering creative solutions to some of the world’s most challenging projects. We are confident in our abilities, authentic in the advice we give, imaginative in our thinking and resourceful in how we turn our ideas into reality. But most of all, we are a people business. Our success is down to people like you.You will be joining the existing team who are part of the Management Services/ Project Management sector of WYG which encompasses professionals throughout the UK, including members of ICE, RICS, CIBSE and the Institute of Asset Management and who include a range of disciplines including project and programme management, quantity surveying, building surveying, building services, and asbestos consultancy, offering public and private clients around the world expertise through the full project life cycle, including design, procurement and management.RewardsIn return for your dedication, you’ll enjoy a quality total remuneration package, including contributory pension, health cover and flexible working options. Pick and choose your perfect blend from advantages including childcare and retail vouchers, travel insurance and variable holiday. You’ll also benefit from great training and development, with support to achieve your career goals.


Contact: Elanor Currin
        

Reference: Totaljobs/11497
        

Job ID: 74289692

Soft Services Account Manager Reading, Berkshire £28,000 - £34,000Soft Services – Facilities Management – Specialist CleaningWe provide high quality, professional facilities management and building support soft services (mainly specialist cleaning) in London and the South East to some of the most prestigious clients in well known/landmark buildings. Due to continued growth and expansion, we are now looking to appoint a Soft Services Account Manager for a prestigious multi-site client in Reading, Berkshire. This is a highly client facing position, with direct reports including service support managers and supervisors and offers genuine further career progression opportunities. Role OutlineTaking full responsibility and accountability for managing the delivery of cleaning and support services to site, ensuring all services provided are delivered to the agreed service standard in an efficient, professional and customer focussed manner.·To manage and develop the cleaning and other soft services delivery team and individuals to maximise efficiencies, service standards and development possibilities·Undertake quality control inspections and audits on service delivery and cleaning (and other) standards·To be a Health and Safety ambassador and take a proactive approach to Health and Safety Management and promote good habits and methods of work in a diverse workforce·Ensure KPIs are managed and achieved – with regular reporting required ·Adhere to budgets, regularly reporting to stakeholders·Identify any cost saving opportunities and service delivery innovations·Accurate, timely timesheet submissions to HR/payroll·Project Management and mobilisation of contracts·Drive, promote and deliver company processes and standards to your team·Occasional out of hours support to ensure service delivery standards are metThe Candidate:·Minimum 3 years experience in a similar role within the soft services/cleaning/FM sector with proven line management skills·IOSH qualification preferred, or proof of working towards this standard ·Confident challenging policies where improvement opportunities exist ·Confident decision maker and quality driven manager of people, systems and service ·Good communication skills and personal presentation – an ambassador for our business·User of computer aided FM systems, good MS Office ·Driving licence essentialSalary and Benefits: £28,000 - £34,000 dependent on experience. Benefits include 28 days annual leave, NEST pension and some excellent employee scheme and incentives (childcare vouchers, cycle to work, employee discounts, health club etc…)The applications process:Applications in writing to our retained recruitment partner. Due to the sometimes exceptional number of applications received, we may not always be possible for us to respond to each one individually. As such, if you have not heard from us within 7 working days of an application, it must be assumed that on this occasion you have not been successful.


Contact: Ellen Spencer

title: General Manager - Sales & Marketing
description:
Our client is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of automotive components; a market leading automotive component manufacturer, with a well-known, high quality, global brand that specialises in the supply of parts to OE manufacturers and the aftermarket.They are in the process of enhancing their senior team and intend to employ a ‘General Manager Sales and Marketing’. The incumbent manager is taking on increased responsibilities and this additional role is required to support the business. This new role reports to the Director – Automotive and will take on responsibility for aftermarket sales and marketing, through a respected and well established team of sales and marketing professionals.Objectives, Responsibilities and Measurement Criteria are defined as follows:-Key Objectives: Develop and implement the Aftermarket Division objectives, sales strategy, market policies, operational activities and practices.Develop a marketing plan to achieve an improvement in profitable sales, year on year.Develop and implement a marketing strategy in line with long and short term corporate plans.Plan, control and direct the efforts of the Sales Management and Sales Force and Marketing Department toward the accomplishment of the Company’s automotive volume sales and profit objectives.-Responsibilities:In conjunction with Sales Management develop and implement a sales strategy at customer and product level, to achieve both long and short-term sales forecasts.In liaison with the Marketing Manager, develop a marketing strategy to compliment the sales strategy, achieve long and short-term corporate plans, ensuring the marketing plan and methods of its utilisation are communicated to all departments concerned.Be responsible for the annual and monthly sales and P&L forecast/planning and short and long-term sales goals.Analyse total Company sales volume against pre-set targets and the performance of all major accounts, taking corrective actions where necessary.Manage accurate market share data at product and customer levels, to enable an accurate understanding of the Company’s position in the market and highlight business opportunities.Conduct press meetings at various exhibitions and special meetings.Recommend pricing policies, including quantities, terms and conditions of sales.Drive the analysis and handling of pricing issues.Monitor and take corrective action involving supply chain issues, stock queries, out of stock issues, market queries and industry rumours.Direct and co-ordinate the activities of Sales Management towards the accomplishment of Company and individual volume sales target.Manage the relationship with the European HQRepresent the UK and the Company.Maintain and cultivate top level contact with key decision makers, with Buying Groups, Nationals and independent motor factorsNegotiation and maintenance of supply agreements.Be responsible for the recruitment of Sales and Marketing personnel in liaison with the management team and personnel manager.Be responsible for recommending to the Director - Automotive, the promotion of staff members, or increases in salary, or changes in commission for the sales team and marketing teams.In any case of unsatisfactory performance, recommend corrective action.Be responsible for sales meetings, conferences and seminarsChair monthly sales, marketing and management meetings.Attend internal weekly and monthly meetings.Active involvement in team building.-Primary Performance Measurement Criteria:The soundness of the tactical plans recommended to the Director - Automotive.The effectiveness of the Marketing Plan.The standard of the sales force and marketing staff, in terms of performance against target through training development and discipline.The quality of the leadership, guidance and assistance given to the Sales and Marketing Management team.The degree of mutual co-operation, which exists between the job holder and other departmental managers and supervisors.The creativeness displayed in recommending new innovations, or improvements for the betterment of the automotive product business in terms of pricing strategy, marketing initiatives, local and national promotions and added value activities.The quality and accuracy of recommended forecasts and attainment of volume objectives.The example of good management, high morale, personal conduct and effective team-work evidenced by the job holder and the sales team, in their contact with members of the Company and others.-The suitable candidate:Will be intelligent; preferably degree educated.Must have a good understanding of the automotive aftermarket and the key players operating in it.Will have a background in sales and marketing management and be able to manage, lead and motivate a team.Preferably, have experience in a data-driven organisation, i.e. one that puts data at the centre and uses insights derived from it to drive their strategy and decision making.Notwithstanding the above, he/she must be self-motivated, have a flexible attitude at work, be good at problem solving, diligent, respectful (but engender respect) and be ambitious for themselves and the organisation that they represent;In addition, the successful candidate must live in a location that is within reasonable commuting distance of our client’s base in North London, or be prepared to relocate.Our client is open minded about package; nonetheless, any offer will include a competitive salary, fully funded executive car (A6 or equivalent), a generous pension scheme, life assurance, healthcare, 25+ days holiday pa and 3 months’ notice period.This is a unique opportunity to work for the UK Division of one of the foremost automotive brands in the world. If this describes you and you are interested in applying for this outstanding opportunity, please send a CV, with a brief covering note telling us why you think you should be considered, to:Jerry Hayter, Managing Partner, Xecutive Search HR, Regus House, Central Boulevard, Blythe Valley Park, Solihull, B90 8AG. www.xecutivesearch.com


Contact: Jerry Hayter
        

Reference: Totaljobs/XS/Kanaria

title: HR Advisor/Consultant
description:
Our client is a one of Europe’s leading FMCG brands, who have been established for over 50 years, and continue to grow from strength to strength, with some of Europe’s best known brands. Due to continued growth and success they are looking to recruit an experienced HR Advisor/Consultant to join their dynamic and forward thinking HR team. This is a stand-alone, home based role where the HR Advisor/Consultant will need to be self-sufficient and manage their own workload/diary, and I will involve regular travel to various regional offices, (including Kent, Tamworth and Warrington).The core remit of the HR Advisor/Consultant role will be to provide proactive and flexible HR support and guidance to our client’s customer facing teams (contact centres), covering the full spectrum of the professional HR areas such as resource and talent management, organisation development and design, employee engagement, performance and reward and employee relations. The HR Advisor/Consultant will play a key part in bridging the gap between HR and sales to ensure the sales function have the required business support to ensure their customer journey is best in class, and HR is at the forefront of ensuring the sales function can establish a premium customer service and customer experience, via excellent organisational development initiatives and talent/succession planning.Principal Accountabilities:·Implement and co-ordinate strategies that support efficiencies and improvements within the functions.·Involvement in broader change projects, including management of required consultation redundancies etc.·Support the HRBP and Management Team in the development and implementation of proposed organisational changes. From concept, design, planning and implementation of the change process, ensuring the people impact is managed effectively and efficiently to deliver the right outcome for the business. Develop and deliver the cultural and organisational change required to create a One Team approach, along with maximising the benefits from the utilising engagement survey results to improve ways of working.·Employee Relations and Management Development – To ensure all managers effectively utilise the employment relations advice line and has the relevant level of training, coaching and support in conducting disciplinaries, grievances, absence management and any performance management.·Career and Succession Management – Identify recruitment challenges, liaising with Resourcing Partners to co-ordinate campaigns. ·Support the functions in the development of a succession plan, talent pipeline and completion of IPR process including PDPs.·HR People Stats – To analyse HR KPI’s. Identification of trends with relevant escalation and follow through with line managers and action plans where appropriate.·Employee Engagement – Support the Function to maximise the effectiveness of the Employee Communication Forums and individual reps. Co-ordinating and attending meetings where necessary, producing pre and post documentation and creating effective two-way informal and formal communications channels throughout the year.·Support site management to maximise participation of Employee Engagement Survey and facilitate effective action planning throughout the year. Experience Requirements:4+ years’ generalist HR and complex ER experience. (Could suit an existing consultant)Proven track record of managing a broad range of HR activities, with particular emphasis on applying commercially-oriented solutions.Effective, impactful and engaging communication, interpersonal and influencing skills with colleagues at all levels.Ability to act on own initiative and work autonomously taking responsibility for decisions, finding practical solutions to problems and addressing challenges in tight time frames.Ability to lead people with tact and diplomacy.Guiding, coaching and inspiring others to reach a common end goal whist maximising engagement for individuals, functions and the depot.Ability to mediate, manage and resolve workplace conflict.Strong time management, planning and organisational skills with the ability to prioritise and delegate appropriately.Up to date and in depth knowledge of current and upcoming employment law, CIPD qualified or with equivalent experience.Our client has a very people centric culture, which is evidenced by their extremely low attrition rates across the business. HR plays a core part in ensuring this culture is instilled throughout the organisation and as such the HR Advisor/Consultant needs to be very people driven and passionate about employee engagement and wellbeing.Our client also genuinely believes in progressing and developing its employees, which means there is a clear career path for the successful HR Advisor/Consultant candidate.So if you feel that you have the necessary skills and experience to succeed in the role of HR Advisor/Consultant, then please apply now for immediate consideration.


Contact: Paul de Rozarieux
        

Reference: Totaljobs/PDHRA01

Planning Director - Bedford National Consultancy Salary: £Negotiable dependant on experience (Guide of £50,000 - £60,000 p/a)Penguin are excited to be representing a national planning and development consultancy who, as part of a strategic growth plan are looking to recruit a Planning Director to co-lead the Bedford team.This an exciting time to join this business as they are a rapidly growing multi-disciplinary business with over 25 years experience in the market and multiple offices across the UK. The business are looking to expand the team and the scope of their project work projecting a 10% increase in instructions, including plans to open a new office in the east of England!The Bedford office has a diverse and growing workload which ranges from the promotion of substantial 'garden village' proposals to 'paragraph 55' dwellings, the promotion of large commercial developments and advising on neighbourhood plan proposals. The Office also works very closely with another and combined has a team of circa 20 planners.Key responsibilities and accountabilities:Development of the client base including oversight of existing client instructions and development of client opportunities;Managing the workloads and professional development of the planning staff and ensuring that the required standards are met;Joint management of the Office including client accounts, budgeting and income projections;Contributing to Companywide business and development strategy; andAccountability to the Board of Directors and Managing DirectorThe successful candidate will share responsibility for the financial and performance planning of the Office with another Director and will also have an opportunity to develop a wider management role within the business. They will jointly represent the Bedford Office on both the 'Regional Planning Directors' Panel' and on the main company Board. It is expected that the post holder would have an opportunity to move to equity status after a qualifying period. In order to apply, you should be RTPI or RICS qualified and have a minimum of 10 years' professional experience. You should have experience of managing a professional team(s) and able to provide leadership and vision. You should also be client facing, and be used to, and confident with, a business development role.Remuneration will be commensurate with the abilities and potential of the successful candidate and will include a competitive salary, performance linked bonus scheme, access to the Company pension scheme, health insurance and a number of other fringe benefits.Interested in this role? To be considered, please click on the link below to apply. For more information on this role or others in the region, please contact me on 01792 365 101.COMMUTABLE LOCATIONS: Bedford, St Neots, Hitchin, Luton, Dunstable, Milton Keynes, Northampton, Cambridge, Hemel Hempstead or LONDON (Bedford to St Pancras International - 39 minutes).

title: Financial Services Strategy Manager for Specialist Risk Boutique
description:
Our client is highly professional and hardworking but relaxed and collaborative. They are the UK’s leading expert on insurance governance. The firm has been operating in the commercial insurance sector for over 15 years. Its focus has always been on detailed, technical analysis which does not shy away from uncovering and studying uncomfortable truths, or challenging accepted wisdom. The company focuses on driving increased standards across the commercial insurance industry giving the business an unrivalled depth of expertise and a wide spread of clients. Mactavish’s corporate clients range from FTSE 100s across all sectors to much smaller businesses with unusual or complex activities. Project work typically spans analysis of business operations, risks and risk controls; reviews of insurance programmes, policy wordings and provider service contracts; advice around risk placement and negotiation; working with leading barristers/QCs to execute contract changes and also to resolve large or complex claims disputes. In addition, they are an influential lobbyist and thought leader, publishes market-leading research into risk, insurance and placement issues and also works with insurer and broker clients to drive strategic and operational improvements across the industry. They are licensed by the Bar Standards Board of the Bar Council to access barristers directly, for both contentious and pre-contractual legal work in the field of insurance. They believe the business is unique in the UK in this regard.

The Role:
We are looking for a Manager to take on the following responsibilities:
 Designing analytical work and project outlines
 Managing projects and project teams
 Producing and quality-checking analytical output
 Running client meetings and presenting findings
 Leading negotiation meetings between clients and their insurers/brokers
 Supporting the preparation of project proposals
 Line managing, mentoring and developing a team of analysts
 Supporting identification and closure of follow on work for clients
 Taking an active role in the ongoing growth and development of the business

Candidate Profile
The candidate will have initiative, intuition, and creativity as well as a strong background in conceptual problem solving and analytic skills:
 Experience in a major strategy consulting firm
 A strong analytical background
 Knowledge, interest and experience in the financial services sector and preferably some exposure to risk analysis work and the commercial insurance industry (but a detailed background in insurance is not required)
 Ability to build and apply depth of content knowledge in project execution and thought leadership
 Ability to own a problem from formulation to conclusion, driving progression and agreement at each stage
 Ability to oversee primary research, define trends, draw conclusions and present recommendations
 Capacity to build client intimacy by innovative thinking around their problems
 Desire to learn and to continuously develop your expertise
 Willingness to go the extra mile for the team and the client
 Excellent communication, influencing, negotiation and presentation skills

Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:NB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Management Development Team - Process Management Assistant
description:
Are you a confident and passionate individual with the drive and determination needed to join the Fast Track Management Development program? The team is championed by the Group Managing Director and members of this team play a unique and critical role in the future development of the business. The purpose of the role is to efficiently manage the projects that you are assigned and be responsible for their development; from concept to release. A world-ranking specialist in the mechanical sealing industry. Designing, manufacturing and distributing precision engineered mechanical seals and sealing systems, the company sets new industry standards in performance, reliability, cost and service.The company also prides itself on exceeding its social responsibilities by a number of very successful initiatives including sponsoring school CAD software systems, managing a wetlands wildlife sanctuary and reducing its environmental impact (carbon emissions and water usage). Job DimensionTo be responsible for reducing costs by initiating and creating processes to control the Company's internal knowledge and dataTo develop, introduce and regulate policies and processes to ensure the integrity of data with a view to reducing waste and costTo take responsibility of any projects given and be confident and able to drive continuous improvement initiativesProject Management - You will be required to efficiently manage the projects that you are assigned and be responsible for their development; from concept to release. You'll need to ensure these projects support the company's strategic goals while integrating the needs of wider group stakeholders. Process Engineering - You will be required to work within varying areas of the company to help drive and develop a lean culture within it. Identifying and implementing continuous improvement opportunities is the main drive of our department. You will be process driven taking the initiative on information gathered across the business and ensuring that the company's data is controlled through the introduction of effective procedures and policies. Problem Solving - You will be required to manage and improve efficiencies within a variety of areas, including Processes, Design, Commercial and Intellectual PropertyThe team work closely with the Group MD and have a weekly meeting with him to update him on their progress. The candidate must be able to communicate confidently and precisely when discussing their project's progress. Skills, knowledge and experience- 2:1 degree in a relevant business, IT or engineering discipline OR must be able to demonstrate this level of learning and development through experience- Excellent communicator both written and oral- Ability to work under pressure and to tight timescales - Presentation skills - A minimum of 1 years experience. (this could be a gap year or as part of an undergraduate course) - Willingness to travel - Effective communicator

title: Structural Engineer - Senior
description:
A small practise with more than 25 years’ experience in the construction industry, providing practical and economical design service is looking to recruit Senior Structural Engineer to join its design team located in Great Dunmow, Essex.The practise offers comprehensive structural engineering service for new residential, commercial development and refurbishment of existing buildings. All staff are trained and experienced in the function of the designer under HSE Construction (Design & Management) Regulations 2015. The practise has compliance with SSIP core criteria and is accredited by CHAS safety scheme.As the Senior Structural Engineer your duties will include:Leading a design team, responsible for executing the projects to the programme.Being responsible for design work from the preliminary design stage to the final design.Supervision of Technicians and Graduates.Site survey and site supervision work.To be a successful Senior Structural Engineer you will have the following skills and experience:Qualified Graduate or Civil Technician with post-graduate experience in design work.Good communication skills.Full driving licence.Own transport to conduct site visits.The job title of ‘Senior’ relates simply to the level of experience and has no relevance to age. You are encouraged to apply for any opportunities that you feel to be suitable, irrespective of age or level of experience.In return the Senior Structural Engineer will receive a salary of £45,000 - £60,000 per annum plus a pension, 20 days holiday and flexible working hours.The first stage of the application process is to apply online.Candidate Source Ltd is an Advertising Agency working on behalf of an Employment Agency. By applying for this position you are giving us permission to pass your CV and covering letter to a third party in relation to this specific vacancy. A full copy of our privacy policy can be viewed on our website.

title: Head of Commercial USVF
description:
Position Overview We are currently recruiting a Head of Commercial with responsibility for all USFP bases for our Defence Business Unit to commercially protect the international United States Visiting Forces (USVF) contract, manage risk and to work closely with the DIO Commercial, Finance and Operations Teams and the external fraud prevention advisors as well as USAF Stakeholders. Position Overview To provide the drive, analysis, processes and information to deliver the budgeted financial performance. To provide exemplary commercial stewardship of the contract; developing, maintaining and controlling commercial processes commensurate with Interserve management systems and corporate governance in conjunction with the Central Commercial Team. Oversee the contract to ensure contractual reporting obligations to ensure contractual compliance. Strive to develop and secure opportunities and mitigate risks. Enforcement of a commercial framework in order to measure and guide contract performance, ensuring business processes and practice are conducted in accordance with Interserve Support Services corporate policies and in a way which protects and enhances the performance, professionalism, reputation and image of the company.ResponsibilitiesReview and collate Contract Value Reports for Management review.Provide Support and Leadership to Commercial teams in multiple locationsProvide Leadership to the Additional Works Teams on siteReview and maintain Forward Additional Services Plan and Change to Core Service Register Draft response to contract enquiries/queries from DIO. Draft commercial process documentation for Management review and comment. Support fraud prevention across international locations. Attend internal commercial/ finance meetings. Attend DIO commercial meetings. Draft guidance notes on contract terms/qualifications for field use. Review commercial issues in respect to operations. Draft contract document changes for agreement with DIO. Manage and Maintain records and reporting surrounding Early Warnings and Compensation EventsManage Defect process from a commercial and financial perspectiveAchieve PADP agreed objectives. Any other duties that may arise from time to time at the discretion and direction of the Contract Director in support of the contract. Be aware of the business continuity plan for the part of the business you work in. What we are looking for Knowledge skills & experienceExcellent interpersonal communication skills. Excellent negotiation skills. Good Excel and Word skills. Organised and methodical approach with attention to detail. Alert, assertive, self-motivated and ability to work without supervision. Flexible approach to work and capable of working under pressure. QS or legal qualification. Extensive, post qualified experience in similar commercial role. Inquisitive attitude, willingness to learn, and motivated by continuous improvement. Must have drivers licence and be prepared to travel within the UK and internationally Experience of NEC Term Service Contracts as well as NEC Professional Services and NEC Engineering and Construction ContractsPersonCompetent and confident who has the appropriate knowledge and experience to complete tasks on time and accurately. A people person who is Client facing and who can work with all levels of staff.Full SC Clearance is a requirement on this ContractAdditional job board textInterserve's vision is to redefine the future for people and places. We are one of the world's foremost support services and construction companies, operating in the public and private sectors in the UK and internationally. We offer advice, design, construction, equipment, facilities management and front-line public services. Interserve is based in the UK and is listed in the FTSE 250 index. We have gross revenue of £3.6 billion and a workforce of over 80,000 people worldwide.

Audit Senior | £35,000 -£42,000 + excellent benefits | Chartered Accountancy firm | Elgin or InvernessSRGEurope have been appointed to recruit an Audit Senior to work for a large independent firm of Chartered Accountants and Business Advisers in Scotland.As the Audit Senior you will be responsible for controlling the day to day Audit work typically flag up issues and concerns to the Audit Manager at an early stage; train Assistants as needed; ensure deadlines and budgets are met and the Audit file is presented for review as a substantially complete file, finished to a good standard and signed off. The successful candidate will be responsible for working closely with the Audit Manager and Assistants to ensure the Audit work is handled efficiently and effectively from start to finish and is done in accordance with the Firm's Audit Policy and other relevant policies and processes.The Audit Senior Responsibilities:Arranging the timing of the Audit work with the Audit Manager responsible for the client.Planning, scheduling and delegating work to Audit Assistants, as available, ensuring the most complex work is completed as soon as practical; the Audit Assistants are supported as necessary to complete their work to the standard required; work expected from the client which is incomplete is passed back to the client and is noted for the manager's attention; and the Audit work is completed on time and to a high standard.Monitoring budgeted versus actual time spent, flagging up scope issues, on-site issues and overruns to the Audit Manager on a timely basis.Keeping the client's staff informed of progress and issues while maintaining confidentiality.Auditing the draft tax computation and tax provisions with supporting schedules and liaising with the tax staff to get these reviewed as required.Preparing the draft financial statements to a reasonable standard, free from quality control issuesThe Audit Senior Candidate:CA qualified or equivalentPractical experience of using software systems in the preparation of Audit files, financial statements and audit working papers.The successful candidate will also have good organisational skills and be pro-active in their approach to their work.The CompanyOur client's style is personal and they value their strong client relationships and genuinely partner-led service. Providing excellent training and development opportunities for staff is an important part of what they do, as their long - standing Investors in People accreditation demonstrates, also they have been named as one of 'Britain's Top Employers' for the twelfth consecutive year.To ApplyPlease click on the 'apply' button and upload your CV or alternatively contact Sarah Cairns, Recruitment Consultant on 0131 510 0024.We have a variety of jobs within the Accountancy and Finance sector ranging from £25k-£150k, so if this one is not suitable please get in touch to discuss other exciting opportunities you can apply for.Skills: CTA , ACCA , CA , ACA , CIMA , Audit , Senior , Accountancy


Contact: Sarah Cairns

Technical Service Operations IT Support Manager that has excellent team leadership and management skills with a broad knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Operating Systems, Networking, Storage, Data Centres and End User technologies is required for a well-established, leading Company based in Central London.SALARY: £50,000 - £55,000 per annum + 10% on Call Allowance + 10% Bonus + Excellent Benefits, including Free Travel on certain Bus and Rail Networks ** Excellent Career Development Opportunities **JOB OVERVIEWWe have a fantastic new job opportunity for a Technical Service Operations IT Support Manager that has excellent team leadership and management skills with a broad knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Operating Systems, Networking, Storage, Data Centres and End User technologies.Working as the Technical Service Operations IT Support Manager you will manage a 24/7 IT Operational Team of Second and Third Line Technical Engineers including a Windows Admin Engineer, Unix Admin Engineer, Network Engineer, a Desktop and Voice device Engineer and a System Analyst. As the Technical Service Operations IT Support Manager you will be responsible for the management, development and training of employees within the your function as well as continuous improvements.In addition, as the Technical Service Operations IT Support Manager, you will also be responsible for out-of-hours escalations across the technical platforms, and ensuring that the relevant engineers are engaged and the associated incidents are resolved. You will also work closely with third-party vendors and partners in supporting the platform to the SLA.Successful candidates will have the chance to join a great Company that can offer excellent career development opportunities.APPLY TODAYIf this job looks like your ideal position then please send in your CV as soon as possible for our Recruitment Team to review.DUTIESOperational Senior management responsibility for a team of Second and Third Line Engineers covering resolution of incidents, fulfilling requests and implementing changes across a range of areas including desktops, laptops, servers, phones, switches and routersSenior management responsibility to lead on the maturity of the operational organisation including developing the people, processes and platforms working with the Service Operations Manager, and Technology GroupSenior management responsibility for the associated Business Continuity process and procedures related to all operating platforms including Data Backup and Disaster-Recovery, ensuring that the associated RTO/RPO SLAs are achieved on a consistent basis, and auditing governance displayedResponsibility for ensuring that the associated service KPIs and SLAs are achieved and improved, with responsibility for delivering continual service improvement across the IT assets and servicesPlan, organise, direct, control and evaluate the operations of all the IT infrastructure including IT assets and both local and wide area networksEnsure the hardware assets of the business are patched to the latest operating system levels at all times in line with Group policiesAct as a technical lead for incidents and an escalation point for operational technical problems, including occasional need to be on call by phoneIDEAL CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTSAbility to directly manage and lead a highly technical team; the candidate will also have experience of mentoring othersA broad set of technical skills in Operating Systems, Networking, Storage, Data Centres and End User TechnologiesAbility to communicate with impact and engage effectively with senior stakeholders both inside and outside of the organisationAbility to lead and motivate a teamSystems and process analysis. The successful candidate must have robust problem-solving and analytical skills to deal with complex technical and non-technical aspects of the roleStrong decision making skills – with the ability to balance conflicting interests to resolve a problem experience of working in an ITIL Orientated environment – ideally ITIL Foundation certifiedStrong knowledge of Microsoft Office 365 products and the associated modulesStorage management, design and supportMDM strategy and usage of MDM tools (e.g. Airwatch)A broad range of technical infrastructure skills including working knowledge of Windows / Linux, VirtualisationNetworking, Storage and Data centres – certifications in any domain a plus but not essentialExperience of managing different Microsoft Office 365 products including Exchange Online, Skype for Business and YammerExperience of running large customer facing web sites – including monitoring and performance testing toolingExperience with Citrix and VMware technologies a benefitHOW TO APPLYTo be considered for this job vacancy, please submit your CV to our Recruitment Team who will review your details. CV’s of Job Applicants meeting this requirement will be submitted to our Client for consideration. By submitting your job application to us you are hereby giving us your express consent to submit your details to our Client for this purpose.PLEASE NOTE: CVs MUST be attached to your email job application in Microsoft Word or PDF format for our systems to process your application correctly, rather than your CV copied and pasted into the body of the email.IT Management Jobs, Careers and Vacancies in Central LondonAWD online operates as an employment agencyawdonline | http://www.awdo.co.uk | http://jobs.awdo.co.uk

title: Business Applications Administrator
description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen with Furniture Village. We are currently looking for a Business Applications Administrator (Dynamics Nav) to come and join our team based in Slough. You will join us on a full time, permanent basis and will receive a competitive salary of up to £35,000 per annum plus benefits.Our first ever Furniture Village store opened its doors in Abingdon in 1989 with a simple philosophy: to offer truly excellent products, prices and service to all our customers. Twenty-seven years and over 50 UK-wide stores later, this philosophy still holds true and we are the country’s number one, independently-owned furniture retailer and still growing. Our customers are the best. That’s why we work hard to make their lives easier with superior service, amazing value and bright ideas.About the Business Applications Administrator roleReporting to the Group IT ERP Manager, the Business Applications Administrator role is new to the business, designed to bring knowledge and support of Furniture Village’s new Dynamics NAV 2016 system into the department, alongside assisting with the support and administration of company’s other business systems.Based in Slough, this role will primarily be focussed on Dynamics NAV 2016, and include the day to day administration of the system, working on new initiatives and projects, engaging with key stakeholders from around the business, and helping the other members of the IT Team to become effective supporters of the Dynamics NAV system.This is a fantastic opportunity to come into the business on the ground-floor of our ERP implementation, and work with the latest and greatest version of Dynamics NAV, provided by the UK’s premium retail implementation organisation, within the best furniture retailer in the UK.What you can expect in return our Business Applications Administrator- Bonus arrangements depending on area- Store, Group, RDC, NDC etc.- Holiday – 28 days inc Bank Holidays standard (rising to 33 days after 5 years of service i.e. 1 day for each additional year)- Company pension scheme – auto enrolled- Permanent Health Insurance and Death in Service benefit after 1 year of service- Staff purchases and Friends & Family discount – after 6 months’ service- Long service – 10 and 20 years of service currently recognised- Childcare Vouchers- Cycle to work scheme – help to buy a bikeKey responsibilities of our Business Applications Administrator- Day-to-day system administration, including user security admin and role centre admin- Support system upgrades and enhancements- Provide a third-line support resource for diagnosing and resolving difficult issues- Assist Business Intelligence teams in identifying the correct data sources from within the system to facilitate reporting requirements- Engage and communicate effectively with all levels of our business- Assist the Group Business Applications Manager in the implementation of Dynamics NAV (including data migration, user setup, security setup, testing and issue tracking)- Assist in, and where necessary, lead projects to implement change within the business systems- Be fully knowledgeable of the direction of the business to align solutions to that business plan- Be involved in other IT related tasks, including more general IT support assistance and out-of-hours telephone supportWhat we’re looking for in our Business Applications Administrator- A good general knowledge of Dynamics NAV 2013, 2015 or 2016- Strong technical knowledge of Dynamics NAV- Good knowledge of the data tables within Dynamics NAV- Transact-SQL- Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. Must also be able to convey information clearly through a variety of methods to members of the business at all levels- Excellent time management and scheduling skills- Ability to work within a small IT department, be flexible and adaptable to varying situations and willing to play their part in both the department’s and business’s success- Able to work to tight timescales and deal with users who have differing priorities.- Demonstrable experience in administrating, developing and improving IT business servicesIf you would like to join our team as our new Business Applications Administrator then please click ‘apply’ today – don’t miss out, we’d love to hear from you!


Contact: Furniture Village
        

Reference: Totaljobs/mzm10643BAA
        

Job ID: 74302699

title: Associate Client Partner - Retail and Consumer Practice
description:
Our client redefined consulting to make it better for clients and better for consultants. They analyse every project and hand-pick a team of experienced freelance consultants to tackle it. For clients, this means tailored expertise at highly competitive rates. For consultants, it’s the freedom to focus purely on client issues.

They have delivered 1800+ projects in strategy, operations, transformation and organisation, working in all major sectors and regions of the world
Their 300+ clients include a third of the FTSE100, a third of the world’s largest private equity firms, and 50 of the global Fortune 500, as well as a large number of mid-sized corporates
Their 1500+ independent consultants are truly outstanding. They have backgrounds with top strategy firms as well as the pragmatism borne of experience in industry. They are committed, energetic, and adaptable
Their offices are located in London, Amsterdam and Zurich
They are recognised as a pioneer and disruptive innovator in professional services, frequently referenced by leading business journalists as well as the subject of several Harvard Business School and London Business School case studies

Retail and Consumer is one of their largest practices and they have served over 100 companies ranging from grocers, department stores, specialty retailers, leisure retailers, and pure play digital retailers to niche consumer goods companies and global FMCG companies. As an Associate Client Partner, you work very closely with Client Partners to help them further develop their client relationships and ensure that they deliver well-structured projects that exceed their clients’ expectations. As an Associate Client Partner you will:

Join with Client Partners in developing relationships with new and existing clients, introducing them to the firm and engaging them in insightful conversations about issues of relevance to them
Scope and structure projects for clients and write compelling proposals. This involves drawing on all of your and the firm’s experience to tailor an approach to the specifics of each client situation and working closely with our internal team to select consultants for each project role and craft strong teams
Remain close to each project and ensure that it is on track, that consultants remain positive and productive, and that clients are delighted with progress. You will not be involved in the day-to-day problem solving, but you need to stay close enough to both clients and consultants to respond to shifts in scope and new issues arising
Be working on multiple projects and opportunities in parallel, with at least one other Client Partner
Be an ambassador for their firm with potential consultants and play a key role in assessing new joiners - as well as build trusting and collaborative relationships with the consultants on their projects

 
Likely Experience and Skills
You will have had a successful career in a top tier international strategy consulting firm up to senior manager or principal level.  You will have spent substantial time serving clients in retail and consumer goods, preferably in the UK. In addition, you may have held a line role in strategy for a large corporate or an executive role in a smaller company, again preferably in retail or consumer goods. As a result you have developed the following skills:
 

You have an understanding of how major client relationships are built, and have a track record of helping create and grow significant long term strategy consulting relationships, hence you are not daunted by expectations of generating your own revenue platform prior to election
You can influence decision-making and have a broad knowledge of consulting approaches to help clients resolve their issues as well as an understanding of the issues facing retail and consumer goods clients
You simplify complex problems, understand the underlying issues, and structure pragmatic consulting projects
You communicate logically and fluently, both in proposal writing and in synthesising findings
You are at ease juggling and prioritising a number of different project situations – all the while demonstrating grace under pressure and maintaining a sense of humour and perspective

 
Additional Qualities
Their culture and the way in which they engage with both clients and consultants is a major factor in our success. To be successful as an Associate Client Partner they believe that you will also need to be:

A skilled and highly motivated relationship builder who gets energy from engaging with people and their business issues, and cares about their success
Highly empathetic and able to engage and motivate our highly talented independent consultants, while respecting the unique nature of our relationship with them
Highly collaborative in your approach to working with colleagues, consultants, and clients
Obsessive about high standards and excellence in all aspects of what you do
A valid work permit is required for the United Kingdom. 

Pleaese send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:TCrichard@mindbench.co.ukNB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Digital Analyst - Specialist Public Sector
description:
Digital Analyst - Specialist Public Sector job vacancy from Mindbench | Top-Consultant.com












Welcome to top-consultant.com







Follow us:































Keep informed! 

Catch up on the latest headlines

Contract Opportunities

Consulting Job Search Engine







Digital Analyst - Specialist Public Sector - Central London, only limited travel required£30k-£40k plus bonus, benefits


Digital Analyst 
An exciting opportunity to join a well-respected and growing boutique consulting firm, with an impressive client portfolio.
Are you excited about the power of technology to transform the way that organisations operate and meet their users’ needs?
Do you want to make a real difference and bring about meaningful change to a variety of organisations through digital change?
Prior experience of working in a government setting would be advantageous as well as experience of working as part of a cross-functional agile delivery team, working alongside Service Designers, Product Owner, Delivery Manager, and User Researchers.
 
The company
They are a small but fast-growing consultancy, with clients and partners across the criminal justice sector, local authorities, charities, and a range of private sector organisations in areas such as financial services and technology. They help our clients transform their organisations and the way they deliver services.
 
The role
They are looking for ambitious and keen people with excellent interpersonal, problem-solving and analytical skills to join our friendly and high-performing team. They need people who are digitally savvy and passionate about the role of technology in making organisations ready for the modern world.
You’ll be working with our clients to transform their organisations and the way they deliver services, combining business analysis and digital service design.
This is a fantastic opportunity to be involved in some cutting-edge assignments and to build on your existing skills, working with small teams of energetic, intelligent and creative people.
They have a comprehensive and successful development programme to help you build the skills you need to operate at an even higher level and a senior team with wide-ranging experiences to coach and share ideas with you.
 
What they are looking for
You’ll need an inquiring mind, great communication and presentation skills, and the drive to succeed. You’ll also need to be good at working with other people, well organised and able to think on your feet. A positive outlook, enthusiasm and willingness to learn are essential.
You’ll have experience, and may come from a startup, consultancy or transformation background. You’ll have built up strong skills and experience in mapping or modelling business processes and redesigning services for the digital era. You’ll be able to use common business process mapping techniques, and customer centric approaches to mapping customer journeys.  
Prior experience of working in a government setting would be advantageous as well as experience of working as part of a cross-functional agile delivery team, working alongside Service Designers, Product Owner, Delivery Manager, and User Researchers.
Their Business Analysts have experience of working within a range of industries and sectors and bring a diverse set of skills and experiences. Some of the qualities that contribute to their success in our Company include the ability to apply their skills and experience to a wide range of areas, to pick things up quickly, and to grapple with unknowns and ambiguity. 
You will need SC Security Clearance for this role or willing and eligible to apply for it. A key requisite for SC clearance is that you should be able to provide evidence of 5 years’ recent residency in the UK. 
You’ll be able to demonstrate to us how good you are at:

Gathering and interpreting information from a range of sources including workshops, interviews and written documents
Working with business users and senior stakeholders to understand and map their services and business processes, including identifying service users, mapping the different stages in a services journey / processes, quantifying the resources and time of each stage, and understanding where the costs in each service are.
Using a range of techniques to analyse situations, and quickly gain actionable insights into how to resolve complex problems and identify transformational opportunities within business services and processes.
Coming up with clever, innovative, and workable new ideas and models – particularly around digital service design
Being adaptable and responsive – you’ll use a range of techniques and see what works, and ideally you’ll be experienced in working in Agile and/or fast moving and complex environments
Presenting your findings and ideas in a way that sets out complex issues very simply and explains your logic
Working with other people to unlock problems and change the way they see things
Developing credibility and expertise quickly in unfamiliar or new environments.

This is a very exciting role for the right candidate who is passionate about problem-solving and curious about the world.
They can promise that the work will be varied and interesting, and will give you lots of opportunities to develop and grow. They will help you learn and develop, and there is real scope for you to shape the future direction of the company, by leading teams and assignments, and taking responsibility for shaping our services, developing our ways of working and marketing what we can do.
In return they will offer a competitive package, and the chance to work on some fascinating assignments with our clients from across the government, not-for-profit and private sectors.
Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk
 
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:, quoting reference number:TCrichard@mindbench.co.ukNB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

Site HR Manager – ManufacturingLocation: ManchesterSalary: £45-60,000 + great benefitsWe are seeking a Manager of HR to lead a team of HR Business Partners and Training professionals to achieve business goals in a super-fast based manufacturing business.The role: Develop key HR business partner competencies within your team. Lead your team with a clear vision and empower their employees with clear roles, responsibilities and accountability. Act as a strategic partner with the Head of Manufacturing through understanding desired business outcomes required at a tactical and strategic level.  Advise and support management in the implementation and delivery of HR programs and the optimisation of organisational effectiveness. Mitigate human capital related business risks and support compliance activities. Provide proactive employee relations and partner with assigned leadership to create a culture that supports business growth or business rightsizing and a respectful workplace. Collaborate and direct the support of the HR Centres of Excellence and all elements of the HR delivery model to ensure the delivery of world class HR services and programs to address critical business needs and employ effective measures of success.  Implements Human Resources policies as a generalist, partnering with business operations to ensure a complete understanding of business needs and objectives and resolves HR issues. Responsible for and/or serves as a HR liaison for most of the following areas: succession planning, talent management, employment, employee relations, industrial relations, compensation, benefits, EEO, and/or training and development.  Create a more competitive organisation by driving to reduce the cost of HR service delivery. Partner with leaders to identify top talent and succession candidates and support the succession planning process at the business unit level. Partner with leadership on driving a culture that is diverse and inclusive. Help drive business success by reviewing and analysing HR metrics to monitor performance and identify actionable trends. Support the integration of new business as required. Work with leadership to develop an effective workforce plan/strategy and collaborate with talent acquisition to translate the requirements into an executable plan. Provide guidance and coaching to management in the delivery of compensation programs like annual salary planning, incentive compensation nominations etc. Responsible to drive ethical behaviour and instill a culture of Safety, Health & Environmental throughout the organization, including continuous improvement of Safety standards through the Safety Maturity Matrix. The person:Degree educated or equivalentCIPD qualifiedExperience gained managing the people strategy within a manufacturing or logistics organisation Strong employee relations and industrial relations background  Strong communication skills Make decisions using sound judgment while complying with policies, procedures, appropriate principles and applicable state and federal laws and regulations.  Analyse, evaluate, develop and implement processes and systems within budget and adhere to time requirements and Schedule.  Experience working within shared services HR delivery model; experience in a manufacturing or logistics environment; project management capability; proficiency with PeopleSoft Understanding of Industrial Relations to include experience negotiating pay negotiations and shift changes Must be able to communicate effectively both orally and in writing Exhibit sound interpersonal skillsTo apply please email your CV

title: Engineering Design Manager
description:
In partnership with our client, a local manufacturing company, who has been established for over 40 years with other sites world-wide, and supports customers throughout the world.We have a unique opportunity for an engineering based NPD Manager for mechanical and electromechanical products.As design is at the core of this business, the team uses advanced techniques to design innovative new products.Key Responsibilities: Provide an effective engineering service within the organisation, ensuring that design, production and product development requirements are competently met. Be available to travel overseas to support the business and customer needs.Key skills, knowledge and experience: Must have extremely good project management experience, managing multiple projects from cradle to grave.  Degree in Mechanical Engineering is essential Worked on national grid projects would be an advantage Need to be used to and embrace ever changing technology  Proficient with modern project management software and collaboration toolsThe client will offer an extremely competitive salary for the right candidate so upon applying please state current salary details.We regret to inform you that only short listed candidates will be contacted.

Head of Marketing, Bourne End - An excellent opportunity has become available for a marketing leader to join a multiple award winning, creative business consultancy, in a Head of Marketing role. Our client is looking for someone with broad marketing, who is robust, bold and passionate about marketing, who can come in and create a visionary strategy. In order to be considered for this role you will have needed experience of working within another consultancy!As Head of Marketing, you'll be responsible for engaging broader stakeholder groups and your marketing team of 6. You'll also be responsible for exceling brand equity and representing marketing at key business forums. You will also manage the development of leads, along with formulating social media campaigns to heighten engagement. The ideal candidate will be influential, highly organized and tenacious. You'll also have:*A post graduate qualification, *Experience of developing and implementing marketing strategies*Excellent managerial skills*Experiencing with managing budgets*And you'll be adept in all things digital marketing.  This position represents a fantastic move for a senior marketing professional to step into a commercial and world renowned organisation. This role is commutable from, Oxford, Aylesbury, St Albans, outer London, Maidenhead, reading, Bracknell and Farnborough. For registration purposes please could you let us know where you are currently based or which locations you are considering.If possible please upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV, excluding textboxes or images, as this can affect the consultant's job matching process and therefore your details may not be picked up for a role. Follow BrandJobs on and Facebook and Twitter and LinkedIn to hear about all of our latest jobs.Brand Recruitment offers the services of an employment agency for permanent work. Visit Brand Recruitment online to apply for other key marketing opportunities in the Central and Eastern region. If you have not heard back from us within seven days please assume that your application has not been successful.
