title: Senior AV Project Manager (Live Event Production)
description:
How do you feel about being part of a company who allow their staff to take real ownership of their roles and be truly appreciated for the job they do? If your curiosity has been piqued then read on.Due to growth and very busy times ahead a technical production company now requires a Senior AV Project Manager to be part of their passionate and talented Cambridge based team. You will be part of a business that is driven by the pride it takes in fulfilling the technical delivery of a variety of events in London South East and other parts of the globe so they are looking for someone with the ability and character to match their values.About YouFirstly it is essential that you are experienced in the technical aspects of event production and have the confidence to manage the delivery of an event from its initial concept through to completion. You will also have a good technical background which may have seen you hold roles such as AV Technician, Senior AV Technician or similar because this will allow you to guide your on site teams and assist where needed. Your amiable and professional personality will allow you to easily fit in with the company’s friendly and creative environment and naturally because of the nature of the industry you will have a flexible attitude to the positionThe RoleAs part of the events and rental team you will have the autonomy to liaise with clients and manage the full life cycle of their projects. The events will be a mix of projects for local businesses, bigger brands, companies and organisations taking in locations in the UK and other parts of the globe. Recent overseas projects have taken the team to parts of Asia and Australasia.You will be expected to have the experience and confidence to take the reins of a project and effectively assess a clients requirements from a technical and commercial point of view and have the attention to detail to make sure all relevant project documentation is accurate and correct, including floor plans, quotes and visuals. Working closely with the Operations and Hire Managers you will also see that all relevant resources and logistics have been correctly allocated, planned and scheduled.You will also provide support to the rental team, especially in the early months of your tenure because this will help you to easily understand the company, its process and procedures.The OfferOn offer is a competitive salary based on experience and the chance to join a friendly and family environment with the opportunity to continue the growth of your career. So for further information and consideration apply now with your full technical CVNO SPONSORSHIP IS ON OFFER YOU MUST BE IN THE UK / COMING TO THE UK TO BE CONSIDERED OR HAVE THE APPROPRIATE WORKING VISA



Contact: Lanre Akanni
        

Reference: Totaljobs/LA38189SPM1
        

Job ID: 74262788

title: Midweight Digital Designer
description:
Innovative design agency is looking for a versatile midweight designer to join their small but perfectly formed team!
From beautifully functional web and app design to engaging social content and advertising creative, great design is at the centre of everything our client does.
Working under the Art Director/Lead designer, core responsibilities will include:
 
Leading the UI/UX design on a range of website/app build projects
Production of wireframes and user flows
Design of beautiful, user-friendly interfaces across all devices and screen sizes
Contributing to creative direction of all the agency’s design and creative output
Understanding the business needs of the client, and how these translate to design work

The ideal candidate will:
 
Have a natural flair and passion for design
Have a deep understanding of best practice for digital design including responsive and adaptive
Demonstrate high attention to detail and uphold the highest standards of design at all times
Work collaboratively with the wider team
Have great time management skills, ensuring work is completed within the allotted time frame
Act as a point of reference for other designers and pro-actively look to help others out when the need arises

Required experience
 
2+ years agency experience working on known brands

title: Social Media Strategist - Independent Creative Agency - London
description:
Our client has been a successful City based agency for over 20 years and with a new management team now in place are investing in talent, technology and partnerships. They are creating advertising, digital, design and content for a long list of well-known UK and international finance, corporate and professional services clients. The Digital Strategist role is a pivotal one within the Strategy team and as a niche and regulated sector they require someone who already knows, or is willing to learn fast, the various FCA and global financial compliance regulations relating to advertising and comms. Your role will fundamentally be to get creative ideas and can bring them to life through clear, achievable digital strategies and plans as well as understand a brand and campaign idea and be able to help clients explore innovative ways of getting that brand out there. Other responsibilities will include:Liaising with senior clients, and to spot opportunities and drive them forwards to make a key strand of agency activity. Working on existing clients and campaigns, advising on strategy for paid and organic social activityInputting into new business opportunities and driving digital as a new business in its own right by growing existing client relationships and bringing in new ones. running social media for a financial clients, executing campaigns and campaign management, as well as planning and strategy. Managing your own workload and help out others within the creative and account teams, and offering support where it is needed. Is it you?The Social Media Strategist role will have a lot of autonomy so you will need to be confident in presenting and advising high profile and senior clients. Content and social skills are essential as you must be able to think from an ideas perspective as much as being strategic. Ideally (and a big plus) you have broad digital strategy and content strategy experience as well and can plan across digital channels in an integrated manner. So if you are a Digital Strategist with agency experience who understands the social media and knows how to reach and influence key B2B and professional financial audiences then get in touch today. Please click apply and send Lisa your CVPlease note you must have the right to work in the UK for your application to be considered. Although we try to respond to all applications, unfortunately due to the high number we receive we are unable to respond to all of those who are unsuccessful.

description:
This is an exciting opportunity to lead and inspire the creative team at this leading design and advertising agency.
Based in the London office, we are looking for an experienced creative heavyweight to join award winning branding and design agency. This agency has a reputation for creativity and strategic thinking that has seen them working with some of the world’s leading brands.
We are seeking a passionate and enthusiastic Senior Designer who is able to inspire, spot and develop great ideas and deliver output that will maintain and bolster that reputation.
To be considered for the role you will be a proven Senior Designer who is obsessed with great creative work. You will be well respected within the creative community and will be able to inspire the agency. You will have experience of digital as well as print.

Directing and supervising the creative team, ensuring we stay ahead of our competition by pushing the boundaries of both print and web design.

Collaborating and contributing to the creative process both as the leader of a creative team and as a senior agency figure.
Ensuring that our high quality of creative is upheld, maintaining consistently high standards for our clients.

The successful candidate will:

Have a proven track record (eight years plus) of design in an agency environment. 
Understand how to deliver the brand experience across the full range of physical and digital media, and how to translate that delivery into style guidelines.
Have a complete understanding of end-to-end print design and production.

Be confident in pitches, articulating views with fully-thought-through arguments.

Marketing ManagerSuccessful Integrated Agency | London | £30,000You know when recruiters say that this is a "rare opportunity"? This is one of those occasions.Why so rare? Well The Great & The Good are working with a successful independent agency who need some help doing their own marketing. There's irony in there somewhere.The CompanyThe agency have got some great relationships with huge companies - FTSE 100-type big - and are adept at nicking work from network shops. Dynamic, adaptable and innovative, this London agency has won numerous awards both for their creative work and their strategic thinking.What's most important to the agency's senior team however is that people want to work for the agency. They constantly strive to make the agency somewhere truly enjoyable to be and therefore to keep staff turnover as low as possible.The RoleWorking alongside the MD, this Marketing Manager will be responsible for the agency's external comms. What does that mean? Basically, you'll be looking after the social media and PR channels across earned, owned and bought media.You'll create the comms plan with the MD and then be responsible for ensuring that the agency has a constant and consistent voice in the marketplace.YouIdeally you'll currently be a Marketing Manager for another creative agency (either fulltime or as part of your role). However, our client will also consider Account Managers who want to try something a little different and step away from client services - or rather just look after one client: your own agency.If you feel that your experience fits the bill, please contact David Love at The Great & The Good for a confidential chat.The Great & The Good represents talented people who love what they do. We recruit for the great and the good of the Marketing, PR, Digital, Advertising and Creative industries.

title: Launchpad
description:
Launchpad job with Cohn & Wolfe | 15613483










































































or








































							
			This job is no longer available
			





Launchpad









    Recruiter
    






				Location
			

London (Central), London (Greater)




				Salary
			

.




			Posted
		

02 Jun 2017




				Closes
			

				21 Jun 2017
			



						Discipline
					






						Specialism
					

, 
							
								




						Sector
					






						Business Type
					






						Contract Type
					

, 
							
								




						Hours
					

, 
							
								













Launchpad

Marketing communications is in the middle of a revolution.  The old ways of working are changing faster now than the industry has ever seen before.
Our mantra has always been to “Dig Deeper, Imagine More”. Today, this means we’re excited by marrying the magic of creativity with the potential offered by technology, to enable ideas we’ve never had before.  For our 2017 entry level programme, we’re looking for the revolutionaries to help us drive this change at Cohn & Wolfe London.
Whether you’re an engineer, designer, data geek, aspiring news editor or biochemist you could play a central role in our agency’s future and we want to hear from you.
We’re a curious bunch and together, we’re not only changing our global structure but we’re also reimagining what communications can look like for our clients whether it’s building  or   It’s led us to win 17 Cannes Lions in the last year.
This is not an internship or temp programme – you can leave your printing and tea-making skills at the door.  We’ll give you the opportunity to walk right into a dynamic and global team, delivering award winning creative campaigns for clients that deliver at scale.  As part of our fast track Launchpad programme, you’ll get the right mix of training and entry-level experience you need to kick-start your career.  We’ll also give you the chance to work across multiple markets.

What we ask of you
We want the very best candidates who are passionate, curious and like us relentlessly restless. We also need candidates who can think critically to answer our clients’ challenges. Therefore we have a three stage application process that’s not for the faint hearted.
Step 1 – Launchpad application form completed by 21st June 2017
Step 2 – From the applications we receive, we’ll select a short list of candidates who’ll be invited to participate in an assessment day on the 30th June 2017 in London, UK
Step 3 – A final list of candidates will be invited in for face to face interviews at Cohn & Wolfe’s offices during July
Successful candidates will start the Launchpad programme at Cohn & Wolfe on 4th September 2017
 What’s in it for you?
Cohn & Wolfe London is an exciting and dynamic place to work but it can be hard to get started and we know living in London isn’t cheap. Therefore, we’re committed to providing you with a package that ensures you get settled.
We know you probably won’t be rooming in Fitzrovia from the start, so to help you get from A to B, in addition to our competitive starting salary, and money upfront to help with your rent deposit, we’ll offer you an interest free travel loan.
As a global agency, we also want to provide you with the opportunity to work together with our international partners. Therefore, whether you fancy croissants in Paris or Moleskines in Milan, we’ll give you the option to include a 2 week placement in another C&W European office on your promotion to Account Executive.
You’ll have the opportunity to learn on the job with bespoke training throughout the year. We’ll also host an intensive Freshers Week Training Schedule in the first week of September so you’re equipped with everything you need for the year ahead.

REQUIREMENTS
So are you up for it?
We’re excited about how the industry is changing and are passionate about our role in leading this change.
If you’re the type of person that’s never happy standing still and are always asking why, then we can’t wait to hear from you. Yes, Hollyoaks is about to start and the washing up might still be on the sideboard, but this could be the start of something special so head to the application page and get stuck in.
BENEFITS
We have a great range of benefits which you can tailor to suit you and your lifestyle. Because we know how tough it is to make it in London we will also provide successful candidates with a £2000 signing on bonus to help you get settled in the Big Smoke. Finally, we will also provide you with the option of an instant interest free season ticket loan to ease the cost of commuting in London.

title: Senior Strategy Consultant - Educational Services Market
description:
Our client is a leading international education charity. Their role is to transform lives by improving education around the world. 

Job purpose:
The team for which this role would be working is responsible for the design and development of large-scale high impact projects and programmes that will support their mission to delivery high quality solutions that improve education systems, transforming the life changes of young people globally. Their key purpose within the team is to play a leading role securing new, high-value and strategically important opportunities for the services group. This will be achieved through providing leadership for the identification, cultivation and winning of new contract opportunities, taking ownership for the full opportunity life-cycle. This will focus on one specific geographic region, overseen by the assigned regional director and providing support to them for high-level regional strategy and CRM. The Strategic Development Consultant will also support the wider development of the development centre team process, including the management of internal and team projects.
Job objectives:

1. Lead on the conceptual design of education solutions underpinning high-value and strategically important new opportunities.
2. Provide strategic support for regional directors to identify new business opportunities as required to support their growth strategy within the region.
3. Lead, manage and quality assure new business opportunities, being responsible and accountable for the successful production of high-quality bid submissions for high value opportunities in the region;
4. Managing complex, international multi-disciplinary bid teams including internal stakeholders - e.g. colleagues from business units, business services, commercial, research & consultancy and resourcing - and external partners;
5. Lead or contribute to negotiations with external organisations to form partnerships for joint bids for new business opportunities. Represent the client in collaborative work with external partners during the bidding process;
6. Working with the regional director, ensuring the client is well positioned and prepared for the formal pre-procurement, procurement and mobilization phases of new opportunities, including the production of policy and thought-leadership articles where required;
7. Undertake key client relationship management for an identified geography, supporting the Regional Director to achieve their strategic growth and key account plans.
8. Manage the strategic analysis of market information including client and competitor reviews to support the design, implementation and regular review of an identified Regional Growth Strategy, supporting the regional directors and the head of business development.
9. Work closely with the research & consultancy team in the development of the trust's intellectual property and design of new services;
10. Develop and maintain highly effective working relationships with key internal stakeholders e.g. regional directors, director for research & consultancy, heads of business services etc.
11. Manage internal consulting and improvement projects intended to improve the performance of the development centre.
12. Provide day to day supervision to development consultants to ensure that bids are supported appropriately, and provide coaching and mentoring as required to ensure that the development consultants develop their professional expertise and capability.
13. Line manage staff in the development centre where required / appropriate

Person requirement: 

Person specification:
Knowledge
Essential:
- Strong knowledge of at least three of Education Development Trust’s core markets, covering key proposition areas and/or geographies
- Excellent political and strategic awareness of education context in at least one of our current geographies (UK, Middle East and North Africa, Asia, Sub Saharan Africa)
- Strong knowledge of public procurement and sales processes
- Strong understanding of education system key function and features
- Good degree in an appropriate academic subject – 2:1 or above

Desirable:
- Post-graduate qualification
Experience
Essential:
- Professional experience in consultancy, professional services, programme management, relevant business development or education management environment
- Significant experience of at least two of: project management, strategy, change management, organisation design, process improvement, Client Relationship Management, partnership / stakeholder management
- Strong experience of managing stakeholder relationships
- Strong experience of successful programme / project design
- Experience of successful business development, including successful contract bidding

Desirable:
- Experience working in the education sector
- Experience of working on programme or opportunity development in a non-UK context
- Experience of working in development of new services or policy context

Skills
Essential:
- Outstanding operational design and management skills
- Excellent stakeholder engagement and interpersonal skills
- Excellent analytical skills
- Excellent problem solving skills and creativity
- Excellent writing skills, specifically relating to client communication
-  Numerate with the ability to analyse complex sources of evidence and understand commercial programme design considerations
- Strong IT skills and highly effective use of MS Office applications
- Excellent presentation and client engagement skills
- Excellent written and spoken English
- Strong ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines
- Excellent team working, cooperation and influencing skills

Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk
To apply by email to this position, please send your CV and covering letter to the following link:TCEduation strategyNB: Mindbench is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: Executive Director of Finance
description:
We are looking for an exceptional individual to join the board of directors of this award winning organisation, in order to ensure its continued success.
Given the challenges facing the sector the position requires someone with commitment to the organsation’s values and purpose, and proven skills in building successful business.
Somerset Care is one of the leading not-for-profit social care organisations in the UK with a turnover of £72m and employs c. 3600 staff across southern England. The organisation’s commitment to quality is reflected in its position towards the top of national league tables for CQC quality ratings. Its ambition is to achieve consistent high quality and value for money in providing care and support which helps every individual achieve what they want from life.  
With changes in health and social care, there couldn’t be a more exciting time to help shape the national debate, in order that the organisation can continue to provide outstanding and innovative services.
Alongside board colleagues, the successful candidate will be responsible for the development, implementation and delivery of the organisation’s strategic objectives and vision. In particular, he or she will be responsible for ensuring that the Finance, Payroll, Property and IT teams offer a customer focused service to the business, with decision making as close to the point of service delivery as possible.
It is envisaged that the successful candidate will have board experience gained in either a commercial or third sector environment. Whatever sector you are currently in, demonstrable experience of business building, with people at the heart of every strategy, will be required; as will your ability to contribute at the top table, in a complex operating environment.
Beyond the obvious technical and intellectual pre-requisites, in order to excel in post, the successful candidate will possess the emotional intelligence necessary to engage appropriately with the wide variety of customers, families, colleagues, commissioners and suppliers that they will necessarily encounter.
Somerset Care provides a wonderful opportunity to contribute at board level in an organisation with a strong social purpose, creating a worthwhile personal legacy, whilst working in a part of the country, regularly acknowledged to be ‘one of the best places to live’. Relocation will be offered, if appropriate.
The closing date for this application is: 12th June 2017

title: Corporate Strategy Manager EMEA
description:
Invesco Ltd. is a leading independent global investment management firm, dedicated to helping investors worldwide achieve their financial objectives. By delivering the combined power of our distinctive investment management capabilities, Invesco provides a wide range of investment strategies and vehicles to our clients around the world. Operating in more than 20 countries, the firm is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol IVZ.
As Strategy & Administration Manager for EMEA your role will be to maximise the effectiveness of the EMEA business. Supporting and working closely on all the various matters, issues, projects and opportunities that arise from the SMD’s responsibilities. 
 
Key Responsibilities:

Working in close partnership with the EMEA leadership team, to identify and implement opportunities within the EMEA region that support and enhance the development, implementation and monitoring of strategic plans
Act as liaison and interface to both the regional and Companywide operating platform by acting as an intermediary with all parts of the EMEA business. Identify and implement practices to enhance the coordination and effectiveness of the EMEA business
Assist in the identification of organisation strengths, weaknesses and business opportunities and working in close collaboration with the EMEA senior management team, actively contribute to the delivery of the overall strategic plan and annual priorities
Drive strategic projects associated with the EMEA business ensuring all key projects are tracked and reported on
Be a sounding board for the SMD and help represent people’s views to the CEO and the senior management team and vice versa
Preparation of regular EMEA reports to IVZ and responses to discussion papers or enquiries to the SMD
Organise various management forums and committees; including managing and driving agenda’s, content, presentations and feedback
Representing EMEA on group wide CAO meeting       
Work with the CEO, senior management team and internal communications on an effective communication strategy

  
Experience:

Experience of working within financial services, preferably asset management
Project management experience
Experience of working in a consultancy type role

 
Knowledge:

Good understanding of the asset management industry
Experience of working in a global organisation
Understanding of Invesco’s products, services and culture
Good knowledge of IT systems and management information;
Strong Excel and PowerPoint

 
Qualifications:

Educated to degree level or equivalent, ideally a business graduate

 
Other Personal Attributes Required:

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to adapt style according to the audience and liaise effectively with senior management, including presenting at board level
Ability to source and understand complex information to draw logical solutions and recommend strategic solutions
Strong, creative problem solving skills and a strategic perspective
Highly organised, self-motivated with a great deal of initiative
Resilient and able to demonstrate tact and diplomacy when dealing with confidential and sensitive issues
Strong analytical skills with the ability to pull together presentations and present information succinctly
Able to work flexibly in order to meet deadlines and travel overseas

title: Project and Programme Management - Central London
description:
We're a rapidly growing, award-winning transformational consultancy. We make sure our clients success in their long-term goals by helping them turn their ; by providing ; and by . 

While we're passionate about designing and delivering successful transformation at the highest levels of industry, we're equally passionate about developing our team. 

Our clients are global names, engaging us on complex and high-value programmes and projects which means you will be working at the highest levels of industry. We want you to be exceptional too, we have an extensive learning and development programme that is bespoke to your grade and needs. You can benefit from core skills training, one-to-one coaching, informal mentoring, leadership development and business-skills training from our core partners. 

Experience and skills 

We’re looking for senior consultants, managers and principals to join us throughout the year. While each grade will have specific essential experience and skills, we’re looking for: 

At least four years’ consulting experience with a minimum of three years at a ‘big’ consulting firm 
Experience of implementing complex client strategy (e.g. planning change programmes, delivering major programmes, or improving a client’s own delivery skills) 
Experience of managing different projects for different clients at the same time 
Experience of creating and nurturing client relationships


Rewards and benefits 

All grades receive the same great benefits: 

25 days’ holiday entitlement, which increases after each complete year of service 
Group personal pension scheme 
Medical cash plan 
Life insurance policy


We also have an excellent base salary with two fantastic bonuses, company and personal performance, which can mean different grades can take home excellent cash packages. 

Senior consultant: up to £80,000 
Manager: up to £100,000 (plus sales bonus) 
Principal: up to £130,000 (plus sales bonus)

We are based in Blackfriars, London.

title: Associate Relationship Executive
description:
Hours: Part-time 4 or 5 days/week, 5 hours/day (20-25 hrs/wk)
Location: Central London/Option to work from home – 3 days min in London
Salary: £20,000 p.a
 
Our client is a small independent management consultancy founded by three highly experienced Management Consultants. The company now consists of the three founding partners, Associate Partners and a network of specialist Associates/Management Consultants. They are looking to grow their team in the coming years.
Our client is seeking someone to work within a small operations team, to help build and strengthen their Associate Liaison and Resourcing function, and will play an important part in assisting their growth.
               
The role will have the following key responsibilities:
 
1.Look after the new Associate application process from new enquiries through to arranging interviews and updating the meeting spreadsheet
2.Responsible for keeping the Associate Summary (currently kept on an Excel file) up to date.  Log details of all new CVs/record ongoing communications.
3.Organise and run the Associate up-date call/maintain a summary of 'Hot Priority', 'Associates on the Move' and 'New Client Requirements'
4.Match Associates to job descriptions for new assignments to include shortlisting candidates/engagement with candidates/tailoring CVs/liaising with the Associate throughout
5.Format CVs in house style, to include writing the introductory profile where necessary
6.Work with the Business Support Executive to implement the transfer of the Associate Summary to a database system
7.Work with Business Support to onboard new Associates/provide all compliance documentation as required by the various frameworks/obtain references
8.Development of Associate relationships, including providing advice and support to the network
9.Assist with general office duties as required
 
 
Skills and Qualifications:
 

Strong IT skills to include knowledge of Office 365 suite particularly Excel and    PowerPoint
Experience of recruitment as a first priority or
Experience of working in management consultancy a bonus
Experience of working with databases
Strong organisational/administrative skills
Good time management skills with the ability to prioritise a wide range of tasks
Excellent business communication skills, both written and verbal
The ability to hold a forward-facing role as the role holder will be responsible for Associates’ first impression of the client
Enjoys dealing with people, both via email, phone and face to face.
Ability to work accurately/pay attention to detail
Reliable and punctual
Flexible attitude and can thrive in a diverse work environment
A preference for working for a small business/start up
Commitment to the company’s values and business objectives

title: Operational Excellence Senior Consultant
description:
Mindbench | Top-Consultant.com

Contract Opportunities

Consulting Job Search Engine







Operational Excellence Senior Consultant - UK WideBased on experience, includes company car and bonus


Mindbench is working with one of the leading global consulting firms in operational excellence to hire into the UK office. The firm has been active in the consulting industry for 35 years, supporting many of the leading global brands in both mature and emerging markets.

About he company:
The firm has over 400 consultants with real world hands-on experience capable of designing and implementing clients' strategies and action plans globally. They work from 26 offices globally and represent of 43 nationalities, working on over 900 assignments annually in over 70 countries.
The international scope and local delivery capability ensures that clients have access to specialist skills they require whether at national, regional or global levels.
On average, the firm generates ROI of 5 to 1 in the first year of engagements, and has a client retention rate of over 90% - they work on building successful long term relationships.

The Role:
As an Operational Excellence Consultant, you will be responsible for delivering and/or managing the delivery of Operational Excellence programmes and projects with the company's UK client base.
Your work will be mostly within the Supply Chain with focus on manufacturing companies in the UK.

Required Experience:

Extensive TPM experience with knowledge of Lean and/or SixSigma in Manufacturing, Warehousing, Transport or Supply Chain Planning.

title: Business Development Manger - Performance Improvement Consulting
description:
Our client is a fast growing performance consultancy. They deliver a range of performance principles and behaviors that drive their high performance programmes, board consultation, workshops, events and leader-led learning products. Their clients, who range from the largest and most successful multinationals to rapidly growing mid-market companies. We help these organisations, their leaders and teams achieve and sustain their best possible performance. Taking proven Olympic-winning strategies and using them to achieve their highest personal and professional ambitions. 

Your role will be at the heart of our client's business, winning new clients and expanding existing clients in our target markets. You’ll be responsible for understanding our clients’ business challenges and opportunities, and selling their expanding range of high performance programmes, consulting services and digital learning tools to help them meet their goals. 

You’ll be responsible for:
 Achieving annual targets for sales of our range of our high performance programmes, board consultation, workshops and leader-led learning products.
 Setting a clear sales plan to achieve your target and executing it in line with their development strategy.
 Generating new leads and relationships in existing and new clients to develop an opportunity pipeline to meet your targets.
 Writing timely, creative and impactful proposals to win new sales and maximise existing client business.
 Collaborating closely with Marketing to meet the requirements of key market segments and clients to maximize our profitable growth.
 Demonstrating an understanding of our clients’ business opportunities and challenges and using a consultative sales approach to become over time a ‘Trusted Advisor’.
 Using the CRM system in a disciplined and timely way to track opportunities and manage commitments to customers.
 Continuously developing your knowledge about our programmes and services, and learning about our clients’ and competitors’ approaches to achieving high performance.

The Business Development Manager the person
 An ambitious and experienced Business Development Manager. You will be a perceptive and consultative salesperson, trusted by your clients to help them solve some of the most exciting and challenging issues that confront their organisations.
 Experience of selling learning and development solutions and/or professional services to Director level in the corporate sector. Understands the business development cycle of large sales to multiple influencers.
 A person who listens, understands and reflects on the clients’ issues and then collaborates with our subject experts to propose solutions that may stretch and challenge our clients to truly raise their performance.
 Efficient in managing the business development process, from developing your market focus to creatively generating new leads, and maintaining strong and personable relationships with key clients.
 A self-driven person who thrives in an exciting, rapidly growing organisation.
 Responds well to strong levels of autonomy and the ability to make a real difference.
 Probably enjoys sport and certainly articulates the high performance links between sport and business.

Working with their internal team and external consultants, you’ll contribute towards the strategy of the organisation and will have significant responsibility for its growth. You’ll be backed and encouraged to grow and be as comfortable working by yourself as with others. You’ll contribute your ideas and have the freedom to be ambitious and daring – and be expected to improve the business in its sales processes, client support and marketing. Results-orientated and entrepreneurial, you will determine your own future as part of the company, with potential to progress as the business grows and to be able to increase your earnings even further.

Sales Consultant The Rewards
 An attractive base salary and uncapped commission.
 A contributory pension scheme.
 Agile working approach to hours and location.
 Strong opportunities for career development and progression in a small and growing business.
 Ability to make a difference to the future success of our clients’ businesses

Please send your CV to richard@mindbench.co.uk

title: Management Consultant
description:
When we ask someone to join The Berkeley Partnership, it’s a big decision, for us and for them. 
We work with big, high profile clients, shaping and delivering complex and transformational change. Our partners and consultants help these organisations tackle their most critical challenges, often by working as an integral part of their leadership teams. Our focus is always on making change happen, making it successful and making it last.  Our people focus on building trusting, long term client relationships and only selling work that clients need and want. We truly believe this is key to our long-term success over the past 26 years, and our repeat/referral business supports this.
That’s why we can’t afford to compromise on the quality of people we hire. At Berkeley we develop talented consultants rather than hire in at the most senior levels, so it is important to us that we hire people at the right point in their career. We look for high achievers with 6 – 10 years consulting experience working in high quality, often large consulting firms.  Joiners will have a proven project leadership track record, and the ability to build strong relationships with blue-chip clients.
But meeting our requirements is only part of the story. Life at The Berkeley Partnership is very different from larger firms. With freedom, trust and autonomy comes a high level of accountability. This is by no means a soft option. There’s a strong focus on personal and professional development, with a partner to consultant ratio of 1:3. We don’t do hierarchy. There are just two levels, Partner and Consultant and if the offer of Partnership comes, you’ll know it means something.
Being owner-managed, we can shape the kind of firm we want to work in. We offer our consultants the chance to develop themselves professionally across a range of sectors and types of consulting work. Our trusting, warm and open culture makes Berkeley both a professional and sociable place to work, with high levels of autonomy and little bureaucracy. You’ll need to be adaptable and open minded about different ways of working and projects/industry sectors that are outside of your comfort zone. Sometimes you’ll be leading, sometimes supporting, but the focus will always be on doing the best possible consulting work for our clients. Sometimes you’ll be on your own, although there’s always support from your colleagues when you need it. The pressure can be every bit as high as you’ve experienced before but most of our people find it easier to balance their work and personal interests in a smaller, more flexible firm.
You’ll find our recruitment process thorough and demanding but friendly too. We know it’s a big time commitment, so we urge you to read our website carefully before taking the next step. If you are the right person for us and are ready for a significant career move, it’s time well spent.
If you’d like to find out more about  at Berkeley, please visit our website.

Conduct research work

description:

A company where your ideas are realized and entrepreneurial attitude is rewarded

title: Directors and Partners - Heavy Industry, Building Materials, Natural Resources
description:
The client's firm delivers measurable and sustainable financial benefits. They help companies better execute their plans and strategies to deliver substantial improvements in operating performance and profitability. In short we deliver tomorrow’s results, today.
They partner with organizations to solve strategically important problems that impede top-line growth, or bottom-line results.
They collaborate with their Clients front line employees, supervision, middle management and senior executives, to create and implement solutions that generate a significant return on their investment. A return clients see in their P & L statement within the life of our engagements.
They utilize a framework within which clients can assess, build and execute solutions to their most pressing operational needs, while productively delivering their day-to-day operational expectations.
They help challenge clients to look at their business differently, to accelerate the achievement of their improvement targets, and to create a more agile way of working, in order to win. They bring the power of P3 Operations: People, Productivity & Profitability.
 
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT TEAM
The Business Development Team operates within 3 core geographical markets, the UK, France and DACH.
Each Executive VP has great front-end support internally in terms of research, and sales front-end support teams. Our CRM tool is salesforce.com.
Our client is looking to expand the Executives Vice President(s) within the Team in order to meet its medium term growth agenda and is specifically looking for candidates with specific experience in one or more of these areas: 
- Heavy industry – (manufacturing/food processing/engineering)
- Building & materials
- Natural resourcing
 
Objective of the role: 
- Convert sales prospects into clients by diligently executing the sales model and establishing long term relationships in the market place as a representative of the company.
- Leverage business identification, business development, and knowledge management resources to effectively identify and target potential clients; collaborate with analysis and project delivery teams to secure a long-term client relationship where the client is chosen as the trusted partner for disciplined execution.
 
Requirements
· Proven track record of building relationships at a CEO level
· Understanding of businesses end to end and their financial structures including P&L and Balance Sheets
· Ideally, a combination of consulting and industry experience
· Demonstrates a strong track record of selling
· Need to be able to lead themselves through to securing a client sale
· Develop a robust understanding of the client offering and methodology to be able to discuss it with conviction to a potential client
·  Attend at least 4/5 potential client meetings per week (self-initiated)
· 100% accountability for the sale
· Need to lead a team to secure a client sale
· Execute front end programs and manage portfolio of target clients

identify, segment, and prioritize target clients
develop sales strategies to secure client relationship
stay current with news; key company and industry issues/challenges; individual motivations; executive movements and changes
utilize knowledge management resources (e.g. project database)

·        Leverage research to be able to prepare and present a compelling case for a target client to agree to meet; set meetings with target clients
·        Embrace and adopt the sales model

Effectively & quickly establish credibility with client to be able to engage in an effective business discussion
Use effective questioning and Socratic method to lead client to the desired result -> a fit for Alexander Proudfoot to partner with them to bring disciplined execution to achieve specific business goals
Leverage business development team to work through issues/obstacles during sales process
Secure the sale of a project (with a Business Review as the first step) through establishing a credible business case and relationship with the client
Be a key player in client relationship management through collaboration with analysis and delivery teams to ensure client needs and objectives are met and the decisions are made in the best interest of the client
Maintain client relationships and contacts regularly through consistent and purposeful follow up
Accurately document all client meetings and comply with all sales reporting requirements. Provide timely information to enable sales/unit management to effectively make key business decisions


Establish strong relationships with BDC/EA to ensure meetings are set, held and minimize likelihood of cancelations
Travel daily to client meetings
Proficient in MS Office Suite

 
Required Competencies

Ability to quickly read people to be able to tailor message appropriately; effective communication skills to support role objectives
	
Can pick up on subtle clues to indicate a person’s attention and interest;
Can quickly and concisely present key information to get and hold prospect’s attention and interest
Can quickly establish credibility and demonstrate value
Quick thinker and can shift gears to adapt to situations
Can convince/persuade prospect to set a meeting


Can effectively apply concepts of game theory – enjoys the “strategic element” to planning out discussions and thinking through potential obstacles, considering possible scenarios – with the goal of thorough call preparation to increase possibility of success
Analytical skills – they have the ability to search for reasons and causes, think about all the factors that might affect a decision (relevant to develop sales strategy, portfolio segmentation, research, etc)
Communication skills – good at engaging clients in conversation
Listening skills – can actively and critically listen to be able to understand, interpret and evaluate client discussions; hone in on important information and then follow up
Able to learn business concepts for a variety of industries and apply them with clients (credibly) to support a meaningful business discussion

 
Personal Characteristics Profile

Driven and ambitious – high level of personal drive and achievement;
	
willing to work hard;
striving to be the top sales performer for the organization;
 fixated on achieving goals and continuously measuring their performance relative to the goal; As a result they:
		
seek to understand factors involved in customer decision making
driven to meet only with key decision makers
strategize about the people and how to match offering to organization (vs speaking only about the offering)
have a sense of urgency




Professional presence and maturity - present themselves confidently to C-Suite clients
	
Able to establish yourself as a peer
Credible


Responsible and accountable – takes ownership for his/her actions and strives to take on increasing responsibility; committed to values like loyalty and honesty
	
Strong sense of duty – reliable
Takes responsibility for results – owns portfolio
Stays focused and understands that they control their own destiny


Has integrity – must be honest
	
With the client about capabilities; it is more respected to say “no” we do not do this; as opposed to lose credibility with the client because you say “yes”
even about bad news; understands that information must be accurate and actionable to enable management to make decisions


Genuine interest in the client’s business and willingness to see them succeed
	
Embodies and conveys to the client a “partnership” model – positions the client and Alexander Proudfoot as the team to achieve results
Establishes client and client business as the focus of the discussion and ultimately the purchase decision


Tenacious – does not give up easily, takes rejection but not easily discouraged; shakes it off and can get back into the fight; competitive spirit
	
able to handle emotional disappointment,
bounce back from a loss;
and mentally prepare for the next opportunity


Courageous
	
not afraid to challenge the client
not afraid to aim high and cold call new prospects


Naturally inquisitive
	
digs deeper to understand what is below the surface; asks follow up questions
remain active and engaged during client meetings
ask difficult and uncomfortable questions in order to uncover issues
able to quickly shift gears even when conversation deviates from prepared strategy (quick on your feet)
driven to find the truth (understands that only specific details will in turn help to achieve the right fit and deliver results to the client)


Disciplined – creates routine and structure; understands the value of order in getting things done; pays attention to detail
	
Sees value in preparedness
Sticks with the process even when it appears to not work


Willing to travel daily, as required, to attend client meetings
 

Education

Graduate, preferably with a further qualification e.g. MBA, MA

title: Project Manager (Technical)
description:
IR35 - this roles falls OUTSIDE IR35 We require 2 Project Managers - One will be for the Smart Cambridge workstream and the other for the Connecting Cambridgeshire workstream. JOB PURPOSE:The Connecting Cambridgeshire and Smart Cambridge programmes are looking for two experienced project managers with experience of project management, procurement and commissioning of projects, stakeholder engagement and ideally with experience of working on digital connectivity projects. We are looking for highly organised project managers who are able to interpret and bring structure to new programmes of work. We are interested in people who work in a structured way with experience of applying a recognised project management methodology at the appropriate level of detail and rigor to the project size and complexity. Smart Cambridge is an exciting programme of work that looks to utilise new and emerging technology to help address some of the issues that Great Cambridge and beyond face. The programme is a workstream within the City Deal, a major new initiative totalling hundreds of million pounds. The Connecting Cambridgeshire Programme has been established to support the creation, promulgation and delivery of the digital agenda for Cambridgeshire. This includes the Superfast Broadband delivery project for Cambridgeshire as well as delivery of related workstreams within the Connecting Cambridgeshire programme, including mobile coverage and public access Wifi. The Connecting Cambridgeshire programme is about to embark on a new procurement for phase 4 of the superfast broadband roll-out programme and require a project manager to manage the planning and procurement workstreams as well as other workstreams within the programme as required. BOTH ROLES WILL INVOLVE:1. Start up, run and see to completion assigned projects following an approved project methodology such as PRINCE2. 2. Work with the Programme Director and Programme Manager and project boards where appropriate to confirm the definition of the project, producing an agreed Business Case and Project Initiation Document. 3. Draw up detailed plans for projects and agree the resourcing of those plans with the Project Board and Programme Manager. 4. Formulate and lead a project team to carry out the tasks and deliver the products defined in the plan. 5. Manage the tasks of the project team, suppliers, and Council staff outside the project team, reporting progress, risks, issues and exceptions regularly to the programme manager, project sponsor and project board. 6. Manage procurement activities. 7. Ensure that appropriate quality checks are designed and carried out for each of the deliverables of the project. 8. Work with the Programme Manager to ensure the activities in the project are co-ordinated with the other projects in the programme. 9. Review the outcomes of projects and make recommendations for the next steps. 10. Take a part in other projects, programmes and other work as and when required.Please apply below.


Contact: Billy Fitter
        

Reference: Totaljobs/BF7837373

Head of Marketing job in Milton Keynes paying up to £70k (perm)  Your new company  A fantastic company known all over the world are seeking a new head of marketing to drive the UK strategy.  Your new role  In you new Head of Marketing job, you will manage the overall marketing strategy and objectives, building a customer-centric approach and integrating digitisation across the business. You will manage PR service and internal communication activities to keep staff members engaged. Furthermore, you will manage the analysis and reporting of key data and identify opportunities moving forwards. title: Head of IT
description:
Pay rate negotiable for the right candidate*JOB CONTEXT:This post will lead and shape the LGSS service provision of Information Technology (IT) services to Cambridgeshire County Council. The Head of IT Services will lead and develop the LGSS IT Services for Cambridgeshire County Council aligned to both the supporting LGSS IT Strategy and the IT Strategy for Cambridgeshire County Council. In addition, the post holder, in conjunction with the LGSS Director of IT Services will be responsible for the business relationship with Cambridgeshire CC and other LGSS IT supported organisations such as EdICT, the operational relationship with members of the CPSN framework and the LGSS Law service for Central Bedfordshire Council and other LGSS IT Supported organisations that join in the geographic area.JOB PURPOSE:To Lead the IT service delivery with the objective of attaining high levels of customer satisfaction and retention;In the Head of Service Role this post will be a key part of Cambridgeshire’s senior management team, working to deliver the Council’s business strategy and understand the challenges and opportunities faced by Cambridgeshire as it works to deliver transformed services across the County. This role must work closely with Cambridgeshire’s management teams to encourage the development, adoption and use of converged solutions already within the LGSS IT portfolio and also to highlight opportunities driven by business need and any gaps to be fed into the development of the IT Strategy, working with the Head of IT Strategy and Architecture.As a key part of the LGSS IT management team the individual will gain a knowledge of and network within the local Public Sector, especially in Local Government and Health. Using skill and experience this individual will work to grow relationships and identify opportunities for new Shared Services, either directly in IT or in other B2B services working with the wider LGSS team. Working with the LGSS Director of IT Services, IT business cases will be developed with other organisations for single solutions, functional areas or whole services.EDUCATION / QUALFICATIONS:Relevant IT Industry accreditations (i.e. ITIL), Relevant Diplomas, Certifications, degree qualification; NVQ level 5 or equivalent; including all chartered professions and post-graduate qualification.EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE:Knowledge and experience of delivering services to multiple customers. Given the commercial nature of LGSS it is essential that the post holder has knowledge of the frameworks and processes required to facilitate IT service delivery within multiple customers and partners Having a good understanding of strategic imperatives and a handle on technology drivers within a commercial environment is essential. It is also essential that the post holder has a proven track record of delivering IT services, projects and programmes within this type and complexity of environment.Operating at a Senior Management Level Significant post-qualification experience and knowledge gained either in the public, private or voluntary sector, including experience of operating at a senior management level. This will include a successful track record of managing technical teams across multiple disciplines in a challenging financial environmentStrategic Planning and Delivery Extensive experience of strategic planning and service delivery within local or central government or private sector, with a demonstrable and proven record of achievement in same. This will include experience of solution and business case development, analysis and interpretation of business requirements and in a multi-disciplinary and partnership environment as well as restructuring and integrating complex functions.Management of dispersed teams from differing backgrounds and organisations Demonstrate a track record of managing diverse and disparate teams, both internal and external to deliver consistent high-quality services.Stakeholder Management Practical evidence of developing and maintaining good working relationships with a wide range of customers/stakeholders, developing a positive personal and organisational profile and building partnershipsBudget Management Demonstrable achievement in successfully managing budgets in a demanding public arena.Service Delivery Knowledge and experience of leading and managing IT servicesPlease apply below.


Contact: Billy Fitter

title: Executive Director
description:
Our client is a highly renowned and prestigious music academy, guided by the vision that all children and young people in Gloucestershire will have access to high quality music education and associated arts activities, and that their teaching systems will have impacted positively on the music sector UK-wide. Right now our client is looking for an efficient and strategy oriented individual to come in and take charge as an Executive Director at their location in.Job Purpose:To develop, deliver and oversee implementation of the business plan working closely with The Director of Music.Your general duties would require you to:Ensure a balanced bottom line, including production of detailed financial projections, management accounts, cashflows and year end reportsSupport strategic review and planning alongside the Director of Music, including responsibility for producing detailed business plans and associated financial projectionsDeliver strategic / organisational development initiatives as requiredLead on devising and implementing the organisation’s income generation strategy and plans, working closely with the Director of Music and Finance CommitteeWriting of bids and grant applications to secure raised incomeHold lead responsibility (supported by an allocated Board member where appropriate) in the areas of:- Health & Safety- Equal Opportunities- Recruitment, induction & trainingMonitor, review and maintain quality standardsEnsure legal compliance in all areas, in particular appropriate contracting with personnel and partners, with the support of the BoardProduce and oversee implementation of annual marketing plans, ensuring termly reviewOversee core marketing, including website development / maintenance and social media platforms.As you progress further into the role more responsibilities will begin to open up for you, but as it starts, this vacancy will require you to perform the general duties expected of an Executive Director.Essential experience required:Significant experience of senior managementA track record of successful bid writing, securing grants, investment and / or contractsLine management experienceProven negotiation skillsThe ideal candidate will be a well driven individual with a firm understanding of the legal, fiscal and public agreement frameworks within which a publicly funded charitable company operates. Our client also seeks someone who is reliable and able to multi-task under pressure and to deadlines.TERMSPost: Fixed term contract to August 2018, ideally with immediate start (potential for extension to contract, subject to funding)Weekly hours: 22.5 hours (fte 0.6)Salary: £30,000 - £35,000 pro rata (subject to experience)Location: Barbican House, Barbican Road, Gloucester GL1 2JFHoliday: 22 days + bank holidays (pro rata)So if you feel that you’re the right person for the job and would like to get onboard with this fantastic opportunity, then please send in your CV today by clicking the APPLY button below.

title: Health & Safety Consultant
description:
Our client have an excellent opportunity for a Health & Safety Consultant to join their well established H&S team, based from Sheffield and helping to cover their North region.The company is a membership organisation and the UK’s leading trade body focused in the Manufacturing and Engineering Sector, they work with a broad range of businesses, including world class blue-chip organisations. They offer a range of professional services to their members and to non-member organisations - principally HR & legal, health & safety, climate & environmental advice, training & consultancy.In the role of Health & Safety Consultant, you will be delivering effective and professional health and safety services to both members and other clients. It is expected that approximately 60% of your time will be spent providing consultancy services and the remaining 40% will be spent delivering and developing training; such as IOSH, NEBOSH Oxford Brookes and in-house tailored courses.Key Responsibilities:• Design and deliver open and in-company health and safety programmes to the highest standard, ensuring that business needs and/or examination requirements are met.• Provide a high-quality health and safety consultancy service to both members and clients.• Maintain and develop relationships with new and existing members and clients to meet their current and future business needs.• Continually promote the brand and its services, in conjunction with other areas of the business including Marketing, Policy etc. and the development of new products and services.• Deliver the health and safety aspects of our related membership package consistently and to a high standard.Skills & Experience:• A NEBOSH Diploma is essential.• Practitioner level membership of IEMA (PIEMA) or the equivalent is preferred.• Strong experience of working in the field of health and safety, with experience of delivering training.• Knowledge and experience of environmental issues and management systems (EMS) – i.e. ISO 14001 and/or 18001• Superb technical skills, including up to date knowledge of H&S gained through CPD.• Preferably experienced in dealing with strategic and specific health and safety issues within a sector that is high risk, such as manufacturing, engineering, construction etc.• Flexibility to travel internationally may be required.Benefits & Additional Information:• Competitive salary, plus an annual car allowance• Potential for flexible working• Private health cover• Pension with up to 8% matched contribution• Development and progression opportunitiesWe require all job applicants to share our company-wide commitment to putting the Customer First. If you are invited to an interview, you will be required to demonstrate a good understanding of customer service and to provide examples of having delivered customer service to a high standard.



Contact: Polly Dillon
        

Reference: Totaljobs
        

Job ID: 74502233

title: Senior Insolvency Lawyer/Partner
description:
Are you a Senior Insolvency Lawyer/Partner who feels that you've taken your current department as far as you can, and are now looking for a new challenge? Or are you ready for that step up to work to Partnership?  This well-established Legal 500 law firm in East Sussex is currently looking for a Senior Insolvency Lawyer/Partner to join its recognised team, in this key placement. You will be provided with all the support and development to help grow and develop the department. The firm has an ambitious strategy and a strong management team in an exciting growth stage.  Your role as a Senior Insolvency Lawyer/Partner will involve:Handling work that involves both contentious and non-contentious insolvency and business recovery related workBeing able to business develop in order to bring new clients in A clear career path from the outset - either as Senior Associate, or working towards Equity PartnerMy client is eager to shortlist for interviews as soon as possible.   Please apply for this Senior Insolvency Lawyer/Partner role based in East Sussex on-line, or contact Chris Rodriguez at G2 Legal. 01273 289000.About usFormed in 1999, G2 Legal Limited is one of the largest, privately owned legal recruitment companies with offices throughout the UK and in Sydney, Australia. We are a fully accredited member of APSCO. Please visit our website for more information on the services we provide and current opportunities.
    
    

Contact: Chris Rodriguez
        

Reference: Totaljobs/CRO136615
        

Job ID: 74510969

title: Consultant Ecologist - Shrewsbury
description:
My client is an independent environmental planning and design consultancy who specialise in the provision of high quality ecology, landscape, archaeology and arboriculture services. Working within sectors including commercial and leisure, education, urban regeneration, energy and infrastructure, this organisation work on a wide variety of exciting and innovative projects. With several exciting new projects to work on, my client is actively seeking a Consultant Ecologist to join the team in their Shrewsbury office.Personal RequirementsEducated to at least degree level in an ecological or environmental-related disciplineProven consultancy experience, ideally within an environmental consultancyExperience of scoping, designing and leading habitat and species surveysGood working knowledge of mitigation designMembership, or eligibility for membership, of the Chartered Institute of Ecology and Environmental Management (CIEEM)At least one protected species licence, e.g. bat, GCN, dormouseExperience of preparing fee proposalsDemonstrable experience of producing high quality technical reportsAbility to work efficiently to given time and budget constraintsWillingness to develop project management and client care experienceRole ResponsibilitiesWorking as a consultant ecologist, you will provide support and technical skills to the ecology and wider team within the organisation, working on a range of challenging ecology and multi-disciplinary projects throughout the UK. You will play a role in implementing and designing Protected Species Surveys and Phase 1 and Phase 2 Habitat Surveys. Your responsibilities will also include analysing data and preparing high quality technical reports and documents, such as Ecological Impact Assessments and Ecological Appraisals.You will liaise with a range of clients, ensuring excellent working relationships are maintained as well as identifying opportunities for follow-up business. You will work alongside wider teams within the company, made up of arboricultural consultants and landscape architects. You will ensure all work is carried out to the highest possible standards, providing the client with support throughout the all stages of their project.The successful candidate will be offered a competitive rewards and benefits package, access to a range of individual and professional development opportunities and the guarantee of an engaging and supportive working environment. For more information or for further vacancies within the Ecology sector please contact Gemma Seaman of Penguin Recruitment directly on 01792 365 002. Alternatively, you can email us and we'll call you back. Emails to: . KEYWORDS: ecology, ecologist, consultant, survey, protected species, habitat, CIEEM, bat, GCN, project management


Contact: Gemma Seaman
        

Reference: Totaljobs/GS2017-A203
        

Job ID: 74511710

title: Financial Reporting Manager 12 month FTC
description:
A Leading Professional services firm are recruiting for an ambitious Financial Reporting Manager to manage a small financial reporting team consisting of Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivables and Management Accounts. You will be a subject matter expert in key accounting principles and in house accounting systems supporting both the finance team and projects. Requirements:- ACCA / CIMA qualified- Excel - intermediate / advanced level- Advanced computer literacy (MS Office Suite)- Team management experience- Experience of P&L management and production of a full set of management accounts- Excellent communication (verbal & written) and interpersonal skills- Strong literacy and numeracy skills- Ability to analyse data, problem solve and make decisions confidently- Meticulous attention to detail- Highly organised and able to manage own workload and team members to meet strict deadlines- Proactive, positive attitude and approachable- Ability to work in a dynamic, complex and fast changing environment- Experience of working in a corporate environmentIf you think you are relevant for the position, Please apply today as our client is actively interviewing this week and next. title: Practice Manager - Hertford - £45,000 Per annum
description:
Job Title: Practice ManagerLocation: HertfordSalary: £45,000Per annum Contract: Full TimeA Dynamic and growing firm are looking for an experienced, intelligent and ambitious individual who is seeking an active practice manager role with the enthusiasm and Desire to progress to a partner levelThe ideal Candidate will have Practice and Management experience, proficient in reporting and advanced knowledge of Excel. Will have experience in managing and motivating employee’s and be qualified in ACCA, ACA or CIMAThe Job: ·Working with the head of Finance ·Ensure that all client work is requested, completed, delivered and billed in advance of statutory deadlines·HMRC contact for all tax areas ·Set up and manage arrangements ·Deliver business goals and profit targets·In-put, creative ideas ·Manage group accounts ·Manage and build client relationships·Manage staff and schedule workload ·Provide support for complex and escalated technical queries on a daily basis·Prepare and submit monthly management accounts ·Maintain and analyse sales, purchase and nominal ledgers for the business Skills/ Experience required:·Qualified (ACCA, ACA or CIMA) ·Experience at a similar level ·Use of (Excel advanced, SAGE, Free agent, Tax calc, Xero)·Must have experience working within an accounting practice, including providing advice to clients ·Must have management experience ·Hands on accounting skills·Excellent time management skills are essential ·High level of attention to detail ·Ability to maintain positive relationship’s·Excellent MS office skills - Especially advanced Excel and data analysis ·Organised and methodical ·Ability to interpret legislative changes·Ability to motivate and manageCompany Benefits·Attractive salary ·6% Pension ·24 days Holiday ·Private Health care ·Free parking on-site·The Opportunity to grow and develop with an exciting company that is committed to success and the success and development of their employees.Should you be short listed for this position, a member of the Smart10 team will be in touch with you in the next five working days. Good luck with your application!Smart10 Ltd is a "Multi Award Winning" and Independently run recruitment consultancy which specialises in both Permanent and Temporary positions across all Business Support roles. Smart10 have become renowned as one of Hertfordshire's most dynamic recruitment companies. As a business, we won the Judges Award in 2012, Best New Business Award in 2013 and 'Business Person of The Year in 2016, at The Hertfordshire Business Awards, for being the most "promising" and "innovative" company within Hertfordshire. We are proud to work with a leading number of blue-chip companies as well as smaller SME’s throughout the region. The smart10 team are an energetic and smart team of highly experienced and professional recruitment consultants who are committed at exceeding both our candidates and client’s expectations.

title: Cognos TM1 Consultants - Locations Across Asia
description:
My client has a strong track record of delivering EPM and BI solutions globally and are experiencing a significant period of growth as they continue to secure further international projects. They are now seeking to add Cognos TM1 Consultants across Asia in their regional hubs such as Hong Kong, Shanghai, Tokyo, Taiwan and Singapore. Successful candidates must have Cantonese, Mandarin or Japanese language skills.The role is suitable to experienced TM1 experts, seeking to expand their technical skills, but also take ownership on the design and client management. Within a growing team, you will have the support of an experienced consultancy but have a great opportunity for entrepreneurship fostering new networks and be a leader in team development within this Asian market. As a Senior Cognos TM1 Consultant - Hong Kong, Shanghai, Tokyo, Taiwan responsible for developing innovative TM1 solutions to a range of clients in a diverse range of industry sectors and projects. Working with various IT and finance consultants will be key to maintaining strong partnerships across client projects. Within the client environment Cognos TM1 Consultants must be able to direct the ongoing strategy for the introduction of or upgrading of Cognos TM1, delivering a client focused solution to suit the business processes.With a strong project pipeline of greenfield implementations you will not be short of exciting projects across Asia. Key Responsibilities: Cognos TM1 Consultants - Locations Across AsiaOwnership for the full project lifecycle - End to end project management on leading TM1 projects Carry out functional analysis and business analysis of client requirements Be responsible for all development activities within the project - design, modelling, build and go-live Design and develop reports within TM1 and BIResponsibility for client/ user training, knowledge transfer to the clientManage all stakeholder engagement and advise clients throughout project assignments Actively contribute to technological developments within the TM1 space - development of new add-ons. Train and mentor junior consultants and developers  Candidate Profile5-10 years of EPM and BI Consultancy experience, with at least 3 years of TM1 experienceStrong TM1 skills including, Advanced TM1 rules and Turbo Integrator knowledge Experience of TM1 Architect/ Perspectives/ Performance Modeller/ TM1 Web/ CafeExperience of using ETL tools and DWH conceptsThe individual will be able to participate as an effective team member on implementation projects with all key stakeholders. Experience of Cognos BI and other BI reporting tools is beneficial Java programming is also an advantageStrong customer focused approach dealing with all levels of staff with different skill sets, whilst able to get the message across and deliver the right technical solution A strong understanding of finance processes and an affinity for understanding finance usersMust have fluent Mandarin, Cantonese or Japanese dependent on location. Salary is negotiable based upon level of experience. Very competitive packages in line with market rates.If interested in this Cognos TM1 Consultants - Locations Across Asia opportunity or other similar roles get in touch now! For all the latest global EPM, BI and Finance Systems opportunities get in touch with Geoff Coleman International Consultant with SystemsAccountants on +31 207 095 137 Alternatively contact via email .


Contact: Geoff Coleman
        

Reference: Totaljobs/J8760
        

Job ID: 74511117
