title: Practice Manager - EPM/ CPM -Tagetik, Cognos, Anaplan
description:
A very exciting leadership role with a market leading Corporate Performance Management (CPM) consultancy has arisen within their Belgian operations. As the Practice Manager - EPM/ CPM -Tagetik, Cognos, Anaplan, you will have ultimate responsibility for the dynamic team of consultants and their successful delivery of CPM projects. Having partnerships with several vendors, you will manage these relationships and oversee the delivery of a range of market leading CPM products. In this role, you will be challenged to build relationships across the business both internally and externally with your team and with new and existing customers, being the focal point for all consultancy operations throughout Brussels, Antwerp, Ghent and beyond.The key challenge in this role is to drive the company values throughout all aspects the team and help define this culture going forward. With a fast-growing team and a very strong project pipeline, this presents itself as a fantastic opportunity for a professional to walk into a very positive point in this consultancies lifecycle and have the opportunity to influence change and drive the continued growth across the Benelux region over the coming years.Key Responsibilities: Development of Services & Solutions offerings and go-to-market strategyRequirements gathering, coordinate workshops with clients and senior stakeholdersDesign of qualitative solutionsManage an expanding team of consultants in the Belgium practiceAssure delivery of all projects in the regionCreate and prepare project estimates and the statement of work for assignmentsRespond to RFPsActively coordinate Proof of Concepts (POCs) with sales teamFocal point to coordinate all customer requestsCoordination of all consultants across current and future projects, ensuring optimal utilization of all resourcesLeadership role in training, mentoring and managing consultants, including operational role in conducting 1/2 yearly performance reviewsPlay a key role in the hiring process of new consultants within the teamCoordinate regular code review process on all ongoing projects to ensure consistency of deliveryManage P&LCandidate Profile:8+ years' experience within consulting or professional services functionsMust have people management experience with responsibility for the development and coordination of direct reportsExperience of delivering numerous CPM/ EPM projects as a consultant and Project ManagerIdeally experience in a similar Practice Manager or Senior Manager function, Big4 experience is an advantage but not a requirementYou have a profound technical knowledge of at least one of the CPM tools e.g. Cognos TM1, Controller, SAP BPC, Oracle EPM (HFM, PBCS, Planning), Tagetik, Anaplan, Board International, etc.Strong skills are required with respect to pre-sales or business development, solution sellingMust have a strong understanding of finance, ideally qualified accountantPrevious experience as a Controller, Finance Manager or similar role is a significant advantageStrong communicator, ability to drive change, lead teams and motivate both consultants and clientsFluency in Dutch, French and English is an assetIf interested in this Practice Manager - EPM/ CPM -Tagetik, Cognos, Anaplan opportunity, please do not hesitate to get in touch with Geoff Coleman of SystemsAccountants now on +31 207 095 137 or email direct at .

title: Purchasing Manager, Sheffield, £40K-£45K DOE
description:
We are currently looking to recruit a Purchasing Manager to head up a busy Purchasing team in Sheffield. This is an exciting role offering the successful candidate great levels of variety, challenge and the opportunity to work for a well known company who offers a compeative salary and a great benefits package.Main DutiesMaintain records of goods ordered and received;Locate vendors of materials, equipment or supplies and interview them in order to determine product availability and terms of sales;Prepare and process requisitions and purchase orders for supplies and equipment;Prepare and process work orders for the internal process of products;Control purchasing department budgets;Manage the day to day activities of the team, ensuring effective leadership, direction and motivation;Provide effective people / performance management of the team, ensuring daily contact, effective supervision, performance management and training & development;Recruit, select, train, monitor and manage team personnel;Review purchase order claims and contracts for conformance to company policy;Analyze market and delivery systems in order to assess present and future material availability;Develop and implement purchasing and contract management instructions, policies, and procedures;Participate in the development of specifications for equipment, products or substitute materials;Resolve vendor or contractor grievances, and claims against suppliers;Represent the company in negotiating contracts and formulating policies with suppliers;Review, evaluate, and approve specifications for issuing and awarding bids;Direct and coordinate activities of personnel engaged in buying, equipment, machinery, and supplies;Establish, develop and maintain excellent work relations with all key stakeholders - internal and external;Negotiate group contacts for utilities;Report on waste packaging requirements and maintain the records;Support group companies with sourcing requirements when requested to do so;Visit suppliers and attend trade shows as required.Successful CandidateStrong analytical skills with excellent standard of numeracy to analyse facts and figuresCompetent project / time management and organisational skillsExcellent communication / interpersonal skills to interact successfully at all levelsIn possession of excellent relationship management and procurement skillsPersuasive with good influencing and negotiation skillsAbility to make responsible decisionsAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyStrong relationship management skillsDue to the volume of applicants, we are unable to reply to every candidate individually. Successful candidates will be contacted by telephone.Office Angels is providing the services of a Recruitment Consultancy and is an equal opportunities employer.Office Angels is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. The Adecco Group UK & Ireland is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

title: EPM Senior Consultant/ Project Manager - HFM
description:
My client, a specialist Oracle Hyperion consulting organisation are looking to expand their consulting team with an experienced Hyperion Financial Management (HFM) professional that can take a leading role in the delivery of their increasing workload as an EPM Senior Consultant/ Project Manager - HFM. This business has a great foothold in the French market but is very much at the beginning of a expansion phase that will offer exceptional opportunity to someone that takes a senior role at this timeThis role as a EPM Senior Consultant/ Project Manager - HFM will involve the delivery of HFM projects within Paris and throughout France, controlling functional design and ideally quality assuring the technical solution. Their existing project workload and pipeline of new work will provide the successful applicant with unrivalled exposure to the latest HFM application and its supporting integration with broader Oracle apps including cloud and planning solutions. This company have unrivalled in house technical delivery abilities so this role will functionally control much of their outputs on client based programmes. Consultants also have the opportunity to be cross trained in other applications such as Tagetik, Anaplan and other Oracle tools to enhance their skills and project delivery capabilities.This is an excellent opportunity for and functional EPM specialist to join a highly regarded team and work on some of the most interesting EPM programmes in France. The role will benefit someone currently leading an HFM team or practice that is looking for a very different model and career path to that normally experienced in similar sized Big Four or system integrator teams. The opportunity will undoubtedly flex to fit the ideal candidate and their consulting experience to date but it will certainly offer a step up in level for those looking to deliver optimal complex HFM solutions into tier one clients.Desired Skills and Experience:Functional and/or Technical lead delivery experience of HFM applications and projectsPrior Hyperion consulting experience would be of benefitA finance background or Finance qualification e.g (ACA or ACCA) would be of benefitWider experience of Hyperion Planning, PBCS, FCCS,HPCM, DRM or HSF would also be advantageous.Excellent interpersonal and stakeholder management skillProject management experience is a significant advantageFluent French is requiredFor further informatio on this EPM Senior Consultant/ Project Manager - HFM opportunity, or to discuss other EPM and Finance Systems opportunities please contact Geoff Coleman on

title: Project Manager
description:
Are you looking for your next step in your Career?My client is a recognised market leader in the design and manufacture of connectors and electrical harness systems used in harsh environments for the Rail and Defense industries.An opportunity has arisen for a Project Manager to join my client within the Programme Management department. Your primary responsibility will be to manage new projects from initial proposal stage through to serial production, ensuring that project deliverables are achieved and are in line with customers’, internal business and regulatory requirements. The Role • During the introduction of new products, comply with customer requests / market requirements whilst ensuring best cost effectiveness to the company. • Obtain quotations, as required, whilst ensuring compliance with company quality procedures.• Develop timing plans and review the status of projects against these plans.• For customer driven projects, establish and maintain regular communication with the appropriate customer contact.• Manage the production of samples/prototypes in line with the project timing plan.• Raise orders, as required, for material, tooling and equipment such that programme needs dates can be met.• Document actions and minute meetings.• Identify any process improvement opportunities.• Support Product Management with price list construction and implementation.• Ensure that project reviews are conducted regularly and report to the Senior Programme Manager for weekly NPD reports.• Maintaining records of all projects using Daptiv/ Microsoft Project.The Candidate You will need to be methodical and structured in your approach and used to dealing with projects and their complexities. You will be required to liaise with all internal stakeholders of the project team as well as external suppliers and customers therefore communication is critical.THOMAS Recruitment is committed to assisting you in your job search with YOUR CAREER at Heart. If you are interested in this fantastic opportunity please send your CV immediately

title: Customer Service Expansion Manager
description:
Company description:•Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.•Customer Service and/or Operations related experience and/or experience managing agencies/vendors.•Extensive experience leading project teams to deliver successful cross-functional projects.•Ability to deal with ambiguity, and effectively influence matrix teams, with multiple stakeholders and a combination of internal and external parties, remotely distributed across multiple locations, languages and cultures.•Excellent planning, organizational and time and project management skills.•Demonstrable proficiency of Microsoft Office including Excel and Word.•Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.•Up to 30% of travel required.  •Master’s degree or MBA.•Work experience across multiple geographies and/or managing geographically dispersed teams.•Ability and desire to relocate to take advantage of future growth opportunities.•Fluent in another European language.•Previous experience with Six Sigma, PMI and/or Lean tools and methodologies. Job description:Amazon opened its virtual doors in 1995 and strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online.Amazon Customer Service (CS) is looking for an Expansion Manager for its Customer Advocacy Network (CAN), associates working from home, to lead growth and expansion. The successful candidate will be responsible for assessing the opportunities to support Amazon’s customers from new locations or in new languages, developing a plan to meet this demand. The Expansion Manager will create the business case outlining requirements for each of these solutions, partnering with multiple groups including CS Operations, HR, Finance, Accounting, Tax, Legal, Payroll, etc.; and will then coordinate the entire matrix team till the successful launch of the new language node. The Expansion Manager will also lead two teams for the continuous improvement and growth of CAN’s processes and technology.Location: Luxembourg Required profile:Project Management Responsibilities:•Creating a business case for new launches, deep diving on the alternatives and defining the optimal CS solutions.•Conducting local or remote assessments of the locations, taking into account various factors including tax and legal environment, infrastructure, labor pool, etc.•Facilitating the meetings with perspective suppliers and review strengths and weaknesses of each solution.•Presenting to senior leaders and managing multiple stakeholders in a complex matrix.•Leading the project team, that includes representatives from multiple Amazon departments, and third-party suppliers.•Launching the new CS node, till the hand-over to the operational teams. Develop the strategy to automate and scale the contact routing and workgroup set up to ensure maximum flexibility for the site and the network.People Management Responsibilities:•Lead and manage the teams responsible for CAN’s processes and technology.•Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Amazon's policies and procedures. Additional responsibilities include interviewing, training and motivating employees; planning, assigning and directing work; rewarding and disciplining employees; and effective conflict resolution.•Effectively partner and build productive working relationships with direct reports, peers, leadership, and other departments.•Manage the career growth and development of the team by driving focus on Amazon's Core Values. What we offer:1


Contact: Heather McClory
        

Reference: Totaljobs/19833

Our client is an innovative and pioneering food manufacturer with an impressive track record in producing high quality products which are distributed across a variety of key markets worldwide from a number of sites across the UK.Reporting into the Chairman and Board, our client is looking to recruit a dynamic, forward looking Chief Executive to drive further business growth and achieve their strategic objectives. The role will be responsible for developing their current vision, translating this into tangible actions to better improve performance across the UK in ever changing market conditions. Having responsible for five sites across the UK, the main aim of the interim Chief Executive is to encourage better organisational communication and operating efficiencies throughout those businesses. The successful Chief Executive will be a commercially astute, inspirational leader from with a progressive career as a Chief Executive within food manufacturing. The Chief Executive will have operated at Board level with experience of P&L responsibility,strong transformational expertise, running a complex business preferably with some European exposure. The Chief Executive will have strategic vision, the ability to inspire and motivate a strong Executive team, with a proven track record of delivering sustainable growth during organisational change .

title: Trainee Health and Safety Consultant
description:
Trainee Health and Safety Consultant
	








, 






£20k - 25k per year










Permanent


Posted 19 days ago


























Trainee Health and Safety Consultant - up to £25k + packageI am currently looking for a Trainee Health and Safety Consultant (up to £25k) to join an expanding Health and Safety Consultancy based South of Manchester. The successful candidate will work on a multisite basis, managing their travel, clients and diary autonomously. The organisation are committed to HSE with buy in from all levels within the organisation, especially the board. This is a fantastic opportunity to work for an expanding company with an excellent portfolio of clients throughout the North West of the UK. Reporting into the Operations Director, you will be responsible for visiting multiple sites within 60 miles of Manchester, advising and liaising with clients to drive the health and safety culture forward. With clear opportunities to progress and develop, this opportunity is not one to be missed!The successful Trainee Health and Consultant will:Hold the NEBOSH General Certificate or equivalent (essential)Hold a full UK driving license (essential)Be happy to travel on a multiple site basis (essential)In return the successful candidate will be responsible for:Initially shadowing Directors and learning the company’s process’sBeing a part of the company’s advice line to gain experienceCommunicating with clientsManaging your own diaryManaging a client portfolioConduct audits and risk assessmentsOffering general Health and Safety adviceIn return the successful Trainee Health and Safety Consultant will receive a salary of up to £25,000 (depending on experience), plus a great package. This includes mileage and expenses covered, medical insurance, company bonus scheme, 20 days of annual leave (rises with service) plus 8 days bank holiday, pension and CPD allowances for further studies. This is an urgent requirement and we have immediate interview availability over the coming week. To ensure you don’t miss out on this excellent opportunity, please reply to us today on or email to express your interest.
